Reviewer: Rachel Beam
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Short version - This is an exclusively christian business where anyone not interested in listing to inappropriate, adult christian music is not welcome to play.

We arrived at Funky Frogs for the first time this morning and my toddlers immediately took off and started to play after seeing the toys. I paid and signed a waiver and only then did I notice that christian music was being played over the loud speaker. I asked the employee, Amanda, if it could be changed to something more appropriate for all families‚Äîchildren‚Äôs music, perhaps‚Äîand she said that she didn‚Äôt have control over the station. After a few minutes I became even more uncomfortable so I simply asked for the volume to be turned down. My children and I were the only people in the store so I figured that this wouldn‚Äôt be a problem. Amanda walked towards the back, but did not make any noticeable change to the level of the volume. This was a huge challenge considering I had not only paid, but my kids had already begun playing and I wasn‚Äôt willing to cut their experience short.

We stayed and played and when it was time to leave, I spoke to Amanda to discuss my discomfort and she made it clear that we were not welcome in the space if we weren‚Äôt willing to be subjected to inappropriate christian music in what is advertised as a family space. She offered no apology and told me that had she known that I was that uncomfortable, that she would have offered a refund so that we could leave. Only after advocating for the refund myself was I able to get my money back.

The christian thing to do would have been to  create a welcoming and inclusive environment for all, but it is clear that the owners have limited their business to only those who practice christianity. Steer clear if you prefer that your kids not be exposed to religious indoctrination.

Vanessa and her husband Mark opened up We Rock the Spectrum right off Hendersonville road in the Turtle Creek shopping center in South Asheville!

Our daughters Sydney and Riley went last night for Parents Night Out and they can‚Äôt stop talking about it! The indoor zip line and the trampoline ‚Ä¶ big hits! Also, pizza, popcorn and a üçø movie!

Support their awesome local business if you can! It‚Äôs for all kids! She even has a pre-K prep program led by a certified elementary school teacher with a Montessori philosophy!

Take a virtual tour on We Rock‚Äôs website!

We missed that too because every kid in the buidling jumped in front even if they were not there for the Elsa ball. There was no organization and nobody making sure that the kids signed up for the ball were getting to participate. We asked the "manager" many times to help us understand this chaos but she was clueless. The only thing that we got from this event was a picture with Elsa as she was ready to leave and the kids were starting to clear our. Y'all need to refund that money or get a new event planner because there were some pissed off moms in there.

Reviewer: Anna Moore
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I regularly come here during the week with my almost 2 year old. Today was the first time I came on a Saturday. It. Was. Awful. They take reservations on Saturday and Sunday to keep the crowd at a minimum (or so they say), but this place was a madhouse from the second I stepped in. Because all age groups of children are welcome here, there were teenagers and rambunctious pre-teens everywhere. Some of them were lifting up the panels at the top of the stairs in the playground creating a fall hazard. Others were underneath making barriers where other children couldn't pass. It was also impossible to let my daughter play on the trampoline part because of so many unattended children being wild. It was also difficult to keep up with my daughter because there were so many people standing around. I had told my sister about this place and she was there too with her 7 month old and two older children. I was honestly embarrassed that I had recommended this place. I left quickly because it wasn't worth putting my small child in danger due to overcrowding and unsupervised children. I will continue to come here on weekdays, but if you have any kid under 7 or 8 years of age, do yourself a favor and skip it on the weekends.

Reviewer: Leah Millsap
Rating: 5/5

Review: Visiting over the Christmas/new year holiday with our 5yr old. After 3 straight rainy days, we needed to get out and play. We googled and found Playland. 2hrs of indoor play geared for 1-10yrs olds for $16 is amazing!!! We don‚Äôt have it in ENC.

Highlights:
Clean/safe
Positive/chill atmosphere
Employees circulate and interact as needed with kids. They are positive and happy to see kids playing - not grumpy or bothered or constantly yelling ‚Äúno, don‚Äôt do that‚Äù. This really is a playground for your kid to let loose and enjoy climbing, jumping, falling, running, all the things. Seems like a family run place that really has put a lot of thought into how kids play and enjoy lots of diverse stimuli to interact around them.

My five year old played hard for 2hrs straight!

There‚Äôs padded benches, seats, and cafe tables. Lots of seating to supervise at a distance if your kid is at that stage. It‚Äôs also very normal to get into the space and play with your littles too.

*there is even a smaller play area that is gated for littles to get in if that‚Äôs your pace.

Didn‚Äôt try the cafe yet but many folks had hotdogs, waffles, coffees, grilled sandwiches, and yummy kids snacks. Sitting back with a cold coffee and chilling while kiddos burn their energy is a great business concept!

Only con:
I wish I could‚Äôve brought in our water bottles. Their sign says no outside food/drinks. There is 100% access to water fountains. In hindsight I‚Äôm sure I could‚Äôve asked if water was ok. Check next time.

Reviewer: Brittney Maxwell
Rating: 1/5
Time: a month ago
Review: We visited Play Land, a playground advertised for kids ages 1‚Äì10. My nieces are both 10 years old, they are twins, but we were told they couldn‚Äôt play because they ‚Äúlooked older/they were about to turn 11 in 2 months and there were many younger children playing that day so they weren‚Äôt comfortable letting them play‚Äù The manager claimed the owners had recently changed the policy and that it was listed on the website‚Äîbut after checking thoroughly, there was no such information online or posted anywhere in the facility.

While the manager said she was just doing her job, the situation was frustrating and humiliating. My nieces were made to feel out of place and judged based on appearance alone, despite being within the stated age range. They were eventually allowed to play, but the damage was done‚Äîit was an upsetting experience that no child or family should go through.

Discrimination based on how a child looks rather than their actual age is not acceptable. Clear communication and respectful treatment should be a priority, especially in spaces meant for kids. We have been coming here for months and are truly saddened by our experience today. I understand there was most likely a situation that happened that put smaller children in danger, that the manager/owners started a policy of gaging whether a child was fit to play or not based on there looks, but I am appalled by the treatment we received by this establishment today.

Replying to owners response.

Thank you for your response, but the manager was not going to let my nieces play yesterday until I drove home the fact that they were 10, so I could understand her reasoning.  I told her multiple times they were 10 and she proceeded with what I stated earlier about their size. My response to was regardless of there appearance, they are 10 yrs old and not 11 yet, and she stated if they are close to turning 11 then your policy is that they can‚Äôt play if you feel they would be a threat to younger children. There was no confusion on what transpired. I just continued telling her they were 10 and she said that she can make an exception this one time. I realize when they turn 11 they will no longer be able to play, that was not the issue.

reviews:
{Reviewer: Denise Infante
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I love bringing my two and three-year-old to this cafe. It's a place I frequently visit with my husband or other mommies. The atmosphere is very clean, and I always look forward to their delicious vanilla lattes and waffles! The staff behind the counter consistently greet everyone with smiles and work their tails off to serve us. The location is also low sensory which I appreciate as a former special education advocate.

While the location is a bit cramped, I believe this is partly due to families placing their belongings on the tables, which can limit space, especially for those who are dining. It would be wonderful if patrons could utilize the cubbies provided to help create a more enjoyable dining experience for everyone. Additionally, I think it would be beneficial if parents could take a more active role in supervising their children and encouraging them to return items to their proper places. My daughter loves playing in the kitchen area, but it often seems empty. Parents joining their kids on the slide should bear in mind that they move all the balls when they slide down. My son hit his head on the back of the slide because the balls had been removed from a parent sliding down.

I truly believe that creating a welcoming environment is a shared responsibility within our community. If you‚Äôre visiting, it would be wonderful if you could encourage your little one to practice responsibility. I also wish there were opportunities to explore memberships! Otherwise, great location!

-----------------------

Rating: 3/5

Review: I enjoy bringing my 16 month old baby here during the week when it tends to be slow, however we brought her recently when there were more older kids running around. The kids were super rowdy, chasing one another around and pelting each other with balls both inside and outside of the ball pit (I got hit hard in the side of the head). They kept climbing up the slides and the parents were way more interested in socializing amongst each other than actually parenting their kids. An announcement was made regarding the kids' behavior, but unfortunately none of us could understand what was being said over the loudspeaker and nothing was done by employees OR parents when the behavior continued. We didn't feel it was safe for our baby to keep playing so we left after about an hour, which felt like a waste of money, as we usually stay for the full two hours. We love Playland, but it would be so much better if there were designated areas by age group, or at least if the rules of safe play were actually enforced. Also, after a few times of coming, we've never once seen employees disinfecting the play area, and as another reviewer mentioned, the baby changing table in the women's restroom isn't bolted to the counter, so it slides around if you have a squirmy baby. We'll still keep coming here, but I was disappointed by our most recent visit.

Review: We are so happy this place opened! The girls that work there are so kind and helpful. I LOVE that they check your sticker against your child's sticker on the way out and when I lost my sticker, the young woman working at the desk was asking my son "is this your mommy?" lol super cute and you can never be too safe! One day we were there and the side door alarm went off. I was happy no child escaped and that the alarm actually did its job. Kids can roam free without fear of losing them as you can walk around the playland; there are only a couple of small places where you may not be able to visualize them, but an adult can definitely get to those places if need be. There were the occasional kids that were on the more rambunctious side but the parents (so far) seem to do a great job of reeling them in. The bathrooms were clean and the snacks and coffee were fresh. Yeah the cafe is a little pricey but that is the price you pay to give yourself a little enjoyment while you watch your kids have a great time or get some work done on your laptop. This place would be best for walkers through about 5/6 year-olds. Lots of little toys/walkers/cars for toddlers, a sectioned off play room, and sensory board. I did see a couple kids eat-it on the slide but that is just what happens when they want to walk down the slide and not sit lol. Everything is padded and kids were still taking nose-dives/face-planting and did not seem physically harmed. It gets pretty busy and seating can be limited but otherwise we will keep coming back until he outgrows it.

She had a fever for six days in a row and we‚Äôre now on week two of being sick. I cannot stress enough as a parent please please do not take your children to these types of places if they‚Äôre sick. Again this is not anything against Playland we‚Äôd happily return but a psa to the parents because what we went through was really miserable! Keep your sick kids at home please.

Reviewer: Tori Scott
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 days ago
Review: This is a hidden gem! I have been wanting to come here with my two children, who have ADHD & different levels of Autism, my son, who is 11, and my daughter, who just turned 6, since they opened. We never had a chance to visit until yesterday (Saturday, June 28, 2025) when we were invited with some friends who are members. My oldest had a blast with the arcade games, the climbing areas, and just being indoors in general in a safe environment to help escape this heat. The facility is card only, which was no issue for us, thankfully. The machine to dispense the game card even took tap to pay, so my son was able to use some Apple Cash he had to load a new game card.

Francine was very helpful when checking in with explaining the waiver, the process since it was our first time, and swatting any of those pesky flies that snuck through the door. They didn't get far because Francine was on it in the lobby, swatting left and right, taking out those summer nuances. Liz with the killer nails (can't wait to see what design she has on our next visit) helped when we needed to check out from the snack bar, which I was very impressed with the selections that are offered. She is very personable and a great asset to the front desk. Kyrsten knew exactly what I needed on this 100 degree day when I ordered a fountain Sundrop because she came in clutch, offering extra ice! I was like, Yessssss please! I was praising the facility already, and they told me where to leave the review, so here I am!

Plum Krazy Play is now a staple in our neurodivergent family! Not only because it is a safe place I can let my children play inside with added sensory play when needed, I can get a fountain Sundrop, AND I can get some adult interactions in.... I say sign me up! We are discussing membership as a family and looking at all the calendar events, including Sensory Wednesday, which is probably going to be the first time I bring my daughter. Reviewer: L J
Rating: 4/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: Our 3 year old loved Angel Island Fun Park. We went on a Friday afternoon. Not crowded at all. They have several reasonable payment options and a waiver you sign via scanning a bar code or doing it online. We opted for the $20 one-time visit (there's a 59 monthly option or a $72 punch card option plus more options). The $20 one-time play option was good for 3hrs of play! üòé We also purchased $3 non slip socks, so bring your own and save some cash. They also offer snacks and drinks for purchase (didn't see any hot food options), or I think you can bring your own snack and sit at the tables, check with the store. We did see children with their own water bottles in the sitting area.  I know they told us no food or beverages in the play area. They have a cubby for shoes. Free "community" flip flops for bathroom use (must remove your shoes for bathroom use) Im guessing you can bring your own disposable foot coverings if you're uncomfortable using the public flops, ask the store. The restroom was clean and so was the play area - soft padding for little ones. Our 3 year old navigated the play area on his own, under our watchful eyes. Parents can sit at the little tables outside the play area with a full view. The play area is also fenced with open entrances so you can stand and watch your kiddos. There's also two pay-as-you-go massage chairs in the sitting area against the wall - you can relax while getting a massage. If I recall correctly, the cost was about $5 per 10-15 minutes. I believe their website states this play place iso ages 8 and under. Parking was ok but the place is in a small plaza and if they get super busy it looks like parking could be an issue. We enjoyed our time and will be back soon. We recommend!

I loved there was plenty to do for my girls but it wasn‚Äôt too big that I was having to run around everywhere looking for them. There‚Äôs also a vending machine that has drinks and snacks. Reviewer: Karen Piquet Ferreira
Rating: 3/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: It‚Äôs a nice place, albeit a little small. I have a 2 1/2 year old and thought the place would be better suited for younger kids. There‚Äôs only one slide, and as expected, some parents are not keeping an eye on their kids, leading to kids climbing up the slide while 3 others are going down. The lack of supervision is not the fault of Unwind, but I do think they should have someone monitoring, instead of having 4 employees hanging out behind the coffee bar. There weren‚Äôt enough balls in the ball-pit/slide area.

Also, you HAVE to buy their socks. We went the Monday after their grand opening and nowhere was it listed that you had to buy their socks. On the way out, they do have a box where you can choose to donate your $4 socks so they can wash and resell. I kept mine. Check-in took forever, but it was only their second day of being open, so I hope they find a better and more efficient way of getting people in quickly.

FYI - they don‚Äôt have iced coffee.

UPDATE - so I wanted to give this place another chance. I went to their online site to book a ticket and was absolutely shocked on their new prices. $24.99 for TWO HOURS OF PLAY? I went six months ago and paid $16 for TWO HOURS. That is a $9 increase in six months. That‚Äôs a 56% increase in price. I was completely floored and astounded on how crazy expensive it got. Did they add new activities? Are they giving away stuff for free at the door? In 6 months, I don‚Äôt know what justifies that. They have outpriced themselves out of the indoor playground market.

Review: Edited: Such a salty response from the business owner. I am not a fake account, only a customer and a mom who is looking for a nice experience for my children, as well as support a woman-owned business. But the owner's reply leaves much to be desired. I am a loyal customer with Playland because they run their business well, are kind and welcoming to all customers, and make sure their equipment and play areas are clean and safe. By the way, I was not solicited or asked by Playland to mention their name or wrote a review. They are an honest business and wouldn‚Äôt engage in this weird and combative behavior.

So sorry that the owner cannot be a professional and apologize for the poor treatment I experienced‚Ä¶
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-
While my kids enjoyed their play experience, I think charging $12.99 per child for one hour is very expensive, and there were no discounts for siblings.  Also, I felt their equipment was not as sturdy, especially in the baby/24 month area where the climbing thing was loose.

I ordered some items from their cafe, and they forgot to charge me for the water. While I was feeding my 2 year old, I was not aware that my hot chocolate was ready. An employee came to me and brought a credit card reader and said ‚Äúwe forgot to charge you for the water, please pay.‚Äù I was shocked because I was frazzled as I was feeding my toddler while trying to watch my other kids. They said I had to go to the counter to pay. I told them I had to feed my kid, and they offered to watch her so I can pay. I didn‚Äôt feel comfortable so I had to drag my child all the way to the register - this experience left a bad taste in my mouth. It felt like they wanted to nickel and dime me when it‚Äôs THEIR fault. Not coming back again, I am sticking to Playland in Monroe.

Reviewer: Julie Moreland
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 years ago
Review: We had out kids' 3rd birthday party here. Things were easy and everyone had a blast! We brought cakes and light snacks. We had Little Doodles decorate and provide eating-ware for a Paw Patrol themed party.

Staff was very helpful in transitioning between playtime, crafts, cake, and presents. During the party, the Cafe was open for purchase and the coffee beverages were quite good (it's not a full cafe setup, but equally yummy).

There is a large area for tables for parents to sit and a play area along the wall. The play area has a bouncy horse, shopping cart, ice cream vendor, food truck, giant blocks, tent/rock wall, pirate ship, dress up clothes and more!

Highly recommend for both play and party. All the parents commented about how great the setup was. Kids were corralled and it was air conditioned in summer (hello!).

Parking was easy as well. Everything was well-orchestrated!

Reviewer: Kelsey Farver
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: We had a great experience at Little Doodles! I took two of my kids (ages 2 and 5) last week and they didn't want to leave. It was our first time at a play cafe like this, but the experience had us all wanting to go back more often!
The pros of this spot for me:
- The seating area - I had a clear view from my table of basically all of the play spaces so when my 2 year old was wandering around, I could be at my table but still have eyes on her.
- The selection of toys and activities. Between the play sets, the art center, and the discovery room - both of my kids were occupied for the 3+ hours we spent there, and we honestly could've spent many more.
- The ability to come and go, and stay as long as we wanted. The biggest perk of Little Doodles to me is that our day pass covered the whole day! We got there 20 minutes after they opened, left to run to a store about 2 hours in, and then came back for another hour before we had to head to school pick up. That flexibility is huge for me as we drove an hour from the Lillington area to visit this location.

We ate lunch here and the food was okay. It is standard cafeteria-esque food you'd expect from a small cafe and fit our needs, but I wouldn't come here just for the food or coffee. It is the safe, fun atmosphere for the kids while the parent/caretaker can work or just hang out that you really come for - and they do that exceptionally well! We will return! I wish we lived closer because I would have bought the year membership on the spot and we'd be there several days a week! Living an hour away, I haven't decided how often we'll be able to make it up that way to commit to a membership just yet.

Review: It really saddens me to write this review, as once upon a time I would have easily written a 5 star review. I have been bringing my 4.5 year old daughter to Over The Moon since she was 1. Before she started preschool we used to come several times a week, we loved it that much! Unfortunately I think we have visited for the last time. The concept, decor, and toys at OTM are so cool and so much fun! Unfortunately, the decline in overall experience since we first started coming here has been SHARP in just about every way. When we first started coming there was a wonderful and caring group of staff members, and the same can not be said about the current group. The last several times we have come the staff have spent more time talking to each other than doing any kind of supervision of the play area. The last time we were there there was only one staff member working, and she NEVER looked back into the play area once. We used to see staff members occasionally go through and pick up toys, reset the obstacle course, etc. and we certainly have not seen that lately. While I‚Äôm always happy to see a local business succeed, the crowd level has been out of control lately, and it can be very overwhelming. Unfortunately, the bigger issue is that many parents don‚Äôt supervise their children adequately. Today a small child (who was in the calm toddler area, no less) whose parent was across the room threw a large toy rocket right at my daughter. Fortunately, it hit her in the back, not the head, but when the child‚Äôs parent was finally located they shrugged it off and continued to let the child run around unsupervised. The staff also didn‚Äôt seem to care about this incident or the lack of supervision which narrowly missed causing a serious injury. Unfortunately, that was the last straw for me. I truly hope the OTM experience can go back to the way it used to be, but until that happens, we sadly won‚Äôt be back.

-----------------------

Reviewer: R H
Rating: 5/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: I wish I could give 10/10 stars!  This place is so thoughtfully designed for parents of young children- infant through elementary school aged.

The space is relatively large, very safe, and even has an infant area. The hours are broader than a lot of competitors and better priced. You can also buy memberships or multiple passes at a time at a discount.

The dining area is spacious while still allowing a great view of the play area. This space provides free specialty coffees (from a machine) and free WiFi!  They also have a fridge of snacks for purchase.

They offer free socks to borrow instead of only for purchase like most other places. You can use the space for free play or birthday parties. They have separate rooms for the food/cake during the party. We attended a birthday there and they did a great job hosting.

They also do an excellent job cleaning the facility throughout the day.  The staff is friendly and professional. I‚Äôm probably missing other great features I‚Äôll think of later.

I‚Äôve been to all the indoor play areas around here and this blows all others out of the water!  I hope they consider opening more locations around the Triangle.

Reviewer: L J
Rating: 4/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: Searched Google for 'indoor play'' and Over The Moon came up as one of the options. We checked in via a bar code or tablet. And paid the same way - $14 got us an hour and a half of play. Our 3 year old had a blast moving from obstacle to obstacle, climbing, and making friends. I would recommend adding a moon bounce or soft thick obstacles for small children to climb - our son needed help a couple of times, and a vending massage chair or something for parents. There was plenty of open space and room to play. Clean place and they offer a sink at the entrance for hand washing, cubbies for shoes, and coat hangers. No shoes or bare feet allowed in the play area, but they do offer socks for the little ones to borrow, if you forget theirs.  Very nice hosts who are friendly to the children and explain the rules. This location also offered free coffee, tables for snacks or sitting while you watch your little ones play (ok to bring your own snacks or kid water bottles), party rooms, etc. Not a lot of seats in the play area for parents but the floors against the walls are cushioned so you can sit and watch or do your own stretching ;). They also have a section for babies/toddlers and a fish tank in the corner.

Review: My friend and I visited each with 3 kids 4 and younger. It was great that they have a sibling discount, because with multiples, stuff can add up quickly. We walked in to a clean play space that was covered in toys the kids enjoyed playing with by the end of our 2 hour session. When we were leaving, the worker was cleaning and organizing for the next group to come in and do it all over again. They have a really nice coffee machine which I really appreciated, the coffee was delicious! Tables and a couch for parents and 2 highchairs for the babies. The bathroom and exit doors have a sound bell to prevent kids from escaping. The bathroom is stocked with baby wipes, poop bags, hair ties and even tampons. Our play time was full so there were a decent amount of kids and parents in the building but it didn't feel over crowded and didn't prevent the kids from playing with anything they wanted to play with. The blue "Elsa" dress was a big hit as well as the fireman hose. The only improvement I could suggest is having one more small couch for parents to sit on and I think it would be perfect! This was a fun place for the kids to let out some energy especially with all the rain we have been having lately. Will definitely recommend to other families!

Reviewer: Alyssa Robles
Rating: 3/5
Time: a week ago
Review: I used to work here back during the 1st two years of it being open. It‚Äôs so cool to see all the new stuff they‚Äôve added but it‚Äôs a shame that the customer service has plummeted to a zero. I remember customer service used to be a top priority here. The teenagers working look like they‚Äôre being forced to work here and like it‚Äôs such a burden. One girl was asleep at the jumping zone where the air bag is. Smh there was multiple kids jumping at the same time, adults jumping with more than one child in their arms. There was no kind of safety being implemented. The other employees in the area would just point to her and laugh, they didn‚Äôt even bother to wake her up. 30 minutes of this went by before a manager was called over. Which leads me to my next point. The managers had no sense of customer service either. Would walk right  by you and make eye contact and not even smile or say hi. At one point a manger walked into the jump zone where the girl was sleeping and didn‚Äôt even say anything to her. When I worked here years ago, food that was ordered was brought to the customers wherever they were in the facility. I ordered food and after 20 minutes still had not received it, I went to the cafe and there my food was sitting under the warmer. I wish they would‚Äôve told me I had to come get my food. I mean what‚Äôs the point of giving me a stand with a number if I‚Äôve got to come get it myself? Maybe give me a time frame too! All in all my kids had a great time but as the adult who‚Äôs spending $40+ in just 2 hours, I lol at these things and they matter to me.

Reviewer: Brian Fulcher
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: Very negative experience.  Paid for a "package" with an "add on extra attraction 1 time use". The rides included in the package which had a countdown of 2 hours to use did not have operators at the attractions which meant even though they were advertised as part of the package, could not be used during periods of my 2 hour package. Several instances not due to my actions resulted in delayed operation times on rides which in turn ate into my kids 2 hour usage time. After all of the negative experiences went to use my add on attraction only to be told my time had ran out. Attendant called the supervisor over after I complained and he told them to let us use it anyway since we had paid for it, only to have an entire birthday  party pass us waiting for the manager to arrive which in turn would've meant waiting for 25 kids to get on the ropes course before my kid would have even though he was ahead of them in line. Would've took hour to hour and half just to ride one attraction.  Told manager we wanted a refund and he was an all out confrontational dick who refused to give me a 9.00 refund which in turn probably costed the establishment more than 9.00 in the long run. Hope someone in management learns a lesson from this.

Reviewer: David Cohen
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We LOVE We Rock the Spectrum - Cary! My four year old autistic son and six year old son with ADHD did their day camp for the last two weeks and have also been going to their weekend parties. They really liked it! This place has been truly a breath of fresh air - a place that is designed to accommodate my kids, releasing me from the usual worries that go with private drop-off programs like whether they will be patient and flexible with my kids and whether I'll get a call asking me to pick them up early because of "bad behavior" (which has usually been code for the camp having failed to provide adequate support). The place has amazing gym equipment to give my kids the proprioceptive and vestibular input (aka joy!!) they need. There's also an arts/crafts activity as part of each camp day. Critically, while the kids are given a schedule of activities (gym time, arts/crafts, lunch) and encouraged to follow it, there is plenty of flexibility if, for example, my kid really wants to just do gym equipment for the day. They can allow this because of the extremely high counselor-to-camper ratio.

An example of how this place made my life and my kids' life easier: one morning my boys decided at the last minute that they wanted to wear their superhero costumes to camp. I was able to give them a quick and easy "sure, why not?" And that was that. I wasn't worried that some adult or kid at the camp would hassle them or me over it.

They also have parties periodically. My kids have done those as well, and really liked them!

They also have various other things like birthday parties and parents night out (aka you can drop your kids there while you go on a date).

I personally dropped the kids there every day and observed the vibe. It's a happy place. Music softly playing while kids swing, spin, jump and play.

Did my kids need to be redirected sometimes (e.g. reminded of certain necessary rules like waiting for their turn for the zip line, or staying off the zipline runway for safety)? Yes! Did I feel this was always handled with kindness and understanding? Also yes! And that's the key. Jes, who runs it, is herself a parent of a neurodivergent kid, and I felt she really got it.

The camp is 9am to 1pm. The way that works is that 9am is the earliest you're allowed to arrive, and it's no problem if you show up late. It's not like there's some rigid group circle time activity at 9am that you'll get hassled for interrupting. When life happened, we sometimes showed up at 9:30 or 10 and it was fine. You need to come get your kids by 1pm, i.e. that's when they stop providing camp counselor staffing, but if your kid wants to continue there past 1pm you can pay for Open Play for the afternoon while you hang out there.

For those who, like us, live far enough away that it's not realistic to do two round trips for drop off and pickup, there are a couple options that worked well. One option, which we ended up doing almost every day, is that we had a sitter pick the kids up at 1pm and take them to a playground or play space for the afternoon (e.g., Downtown Cary Park, Pleasant Park in Apex, Over the Moon, Marbles Museum). I understand that's not an option for everyone. Another option is that sometimes I'd stay in the Cary/Morrisville area for the morning, filling the time on my laptop at a cafe or walking one of the nearby trails. There's also a lot of shopping nearby (e.g. Trader Joe's, Target, Michaels, Home Goods).

I'm posting this because I think this place is really valuable and serves a huge need in the Triangle area for neurodivergent kids, so I want others to be aware of this resource. I also want it to succeed so that it will continue to be there for my own kids! The business just opened and I can tell they are still evaluating whether they can make it work. The more people who go, the better their chances will be! I'm hopeful that they will eventually also open a location over here where we live in Chapel Hill.

Reviewer: Emily Steinhoff
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We had our son‚Äôs birthday party at We Rock the Spectrum and it was AMAZING! It was definitely the BEST venue we have ever chosen! We were able to rent the entire space, so it was just our family and friends, which was so nice. It kept the noise (and germ) levels down and everyone had an AMAZING experience! The kids had an absolute BLAST and the parents did too! When I arrived, Jessica (one of the founders) and her team of employees immediately jumped in to help me decorate the party room!!! They untangled balloons (it was windy), put together my cupcake stand, hung our backdrop & other decorations, put tablecloths on the tables, and helped me figure out which tables would work best for gifts, desserts, food, and seating. They put little monster trucks on cupcakes and the cupcakes on the stand. They even took photos of the party room for me once it was decorated. They help supervise the kids and keep them safe (especially on the zip line, rock wall, and giant trampoline), which allows parents to relax a bit instead of having to be on high alert nonstop.

The entire facility was SPOTLESS (it always is). When I walked in, there was employees all over the place spraying and wiping down counters, equipment, toys, etc. I am an RN. So, I tend to be hyper aware of germs and the importance of proper cleaning between parties is huge for me.

Jessica was absolutely WONDERFUL! She asked what kind of music we preferred and what volume level. She (and the rest of her staff) were super friendly and show genuine concern for kids with sensory issues and they also understand that all kids can get overwhelmed due to sensory overload! That is why they have a calming room with sensory friendly lighting, noise canceling head phones, quiet activities, and comfy pillows to sit and relax on. It is so nice for kids (and parents) who need to take breaks from the noise! I cannot say enough good things about We Rock the Spectrum! I take my son and my niece frequently to play and have introduced lots of our friends too. I highly recommend them anytimew, and for birthday parties (both the experience and the value for such an affordable price) they reign supreme!

Reviewer: Jessica wangqin
Rating: 5/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: I compared 5 or 6 indoor play centers in the North Carolina area and finally chose TOWN OF FUN. I‚Äôm really happy I selected this place for my 4-year-old son‚Äôs birthday party.

The environment here is great and very clean. Since it‚Äôs a newly opened play center, all the toys are brand new. The indoor space is large, and even with nearly 40 guests, the room didn‚Äôt feel crowded at all. Both adults and children had separate areas to relax and play.
The staff was incredibly responsible and attentive. I‚Äôm especially grateful to Valeria, who coordinated with me via email during the planning phase. I shared my preferences regarding the party‚Äôs timing and decorations, and she arranged everything perfectly. She even reminded me of details I hadn‚Äôt thought of, like background music and setup times, and helped me plan accordingly. On the morning of the party, 4 or 5 staff members helped us set up the room quickly. They worked fast and had all the necessary equipment, so we finished decorating in less than an hour, leaving me plenty of time to prepare for other things.
During the entire birthday party, the staff cooperated with all our plans. They helped organize games for the kids, served food, greeted guests, and sorted the presents. We invited 17 families, so there was a lot to handle, but with their assistance, everything went smoothly. I am so thankful for that.
I also noticed how seriously Town of Fun takes hygiene. After the guests left, I saw the staff immediately begin cleaning the room and toys, even skipping lunch. They thoroughly cleaned the ball pit with a vacuum and paid great attention to detail. I believe this is especially beneficial for young children, as their immune systems aren‚Äôt fully developed, making them more susceptible to germs in indoor play areas. Their focus on cleanliness helps protect the kids.
It‚Äôs very fun! Children aged 1 to 10 can all have a great time here ‚Äì it‚Äôs definitely a paradise for kids.
I‚Äôm so glad my son had an unforgettable birthday party here.

Review: We recently celebrated our son Zayn‚Äôs 3rd birthday at Piney Town Play Space, and it was truly a five-star experience from start to finish!

The theme was George from Peppa Pig, and Courtney along with the amazing staff absolutely delivered. Every detail was thoughtful, colorful, and perfect for the occasion. The kids had a blast, and the entire event was so well-organized that we could actually relax and enjoy it.

We initially had some concerns because we invited a big group of friends, and we were worried the space might be too small or that we‚Äôd somehow be over capacity ‚Äî but the space was HUGE! It was more than enough for everyone to play, mingle, and celebrate comfortably. Courtney, the owner, even called me personally before the party to check in, reassure me, and make sure we were confident in moving forward ‚Äî that level of personal care really meant a lot.

We chose the Pandarosa package, which included 48 cupcakes, sweet tea, lemonade, chicken trays for the adults (so delicious!), and 7 large pizzas for the kids. There was plenty of food and even some left over ‚Äî they really thought of everything.

Special shoutout to Ede, Railey, and Madison who were absolutely wonderful ‚Äî so helpful, kind, and attentive throughout the entire party. Their energy made the day even more special.

Overall, Piney Town made Zayn‚Äôs 3rd birthday unforgettable. Everything was smooth, stress-free, and full of joy. We can‚Äôt thank Courtney and her team enough, and we highly recommend Piney Town Play Space to anyone looking for the perfect place¬†to¬†celebrate!

Reviewer: Stephanie Gillespie
Rating: 5/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: EDITED 2/9/24: I said I would never come back here but I have eaten my words and have changed my review from 1-star to 5-stars. The new owners are amazing and have really turned this place around. They have restructured the play area, now offer snacks and coffee, and provide more supervision during play time. They even offer events each month and have extended their hours to include afternoon play times! Piney Town has gone from being the worst indoor play place around to the best, by far.

I never thought I would be writing this review or have a membership (because we are there at least once per week), but here we are.
_______________________________________________________________
THIS REVIEW WAS FOR THE PLAYHOUSE MUSEUM...BEFORE THEY CHANGED OWNERSHIP.
My issue is not really with the Playhouse itself but more the culture there. We have been 3 times and the facility itself is great and the staff are always super friendly but, some parents don‚Äôt watch their kids AT ALL.

Every time we have been there has been an issue with at least one kid pushing or shoving or taking toys from other kids (just being kids), but there is no redirection or even acknowledgement from the parent.

Until today, I just chalked it up to differences in parenting and it wasn‚Äôt a deal-breaker for me. As a stay-at-home mom, I totally understand needing a break and wanting to let your kids figure things out socially for themselves. However, today, my child was playing on the fire truck and sitting in the driver seat, when a child literally picked him up out of the seat and threw him out of the truck. I removed the child from the and out my very upset toddler back into the driver seat. I told the kid that he could play there when my kid was done.

The mother didn‚Äôt come over until much later and didn‚Äôt even ask me what happened. Instead she asked me ‚Äúdid you just put your hands on my child?‚Äù and didn‚Äôt even apologize when I told her what happened.

Again, I know this is not really the fault of The Playhouse Museum, but all the same, I don‚Äôt think this place is for us and we will not be returning.

Reviewer: Soula Sanderford
Rating: 2/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: The Bumble Brews owner, whom I've corresponded with via email, and staff, whom we interacted with in person, were all very friendly. The actual inside of the establishment was very bright and clean. The coffee was not good in flavor unfortunately; the specialty coffees, including the dairy free options, tasted like plain unsweetened coffee, which was a disappointment. But there are 2 reasons my son will not be returning to play at Bumble Brews.
First, the toys, on average, were more about imaginative play, such as playing kitchen/chef, rather than STEM play. Our 1.5 year old son was bored well before the 90 minute mark because none of the toys required critical thinking or a challenge. The obstacle/jungle gym equipment were impractical to use because of the mandatory sock policy. I completely understand the reasoning behind requiring socks to maintain cleanliness, but the children have no traction on wooden gym equipment, which becomes hazardous. My son recognized how slippery the wooden gym equipment was and wouldn't scale them. Perhaps adding adhesive traction grips to help with traction would be beneficial?
And my second reason‚Ä¶there was an older child (maybe 7?) who appeared to belong to one of the staff working the cafe as they engaged on a familiar level. To put it plainly, she was a bully to my son and many of the other children trying to play. She had no parent shadowing her and when speaking to other parents who frequent Bumble Brews during our visit, we were informed that she is there often and her unpleasant behavior is the norm. I have issue with this if she truly is the child to one of the staff as it made it difficult for my husband and I to relax and allow our child to roam without concern. This child frequently tried to take toys from other children, including my son, and boss them around in an inappropriate tone. If her parent was shadowing her and trying to correct the behavior, I wouldn't have an issue, but without a parent shadowing her, we worried circumstances could escalate, making it challenging to mediate as I am not her parent and do not want to overstep. So instead, my husband and I had to continuously redirect our son away from wherever this child was playing.
For these 2 reasons, our experience was just okay. It is a 30 minute drive to reach this indoor children's play place and the good we experienced in our visit does not justify the drive.

Reviewer: Victoria Romberg
Rating: 5/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: I cannot speak highly enough about Jason and the incredible experience my children have had at We Rock The Spectrum in Kernersville. It is evident that Jason is a compassionate and truly caring individual who prioritizes the happiness and well-being of every child that enters the facility.

One aspect that immediately impressed me is the cleanliness of the place. The facility is always immaculate, and it's clear that great care is taken to maintain a safe and hygienic environment. The bathrooms are consistently clean, which is a big plus for parents like myself who value cleanliness and hygiene.

I particularly appreciate the mandatory sock policy at We Rock The Spectrum. It not only promotes sanitation but also ensures the safety of the children. By requiring socks, the facility minimizes the risk of slips and falls, creating a secure environment for kids to play and explore.

We Rock The Spectrum in Kernersville is undoubtedly the perfect place for children to release their energy in a safe and controlled environment. Jason's commitment to providing a space for kids to have fun and get their wiggles out is truly commendable. His dedication to ensuring the happiness and well-being of every child is evident in the positive atmosphere and joyful experiences we've always had.

If you're a parent searching for a place where your kids can play safely and have a blast, I highly recommend We Rock The Spectrum in Kernersville. Jason's compassion, cleanliness standards, and emphasis on creating a fun and secure environment make it an exceptional choice. Your children will have a fantastic time while you enjoy peace of mind knowing they're in the best hands.

Review: We loved our time here today!  There's a gated little area for smaller kids which was perfect for my 10 month old but he also loved exploring the calming room and the swing area too.  So many fun toys like vacuums and kitchen, laundry, pizza oven, etc.  My son loved the toy cupcakes!  Fun zip line for kids that are a bit older, plenty to climb in and on and a nice enclosed trampoline as well.  Love that they offer something for everyone, whether on the spectrum or not. Reviewer: S Gieseking
Rating: 5/5
Time: Edited 2 years ago
Review: There are so many fun things to do here for children of all ages and abilities. My 7-year-old and 2 yr old had an absolute blast! They have a zip line that both of my kids absolutely loved! There is even a little play pizza kitchen, dolls, washer/dryer, and whole little house area set up! There is a calming area that is in a private room, away from all of the busier toys, that is perfect for children who need a quieter and calming space. This was the perfect place for a birthday party! There is a party room you can decorate and bring your own cake and food. You get to come 15 minutes before the party starts to set up. Socks are required for all, no shoes or bare feet, but you can wear your own, or you can buy a pair for $2.
It's most definitely worth the drive from Winston or Greensboro for such an amazing indoor space that is sure to be a fun filled day for all children!

Review: Words cannot express how much we love and appreciate We Rock The Spectrum Triad. Jenny and Jay are outstanding individuals who are changing lives in this community. Swings, a zip-line, trampoline, crash pads, calm room,  toddler area-- it's perfect! My 12 month old also loves the toddler area!  We had a birthday party here and all of the kids said it was the "best party ever!". We're also in Summer Camp and it has been such a positive experience. {Reviewer: Yudany M
Rating: 1/5
Time: 17 hours ago
Review: I‚Äôve worked in some dirty places before, but nothing compares to Just Play. After visiting Playland, it‚Äôs clear what a clean,  safe kids‚Äô space is supposed to look like.

I worked at Just Play for about a year, and I would not recommend it ‚Äî especially to parents. The toddler area in particular is filthy. There‚Äôs dust built up under the benches ‚Äî right where babies crawl and play. Snacks like Goldfish or Cheerios are always left on the ground, which is a choking hazard and completely unsanitary. Inside and under the main play structure, there are piles, PILES of dust that have clearly been there for months, if not longer.

All of this is expected to be cleaned by the staff, who are paid just $12 to $15 an hour and mostly under 18. The owner, Beth, refuses to hire professional cleaners and instead gives us cheap, ineffective cleaning tools to do the work ourselves. No matter how hard we tried, it was never enough to please her. The owner is out of touch and inconsiderate. She treated us like we were disposable and expected us to clean up years of built-up filth like it was just part of our job ‚Äî I realized that work shouldn‚Äôt be this dreading as a 18 year-old and left.

If you‚Äôre a parent reading this, I highly recommend going to Playland instead. It‚Äôs spotless, smells clean, and everything is bright white ‚Äî so you can see the difference. Your child deserves better, and so does the staff expected to care for them. Give your money to businesses that deserve it.

Reviewer: James Haston
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: We (me and my 2 year old daughter) had a great time here on a Sunday afternoon, it was a little crowded, and hectic. But what do you expect in a room full of kids. You just have to stay close by to your child. Or at least I did because anything can happen. They had food, drinks, & snacks (bags of chips, pizza, chicken nuggets, pretzels, soda, & candy). It was a great time for us. My 2 year old had an absolute blast. And I loved that there was a section for my toddler to play in and not get trampled by all the other sugar rushed youngins. Everything seems well maintained & clean for the most part. The employees were nice and had smiles on their faces. Clean bathrooms and padded floors. Good prices & monthly memberships. This is not a place for the parent to come relax. This is a place for the children to come have fun. And that's exactly what happened. If your a parent and care about your child. You need to be with them and watch them to keep them safe. Its not the staffs job to watch your child for you. It's the parents job. I've seen other posts about this place where a child was hurting another child, or pushed them or something. (Kids will be kids)  That's why you need to be with your child at all times! And the fault lies not with the venue, but with the parent of the mean child. If this occurs. I won't be dealing with the venue. I'll be dealing with that child and their parents myself. That's what anyone should do in that situation. With that being said. It would be cool to have attentive staff. But I understand places get crowded. And there might not be enough staff available. Long story short. We had fun. And we will return whenever we have the time. üòÅ

Rating: 1/5

Review: I regret to share that my experience hosting a birthday party for my child at the play area was less than satisfactory. The party attendant appeared to be inexperienced and struggled with basic responsibilities:

1. I was informed I need to purchase a $5 pitcher of water, despite the package including two pitchers.

2. After clarifying, the attendant brought the water but forgot cups, plates, and utensils. I had to request these separately, specifying quantities.

3. Unfortunately, I found myself unexpectedly managing party supplies instead of enjoying the celebration, contrary to our expectations that the attendant would handle such tasks.

4. When it came time to serve pizza, the attendant simply left plates and pizza boxes without offering assistance. When I inquired about serving hungry kids, her response suggested surprise at my request.

5. There was no help in setting up the table for cake cutting, and I ended up serving the cake without assistance. (There is no private room . It is just a private open spot , which is okay)

6. The attendant was often at the counter helping other customers rather than focusing on our party needs.

7. Despite requesting a party attendant, I was met with confusion. The attendant insisted she was there to help, but her actions suggested otherwise.

8. The pizza size was inadequate for five kids, leaving everyone unsatisfied.

Despite these challenges, the saving grace was the manager's responsiveness. She patiently listened to my feedback during checkout and offered compensations such as 2-hour free play coupons and a discount on additional pizza. While the manager's actions were commendable, the overall experience fell short of expectations.

Reviewer: Oluchi ‚ÄúLady O‚Äù Thomas
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I recently celebrated my daughter's 3rd birthday at Just Play and it was by far the worst experience I've ever had with a party venue (which I guess isn't saying that much since she is only 3 lol but hear me out...)

I was assigned a party planner but then another young man insisted that he wanted to be the host - since he was so anxious I agreed. Turns out he was very inexperienced - long story short the pizzas were brought out too early (some of my guests hadn't even arrived yet) I had to fight for a fresh order so the kids wouldn't be eating cold food. I had to fight for extra plates, forks and napkins and when they finally did arrive they didn't even match my color scheme. I had to ask several times for them to make an announcement for my guests to come to the area for the party, I had to literally go to Big Lots next door to purchase my own hand sanitizer (which delayed everyone eating). I had to serve the pizza myself - using forks because they couldn't be bothered to assist. And to make matters worst my "party host" couldn't find a lighter. He said I had to get everyone on my own to sing happy birthday and cut the cake and I had to ask all of the dads if they had matches. My sweet baby loves to pretend and "blow out" candles but it almost didn't happen. Luckily my original planner was able to find a lighter for me.

The point of having a party at a venue like this is so that the parents could relax - I couldn't do that. I had my own plates, had to buy my own hand sanitizer, had to serve the food and beg someone for a lighter. For all of that I could just have a party at home. Will never host a party here again. My friends were the ones helping me clean up at the end!

The manager tried to make things right (charged for a party of 10 instead of 15) so I appreciate her effort but I am still so upset by how much I had to work for as much as I paid to have my "party host" do his job.

Review: This place is HORRIBLE!!! Don't get trapped in the monthly subscription. If you try to take your child to play on the weekend (when most parents get the chance because they work during the week) 9 times out of 10 when you get there and walk in and your child sees all the other children playing they will tell you that you and your child CANT come in because they are filled to capacity and they have also have birthday parties scheduled ALL DAY so there's not going to be any time available for your child to come play. When you ask to cancel your subscription because the last 4 times you've tried to come you've been turned away they will tell you that there's a 1-800 number you have to call to cancel your subscription and they conveniently DO NOT have that number for you EVER!!! So I go online to see if I can find the number and all I can find is something telling me I can cancel my subscription if I pay for the following 2 months right now but that's it there's no option to do that and there's definitely not a phone number anywhere to cancel anything. If you have the convenience of going during the early day on a week day you might enjoy this place and be lucky enough to actually go INSIDE and play but if your free time is on the weekends then don't bother. Save your time and money.

Reviewer: Jenna Trump
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Always an absolute blast! This play place is mostly geared toward the younger set. Probably under age 10 but it depends on how much your kid enjoys imaginary play. My four and six year olds absolutely adore it. The play areas change around periodically but there‚Äôs usually a vet center, play kitchen/grocery store, a magic spell booth, puppet show, and a few small games (skee ball, fooseball, basketball) in the back plus a foam pit, small ball pit, trampoline, and a variety of ninja foam blocks to jump and a roller slide and mountain to climb. Also the front area has one of those interactive coloring areas that animates your drawing on a big projector screen. Plus some tables full of building toys. There are plenty of places to sit and chat with other parents while staying within range of your kids. I‚Äôm always impressed with how clean they‚Äôre able to keep it and how chill the vibe usually is. At our last visit they added a new room full of airtoobz machines which kept my four year old busy for most of the play session. They also added a ‚Äúsnowball fight‚Äù area where you could pelt each other with tiny fluffy balls. I ended up in there with both my kids and nephew having the best time. It‚Äôs a really great place to go let your kids have a fun without being overstimulated and blasted in the face with screens and lights and ending the day in a meltdown. It gives wholesome playdate vibes and I just adore it. It‚Äôs really what the children‚Äôs museum in Portsmouth wishes it could be. If you‚Äôre a family with a quiet calm child it‚Äôs amazing. If you‚Äôre a family with a wild animal child climbing the walls and trying to parkour off every surface in your home it‚Äôs amazing. Bring em both. They‚Äôre gonna love it.

They were ready to help as soon as we walked in to set up, they were right there ready to help during the party, and even during the clean up. The schedule of events couldn't have been more perfect. Play time was for a hour and 15 minutes, and the last 45 minutes was dedicated to the party room for pizza and drinks. Sprouts took care of ordering all of the pizzas and even providing drinks!! The kids were allowed to run and play, while the parents were able to talk amongst each other without having to worry too hard about making sure every kid was safe. The layout of the indoor playground is so spacious and open - so it is easy to have eyes on your child at all times. I will always recommend Sprouts to anyone looking to entertain their children in a safe, clean and fun environment.

Review: Really wanted to like this place but we paid $15 per child ($30 total )for a 75 min play time. When we arrived the girl told us that because we had the last reserved spot of the day we needed to leave at the 1 hour mark because they needed time to clean and sanitize everything. So we were asked to leave at 5:30 when we paid until 5:45. It says on the door that they close at 6:00 p.m. The employee locked the door right behind us. I asked her why we were not told when we reserved the spot that it would be a different play time and she said she would have to look but never followed up with us and was instead behind the counter on her cell phone the entire time. She started cleaning with strong smelling chemicals before we were even done with our hour of playtime. This is something that I did not appreciate since I am pregnant.
If these are the rules, that should have been told to us when we reserved our spot, or our playtime should have been credited back or applied to another playtime. Will not be spending our money here again.

Reviewer: Amanda Branscome
Rating: 3/5

Review: Really wanted to like this place but we paid $15 per child ($30 total )for a 75 min play time. When we arrived the girl told us that because we had the last reserved spot of the day we needed to leave at the 1 hour mark because they needed time to clean and sanitize everything. So we were asked to leave at 5:30 when we paid until 5:45. It says on the door that they close at 6:00 p.m. The employee locked the door right behind us. I asked her why we were not told when we reserved the spot that it would be a different play time and she said she would have to look but never followed up with us and was instead behind the counter on her cell phone the entire time. She started cleaning with strong smelling chemicals before we were even done with our hour of playtime. This is something that I did not appreciate since I am pregnant.
If these are the rules, that should have been told to us when we reserved our spot, or our playtime should have been credited back or applied to another playtime. Will not be spending our money here again.

Reviewer: Jessica Langlois
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I take my daughter a couple times a month to play and interact. It's only $15 for her to play with all their toys and indoor playground equipment all day as long as she wants. I asked about the daycare they offer and after a lot of thought I decided I'd give it a try. The day I went in for drop off, Z was working. She gave me so much assurance, and texted me updates throughout the 2 hours my daughter was there. Z knew I was nervous and went above and beyond to give me comfort and assurance. She treated my baby (17 months) like she's known her her whole life. I was pleasantly surprised when i got back to my daughter refusing to leave, which she's never done before. I can see that my daughter had fun and that Z doesn't do just the bare minimum. Later that evening she even texted me saying that my daughter made her day, which was another thoughtful surprise. Would 100% recommend. I have no experience with the other workers other than the regular play days, which has also been a nice experience.. But I would feel very comfortable and confident trusting Z with my daughter. The 2 hours she spent with her made a positive impact. Very glad I went in on the day I did.

Reviewer: Rob and Fara Oakley
Rating: 1/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: I wanted to share my recent experience regarding our reservation for my son's birthday. While the lady who assisted us initially was friendly and accommodating, the follow-up call for confirmation was quite unpleasant. This caller claimed to be the one who helped with our reservation, which was not the case.

The original representative said it would be ok to arrive 10 minutes early for setup, despite the contract stating setup time was included. I've had friends celebrate at this venue, and they've been allowed those few extra minutes without extra charges. This isn't our first birthday party, and we've never encountered issues with early setups before. I am not saying 20-30 minutes prior; I am talking 10 minutes prior.

I understand that rules exist for a reason, but a little kindness can really enhance the customer experience. I suggest the management consider adjusting the scheduling to allow parents a few extra minutes for setup before guests arrive.

Reviewer: Kristina Jones-Parker
Rating: 4/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: I have a mixed review of this place but still giving 4 stars because my guests and kid's enjoyed it. I recently had my kid's joint bday party there Saturday 8/17. Positives- The employee that day (I forgot her name) was extremely helpful and kind. She was always checking in to see if we were ok and needed anything. I greatly appreciated that. Tons of activities for kids to do and they had SO MUCH FUN! The party room is nice but would not realistically seat 30 people at one time. It was a little crowded inside the party room.

Negatives- The entire facility on the weekends is reserved for private parties only from 9-2. There is a set amount you pay for a certain amount of hours and then $50 for each additional 30 mins. This does NOT include set up or breakdown time. I booked the space for 10am-1:30pm. Therefore, no one could have a party before or after me. The party was 11am-1pm. In my opinion, set up time and breakdown should be included. I should not have to pay an additional $100 to get there at 9am to set up when I have already reserved the space for the party. Trying to rush and set up in 1 hour was extremely stressful and a buzz kill. Additionally, the AC was not on when we arrived at 10 so we were sweating carrying in boxes, setting up, etc. For this reason of no set up time included, I do not think I will be having another party there. I really hope the owner considers adding in free set up time. I have heard in the mom's Facebook groups that many are deciding against having their party there because they think that is unfair.

Reviewer: Jay Carter
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 years ago
Review: The price combined with all the restrictions and employee attitudes is ridiculous. My niece‚Äôs party was this past Sunday 03/06/2022, my sister in law and a friend did a combined party. This was both of their daughter‚Äôs first birthday. They originally booked the space for 2 hours from 11:30 - 1:30pm. My sister-in-law was told that the set up and clean up time were included in the 2 hour booking time. The two hour time slot before theirs was not booked, despite this an additional 30 minutes was booked for $50 to ensure there was enough time to set up. Even though she paid for the additional 30 minutes she was unable to bring more than two people with her to set up because they did not want the equipment used. Why did that matter if she paid for the time slot. My sister-in-law got to the place at 10:30 to try to blow up some of the balloons in her car. An employee then came out to the parking lot informing my sister-in-law that she was not able to enter the building until 11 am even though no one else had rented the area before her. The employee explained this by stating that she was sweeping the area. My sister-in-law saw her grab a broom and pretend to sweep for 30 minutes. Overall, the party costed around $400 for 2 and 1/2 hours. 30 of those minutes were used to decorate the area. While the party was fairly enjoyable the stress of the strict time limits made it difficult for my sister-in-law to fully enjoy the party. I understand that the parties are booked for a specific amount of time for a reason. What I don‚Äôt understand is why an additional $50 had to be paid for 30 minutes when there was no party booked in the slot before. If you pay for the time I also don‚Äôt understand why there is a limitation on the amount of people you can bring with you. Overall, this place is way overpriced for all of the rules and restrictions that were given to my sister-in-law. We will never book this space again for any reason. Overpriced and underwhelming with rude employees.

Reviewer: Megan Romero
Rating: 5/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: My friend and I visited each with 3 kids 4 and younger. It was great that they have a sibling discount, because with multiples, stuff can add up quickly. We walked in to a clean play space that was covered in toys the kids enjoyed playing with by the end of our 2 hour session. When we were leaving, the worker was cleaning and organizing for the next group to come in and do it all over again. They have a really nice coffee machine which I really appreciated, the coffee was delicious! Tables and a couch for parents and 2 highchairs for the babies. The bathroom and exit doors have a sound bell to prevent kids from escaping. The bathroom is stocked with baby wipes, poop bags, hair ties and even tampons. Our play time was full so there were a decent amount of kids and parents in the building but it didn't feel over crowded and didn't prevent the kids from playing with anything they wanted to play with. The blue "Elsa" dress was a big hit as well as the fireman hose. The only improvement I could suggest is having one more small couch for parents to sit on and I think it would be perfect! This was a fun place for the kids to let out some energy especially with all the rain we have been having lately. Will definitely recommend to other families!

Review: We hosted my daughter‚Äôs 2nd birthday party at Shelby Play Place, and it was absolutely perfect! The space was the ideal size‚Äînot too big or overwhelming, but just right for the kids to explore and play comfortably while parents could easily keep an eye on them. The entire place was spotless, and the pricing was super affordable for everything included.

Kayleigh Melton, the owner, was incredible to work with. She maintained excellent communication throughout the planning process and went above and beyond to accommodate all of our needs. She really pays attention to the small details, like providing bathroom amenities specifically for little ones and ensuring the space was safe and secure for all kids.

One thing that truly stood out was that parents are allowed to get on all the play equipment with the kids. This was a huge relief since we have a little one who is sometimes a bit hesitant. So many other indoor play areas don‚Äôt allow this, but here, it made all the difference!

This play place made for a stress-free, fun, and memorable celebration. I couldn‚Äôt recommend it enough! Thank you, Kayleigh, for helping make my daughter‚Äôs special day so wonderful!

Reviewer: Alex H
Rating: 1/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: If you‚Äôre curious about having a birthday party here, here are the things you need to know. It‚Äôs lengthy.. sorry üôÉ

Time: We had a birthday party for our son and let me tell you the time frame they give you for the room is NOT worth it. They don‚Äôt serve the pizza until after 30 minutes so you have 45 minutes to get through the pizza, sing hbday, do the cake, & presents, get every body out of the room and get everything packed up and get out of the room yourself. Play time is until they close so that‚Äôs beneficial but you did pay for everyone already so it‚Äôs actually expected.

Food: pizza is from papa John‚Äôs and is very good!

Fees: if you get sick or have an emergency and need to reschedule, they fee you $50. Children get sick all the time so you would think they would be understanding being a kids place but they very much not understanding and do not care at all.
There is also a $75 fee if you go over the party room time for every 5 minutes over. We were all stressing trying to get through everything to be able to get out in time especially since they don‚Äôt let you in early to decorate or set up the food and cake, ect and don‚Äôt serve you immediately either so  you wait 30 minutes before you get the pizzas to eat so you really only have 45 minutes total for everything.

Things included: they say decorations and plates and napkins are included. We received table clothes, a happy birthday sign, and only 10 plates and napkins. The juice boxes are the capri suns and they only give you 10. The reservation is for 10 kids and 15 adults so you‚Äôd think they‚Äôd give you more options or atleast waters for everyone. Good thing there‚Äôs a grocery store near by or the adults will starve and not have anything to drink or eat on because just like us, you will need it to go buy yourself more plates, napkins, cups & drinks.

Viruses/sicknesses: be prepared to get sick if coming. We managed to get the flu the week of our son‚Äôs birthday and had to reschedule. When we reached out to the owners to let them know we were all sick, the options the owners gave us were‚Ä¶
Option 1: keep the date because they said ‚Äúwe‚Äôre going to lose your $300 this weekend if you don‚Äôt show up‚Äù  Yet, they knew we were all sick with the flu‚Ä¶ and still wanted us to come in so they would ‚Äúlose‚Äù out on our money.. I find it very irresponsible of these owners to sit there and say that to a parent.
Option 2: pay additional fees ontop of our $300 we spent for 1 hour rental of a room. Which really is 45 minutes when you actually get to start eating.

As a parent, we obviously rescheduled and ate the cost because we in no way would want to get the other kids sick and we obviously didn‚Äôt feel well ourselves but to know the owners are willing to send people there knowingly with the flu not caring that it will get all the other kids sick is disgusting.  We usually come every month with friends and family but I think this will be our last time knowing now what we do. They‚Äôre so desperate for an extra $50 they lost a lot more from us in the long term.  We know kids get sick and we try to have fun and be safe but now knowing you‚Äôre intentionally letting people come in sick because you allow people to keep their reservations when they tell you they‚Äôre sick instead of simply rescheduling them to keep everyone safe without fees attached is bad business and it‚Äôs gross.

Review: I came here with my 2 year old son on a Friday during winter break. We arrived right when they opened and little did we know that the place would soon be taken over by lots of older kids from the Y. All the commotion from all those kids did overwhelm my son at times, but we still managed to have fun. I appreciated how large their 4 and younger section was and there were 2 slide options. I wish there was staff regulating that area a little more as some of the older kids did attempt to play in the area. With the larger playground, there was a good variety of slides and activities. However, there are some areas that need to be fixed as you could see things were falling apart after lots of wear and tear. There is a section where you can shoot soft balls and my son was scared of that noise and it was going off often. I appreciated that you could bring outside food, but not sure why you cannot bring outside drinks. Overall, it can be a hit or miss on how busy it is so you just take that risk when you go. Also it truly depends on your child if they will like that type of environment.

Rating: 1/5

Review: Today was my sons 4th birthday party, and I will never use safari nation again. I called and asked about my reservation and they confirmed that they had the color green wrote down and that I could only have 10 minutes to decorate with my stuff. I also asked when they ordered their pizzas so I could make sure mine was ready at the same time. They told me they would be ready at 2:15, I got there and they literally made me wait till right at 10 minutes to get in the room (I saw other families that got in while the members were cleaning from prior parties) then i get in the room and they didn‚Äôt have any of the green things out. So the 10 minutes I did have pushed me further back, and had my guest watch me set everything up. I was given the room with no instructions. They didn‚Äôt give me the juice boxes till 20 minutes before my party was over and the pizza got there with 30 minutes left in the room. You only get one hour in the room. I‚Äôm thankful I had juice and pizza for the kids or we would have literally been sitting there till half way when the room time  was over. My child‚Äôs name wasn‚Äôt wrote on the door for my guests to even know where to go. There was signs on the table telling me to tip my party attended but I had no attended the whole time- I was even told that an attendant came with my package- I had no one helping the whole time. When I asked about it, they said I had to request one and that no one would really be in there much anyways. The staff were very rude and acted like we were a bother. When you spend almost 400 dollars, I expect so much more. I have had several parties at other facilities, and will definitely use those. It was embarrassing to me, and even some of the people at the party that are members of safari nation. We will not be back.

Review: We hosted my daughter‚Äôs 2nd birthday party at Shelby Play Place, and it was absolutely perfect! The space was the ideal size‚Äînot too big or overwhelming, but just right for the kids to explore and play comfortably while parents could easily keep an eye on them. The entire place was spotless, and the pricing was super affordable for everything included.

Kayleigh Melton, the owner, was incredible to work with. She maintained excellent communication throughout the planning process and went above and beyond to accommodate all of our needs. She really pays attention to the small details, like providing bathroom amenities specifically for little ones and ensuring the space was safe and secure for all kids.

One thing that truly stood out was that parents are allowed to get on all the play equipment with the kids. This was a huge relief since we have a little one who is sometimes a bit hesitant. So many other indoor play areas don‚Äôt allow this, but here, it made all the difference!

This play place made for a stress-free, fun, and memorable celebration. I couldn‚Äôt recommend it enough! Thank you, Kayleigh, for helping make my daughter‚Äôs special day so wonderful!
