Reviewer: Rachel Beam
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Short version - This is an exclusively christian business where anyone not interested in listing to inappropriate, adult christian music is not welcome to play.

We arrived at Funky Frogs for the first time this morning and my toddlers immediately took off and started to play after seeing the toys. I paid and signed a waiver and only then did I notice that christian music was being played over the loud speaker. I asked the employee, Amanda, if it could be changed to something more appropriate for all families‚Äîchildren‚Äôs music, perhaps‚Äîand she said that she didn‚Äôt have control over the station. After a few minutes I became even more uncomfortable so I simply asked for the volume to be turned down. My children and I were the only people in the store so I figured that this wouldn‚Äôt be a problem. Amanda walked towards the back, but did not make any noticeable change to the level of the volume. This was a huge challenge considering I had not only paid, but my kids had already begun playing and I wasn‚Äôt willing to cut their experience short.

We stayed and played and when it was time to leave, I spoke to Amanda to discuss my discomfort and she made it clear that we were not welcome in the space if we weren‚Äôt willing to be subjected to inappropriate christian music in what is advertised as a family space. She offered no apology and told me that had she known that I was that uncomfortable, that she would have offered a refund so that we could leave. Only after advocating for the refund myself was I able to get my money back.

The christian thing to do would have been to  create a welcoming and inclusive environment for all, but it is clear that the owners have limited their business to only those who practice christianity. Steer clear if you prefer that your kids not be exposed to religious indoctrination.

Reviewer: Richard
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: At 12:15 we are told that we can't enter with our 3 year old because "the current playtime is about to end and the next one doesn't start until 12:45". There ONE child currently in there playing. ONE! There are two parents with him. So, there are literally twice as many parents, including the staff, three times as many adults as children here. Still, our child can't come in, and we can't wait inside either for some odd reason. "You have to come back at 12:45" we are told. I point out the ONE child thing. Nope, come back at 12:45. I'm informed these rules "are strictly enforced and have been since covid". So, I asked "why have we not been turned away and told to come back at a designated time the last THREE times are three year old randomly decided she wanted to go there"? With a straight face, the girl behind the counter tells me, "well, it depends on who the staff members are that are that are working that day as to if the 'rules are enforced'". Have you ever tried to explain to a three year old, who's now throwing a fit because she can't play, that she has to go somewhere else and can't play because the wrong staff member is working that day? One last try. "Ma'am, there's one other kid in here, she's all excited to play, no one has ever mentioned this to us before".  Nope, come back at 12:45. ONE kid! I have no problems with there being rules. I do have a problem that only ONE staff member chooses to enforce them or even make them known. I do have a problem that we were allowed to pay and play three previous times and out of the 5 maybe 6 other staff members we've met, none of them ever mentioned these "strictly enforced" rules.
TLDR;
1)Whether or not your child can play without an appointment in a building with ONE other child, COMPLETELY depends on which staff members are working that day.
2)We did NOT return at 12:45
3)You are not allowed to use the restroom to change a toddlers diaper unless you pay. You can't pay until 12:45.

Reviewer: John Lawrence
Rating: 3/5

Review: 3 stars due to cost and needed maintenance and upkeep.

My daughter (3 years old) absolutely loves Megaplay. She has more fun here than she does at Zing Zumm and Altitute, both of which we have memberships for.

That said, I think Megaplay is prohibitively expensive as a place to take my daughter. Zing is $100 for an entire year, and for her and I to jump at Altitude 7 days a week for 2 hours at a time it's $40 a month. At Mega, there is no monthly option, so taking her just 3 times a month is as expensive as Altitude unlimited visits.

Can we get a membership option like everywhere else?

As for maintenance, the junglejims have many spots missing padding, covered in duct tape, equipment removed likely due to damage. The bounce houses have airleaks and tape all over.

I'm not posting this to bash, we really love it and would really love if we could go more often and see some much needed repairs. Thank you and please think about it!

Reviewer: Evangeline Jones
Rating: 1/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: On 11/15/2024 at approximately 10:02AM My son & I visited Mega play's Center. I am writing this review to raise awareness about discrimination faced by children with developmental delays during playtime. Office Manager of Megaplay left her office door open leaving a safety hazard to all children in this establishment my son entered her office to play on her play rug and we were verbally attacked by this Manager screaming for us to "get out of her office". I immediately attempted to explain my son is Autistic and this door should be closed. We were kicked out and I asked for a refund before I would leave. The Manager did grant this refund while speaking in a tone and demeanor not professional or fit for any type of leadership. As per the United Nations Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities which ensures disabled children have equal access to play and recreational activities my sons experience suggests that such principles were not upheld.  On behalf of my son, I would like to emphasize the need for this environment to become more nurturing and increase the ability for children to be able to thrive here. I am disappointed in my experience both women in this business lacked professionalism. maturity, and the ability to run an establishment properly by using conflict resolution this is a vulnerable child. You kicked him out because he entered your office and then screamed at a parent? I'm mortified...I ask anyone in this community don't allow your children to be treated like this. This business is unsafe, and follow-up will be taken to determine ratio per employees, cleanliness, and overall ability to operate properly. Staff training and creating a more inclusive environment should be required for this establishment to continue to operate.

Reviewer: Katelynn Burnett
Rating: 5/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: We rented the party room at Megaplay for my daughter‚Äôs 7th birthday this year. I am someone who really struggle with perfectionism and people pleasing. Thanks to this, party planning means a lot of stress for me. The folks at Megaplay were so kind and accommodating from the first moment I called. They had no problem answering every question I had before booking the room. They also explained clearly the fees and accommodations. In addition, they never made me feel uncomfortable or like an inconvenience for needing more clarification or for asking a second or third time. They also confirmed my time slot and accommodations twice before the date of the party. They made it clear they would do all the decorating all I had to do was drop off my supplies, and there was even an option to have them go buy the supplies for you (for an additional charge.)

All of that is great alone, but the staff really went above and beyond to support me. My daughter woke up sick the day of her party and I frantically called crying and defeated that everything was ruined. Not only did Megaplay have no problem rescheduling me, but the staff went out of there way to offer me reassurance and support that everything would be okay. Not as a customer, but as a stressed out mom thinking way too hard about a pokemon party. The reschedule affected the guest turnout pretty badly and I was fretting around in circles most of the party. Josh and Joyanna were right there for me the entire time. They checked with me every few minutes to make sure I was doing okay. They let me take the reins wherever I felt comfortable, but had no probably helping me direct the flow of the party in my stressed out state. I cannot count the number of times they told me ‚Äúif you need anything at all please don‚Äôt hesitate to let us know.‚Äù

The sincerity of the staff at Megaplay made every difference in the world for me. Thank you so much to Josh and Joyanna for having next level customer support. It was so clear my experience mattered to them as a person not just a customer. They were really able to help turn my entire mood about the party around. I‚Äôm so grateful this is where we chose to celebrate and I would give more stars if I could. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Reviewer: amanda stobaugh
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I've taken my son to play at Mega play several times now. During covid, they were on top of keeping it pretty clean. They stopped play time every hour to walk through and sanitize.  The equipment has always been a bit worn out, but this last visit, I was blown away. They have let this place go all the way downhill. 2 days after visiting this place, my son came down with a high-grade fever.

When we first arrived, the only thing I noticed was how HOT and muggy it was inside. Smelled like moldy gym socks. My son was too excited to turn back, so we continued.  My son is only 40 pounds, and he was the only child in the whole building. The bounce house he first picked could barely stay inflated with just him on it. Lots of holes and tape to patch these inflatables up.  And dirt. Lots and lots of dirt.

In the jungle gym maze part, there is pure filth. Candy wrappers, dirt,  drippings of God know what, and HAIR EVERYWHERE.  Lots of spots in the maze need to be fixed properly before someone gets seriously hurt. DUCT TAPE DOES NOT FIX EVERYTHING.  Mind you, we were the first ones there for the day.  So surely there were plenty of hours to clean before the next batch of children came in. There are signs all over saying, " If your child shows any sign of being sick, please inform the staff immediately."  Well, it's 2 days later, my son is very sick, and the only place we were was mega play.

I understand that businesses are short staffed, and I will say that the only girl working in there was very kind..... but this filth is absolutely unacceptable at a childs play place.  They charge 12 dollars for one hour. Not worth it at all. I will never ever bring my son back to mega play.

Reviewer: Camryn Holloman
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: My kids have been coming to this place for 3 years and absolutely love it. Besides the occasional times my kids have gotten sick, never had many issues. I have my kids birthday parties here. My concern currently is yesterday when we went at the FIRST time slot available; my 5 year old managed to get their leg IN BETWEEN a zip tie that is holding the net to the giant Playset. Another parent had to run up there and help me break the zip tie as my child was suspended in the air.

Additionally, there was a large hole above the slide that my child thought was funny to try to stick their head through. Obviously I corrected my child. However, this is still a serious safety concern and should be checked CONSTANTLY and addressed asap. Not once a week!

I called the manager the next day who told me once a week someone comes through to check the safety of the net and the playset. She Then proceeded to tell me that the large hole in the net above the slides must‚Äôve occurred the same day because the employees check the nets every night. That is not possible, because we arrived at the very first timeslot that was available that day.

I tried to explain to her that the zip tie was also loose because there‚Äôs no possible way my child could have slipped their entire leg through a zip tie in between the foam padding on the side; She continued to say it must‚Äôve happened that day and that the employees are very busy.

My child is not a small kid. The zip tie had to have been loose. A zip tie that is loose connected to the foam siding can cause a child to slip through the side off the playset, and the only thing holding a child from falling down is that cheap net that the employees supposedly check every night? I think not.

Additionally, we have a birthday party planned there and I cannot get any refund for the party. I will lose 50% of the funds that I paid so I will continue to have my birthday party there for my child and we just have to ensure that a parent is in there with kids, because the employees do not effectively check the netting for safety. Most of the employees that work there are likely high school or early college kids who genuinely don‚Äôt care. It‚Äôs just a job to them. Nothing wrong with them personally I was at age once with a job that wasn‚Äôt a serious career for me so they genuinely do not care and probably do not check the netting every single night.They are NEVER been too busy the 20 times we‚Äôve been here to check for safety hazards.

My kids enjoy this place so much so we will likely still attend here and have the birthday party where I can‚Äôt get my money back but if you‚Äôre a parent you need to make sure you watch your child extreme amount on that place and be up there with them or have an older child who is capable of watching younger kids because your childs safety is at risk on that play set.  And because you sign a waiver, the facility and the employees and manager genuinely don‚Äôt appear to care.

Review: I've taken my toddler here to play a handful of times, and I've always been so impressed with the cleanliness and the sweet staff members ready to help in whatever way they can. We decided to have our girl's 2nd birthday party here, and the day could not have been more perfect. The staff members were extremely helpful in making sure that we had everything that we needed. They were ready to help as soon as we walked in to set up, they were right there ready to help during the party, and even during the clean up. The schedule of events couldn't have been more perfect. Play time was for a hour and 15 minutes, and the last 45 minutes was dedicated to the party room for pizza and drinks. Sprouts took care of ordering all of the pizzas and even providing drinks!! The kids were allowed to run and play, while the parents were able to talk amongst each other without having to worry too hard about making sure every kid was safe. The layout of the indoor playground is so spacious and open - so it is easy to have eyes on your child at all times. I will always recommend Sprouts to anyone looking to entertain their children in a safe, clean and fun environment.

Rating: 3/5

Review: Really wanted to like this place but we paid $15 per child ($30 total )for a 75 min play time. When we arrived the girl told us that because we had the last reserved spot of the day we needed to leave at the 1 hour mark because they needed time to clean and sanitize everything. So we were asked to leave at 5:30 when we paid until 5:45. It says on the door that they close at 6:00 p.m. The employee locked the door right behind us. I asked her why we were not told when we reserved the spot that it would be a different play time and she said she would have to look but never followed up with us and was instead behind the counter on her cell phone the entire time. She started cleaning with strong smelling chemicals before we were even done with our hour of playtime. This is something that I did not appreciate since I am pregnant.
If these are the rules, that should have been told to us when we reserved our spot, or our playtime should have been credited back or applied to another playtime. Will not be spending our money here again.

Reviewer: anne h
Rating: 3/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: So decided to try this for the first time today with a 9,4 and a 2 Yr old. Price to get in was reasonable but price of socks was a tad expensive when in a group of 3 or more but luckily we brought our own.

Price of food wasn't too bad, although the jacket potato was slightly cold, the chips were cold and wraps should come with chips which they don't. I was however impressed with the ¬£2.75 slush which seemed very popular with kids. Not so much for a dairy free child to eat apart from chips or Crisps ü§î

The trampoline bit both the 9 and 4 Yr old loved and were all sweated out within the first 20 mins ü§£ the play area bit well that's a bit of a let down tbh. The under 4s area was overrun by kids older than 4! My 2 Yr old was pushed and there were babies in there that could only sit in the ball pit as it was just way too busy to sit anywhere else because older kids were just running wild. There wasn't enough seating in either areas of the upstairs cafe or the play area which was a tad letdown for me.

Also the lovely green button you press to get out the play area needs to be higher as my 4 Yr old was somehow found outside the play area with another family. You need a better booking in system for the play area as its a safeguarding issue if kids can freely get out. It seems peak times are just a free for all especially older kids.

Having said all that all the staff were polite, welcoming and helpful. The pizzas were good too. It would be nice to see staff in play area as well as parents of older kids keeping a close eye on them and to avoid the under 4 area.

Would I return?? Yes because my kids loved it but were in no rush and that's why I've given it 3 stars. Would of gotten a 5 if more seating was provided.

Review: Avoid peak time. I was here on Friday noon. First we were met by a long queue outside. When we got inside after 15 minutes of waiting, the staff ensured that we would be able to stay an extra 10 minutes (I paid for 2 hours).It turned out that the room was overcrowded and there were no seats. I will only add that at the entrance I had to pay an extra pound as a fee for monitoring adult capacity. After half an hour of standing, we managed to sit down. Before I ordered the food, someone from the staff approached me, asking to leave the playground. When I asked why, he explained that I had a green armband and it was my time to leave. I explained that I was here only half an hour and I paid for two. It turned out that we were handed the wrong color of the bands.I didn't get an apology. He just threw me a different color of bands on the table. After less than two hours after entering, I was asked to leave the building again (the staff did not grant us the promised 10 extra minutes).I felt uncomfortable and unwelcome. For that reason it's only one star- for tasty food.

Review: Not a bad place, but definitely let down by pricing and lack of parental supervision 5 kids.

Another thing that lets this place down is the number of kids just being left unsupervised by parents, despite signs all over telling parents to supervise them. When you've got kids 7+ charging round the toddler area and throwing things at each other, it really doesn't feel like money well spent on a 1 year old to go in. During the quiet times it's not too bad, but when it's peak time, it'd be an idea for the owner/manager to have more staff in and actually enforce the rules

Review: The Cub House Play Cafe - A Wonderland for Kids and Parents Alike

The Cub House Play Cafe is nothing short of a magical kingdom where both children and parents can find joy and relaxation. Nestled in a cozy corner of town, this playplace is a haven for families seeking a delightful escape from the everyday hustle and bustle.

As you step into The Cub House, you‚Äôre greeted by the inviting aroma of freshly brewed coffee and an array of delectable snacks and salads. The cafe offers a wide variety of treats that cater to both kids and adults, ensuring that everyone leaves with a satisfied smile.

But the true enchantment lies in the play area. The Cub House boasts a vast assortment of toys, slides, and play structures that spark the imagination and energy of every child who enters. From towering slides to intricate playsets, there‚Äôs something for every little adventurer. The space is thoughtfully designed to be safe and engaging, allowing parents to relax and enjoy their coffee while their children explore and play.

The staff at The Cub House are nothing short of wonderful. Their friendly and attentive nature ensures that every visit is a pleasant experience. They go above and beyond to maintain a clean and welcoming environment, making it a place where families feel at home.

Whether you‚Äôre looking for a place to host a birthday party, a playdate, or just a casual outing, The Cub House Play Cafe is the perfect destination. It‚Äôs a place where laughter echoes, friendships are forged, and memories are made. For a fun-filled day that caters to both kids and parents, look no further than The Cub House Play Cafe.

Review: A great play space for young children! It is a really large venue with areas for the cafe, seating for parents, main play space for kids, a separate baby/infant space, and a party room.

Reviewer: Nicole D
Rating: 3/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: I visited today, March 11th with my niece. Our last visit seemed okay, so we returned. She loved the bounce area. It is clean and has well-defined areas.

I wouldn‚Äôt say the rules posted everywhere are monitored. I saw several kids get hurt by others climbing up slides and pushing down on the equipment. I get that parents and guardians are supposed to keep an eye on their child, but the fact is, that doesn‚Äôt always happen. They could use someone to walk the facility and remind the children of rules.
Also, everything seemed a ‚Äúmoney-grab‚Äù. For example, I bought a water bottle for my niece and knew she wouldn‚Äôt drink it all, so I asked for a cup to share it between us, I was told it would cost an extra dollar. I ended up just buying a second water bottle that she took 2 sips from. I agree with another poster that the arcade games are unnecessary. They‚Äôre just another way to entice parents to spend more money.

The food was alright and fairly priced, but I intended to go home to eat between play times. After spending $20 ($16.99 + tax) for our entry fee, I thought it was with in/out privileges, but I was told if we go home to eat, we cannot return without paying again. When she said they didn‚Äôt have a way to track if I‚Äôd paid, I thought that‚Äôs untrue, as they ensure everyone in the facility signs a waiver. Or give me my receipt and I‚Äôll prove I‚Äôve paid when I return. Similar places in the area offer this and I‚Äôll go there instead.

Overall, I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll be back. Other patrons there were saying similar to me. It got very crowded and you could barely move sometimes. The staff were food police, coming up to parents and accusing them of bringing outside food.

To my shock, she then told me that strollers weren't allowed! What did she expect me to do‚Äîhold my baby for the entire time? Reviewer: NS F
Rating: 1/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: I would recommend considering alternative venues for your event. My experience with this establishment was disappointing, primarily due to the owner, Lisette, and her approach to customer service. I regret not reading   earlier negative reviews regarding her lack of professionalism and prioritization of profit over client satisfaction.

During our event, I felt that many costs were unnecessarily inflated, which was particularly disheartening given the substantial amount we invested‚Äîaround $800. This is a significant expense, and it would have been more enjoyable to spend that money on a nice dining experience. Additionally, Susan, Lisette's daughter, encouraged us to order more food than we needed, most of which went to waste.

A particularly frustrating incident occurred when one of our guests was refused entry at the door, even though we had not yet reached the minimum capacity for our event. It was surprising to witness such a lack of flexibility. Our guest left the event upset .  I also noticed that a young family member, a 13-year-old, was allowed to work in the establishment, which I found unprofessional.

Furthermore, the policy of not permitting outside snacks, while allowing drinks, seemed contradictory and not very customer-friendly. This restriction, which they claimed was for safety, appeared to be more about limiting customer choices. For those seeking healthier food options, the absence of such considerations was disappointing.

I also felt pressured to purchase specific items such as cakes and decorations, which contributed to the overall sense of being taken advantage of as a customer. While Susan expressed a desire to apologize during the event, the timing felt inappropriate and did not mitigate the overall negative experience.

The  balloons we purchased  from them were not adequately inflated, leading to them not lasting the duration of our event.

I believe in treating customers with respect and care, and I would encourage Lisette to adopt a more client-centric approach that values customer relationships over profit. I would strongly recommend exploring other venues where the owners prioritize treating their guests with kindness and respect instead of taking advantage of them .

We arrived at 3:40 and upon entering we were met with the manager who informed us they closed at 4... The summer hours. When I stated that online it says 7, she became defensive. I highly recommend calling in advance to check their hours before driving out of your way to go like we did.

Reviewer: Joe
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: Although I am not the one to normally write a review, I feel compelled to share how disappointed I am with this business. From the top down, it seems clear that profits and self-interest are prioritized above any sense of responsibility, consistency, or customer care. The owner has repeatedly failed to open the business on time and rarely communicates when this happens ‚Äî leaving families confused, frustrated, and sitting outside the door with their baby/toddler in frustration. Despite having paid for services that were supposed to be reliably available during stated business hours, there has been no consistency with their hours of operation.
When events are cancelled there is no clear communication.

The lack of consistency is staggering. When families pay for a service ‚Äî especially one that‚Äôs supposed to offer a dependable, supportive environment ‚Äî the bare minimum expectation is that the service will actually be provided. Unfortunately, that just hasn‚Äôt been the case here.

Save your time, money, and energy. More importantly, if you value your family or even the concept of value itself, look elsewhere. You deserve better.

Reviewer: Christina C

Review: We were looking for a new activity for our 2 year old to start after taking a break from tumbling. Looking through the local area we came across The Baby Bar! Reviewer: Mattania Chapman

Review: I was super excited to have my son‚Äôs first birthday party here and it turned out, not to be what I expected. I arrived at 12:50pm to get the room set up/oversee the progress (mind you the reservation was between 1p-3pm); to my surprise the room was set up for a Mrs Rachel party that took place at 3pm. They didn‚Äôt have my son‚Äôs decor ready nor was the room ready by 1pm. I left the facility at 1:15pm to go pick up the birthday boy. All of our family members were arriving and could‚Äôve signed the play waivers for their babies but the employees waited until our arrival around 1:40pm to get the guests to sign waivers while making sure I understood I only had 20 minutes left in the party room. There was no reason why the guests couldn‚Äôt have played while we weren‚Äôt there. I provided their names to the staff previously and paid for their admission in advance. There was no reason why the guests couldn‚Äôt have enjoyed the experience. Later on while the children were enjoying their food, I was informed that the staff and owner went into the party room to clean it for the next reservation; the Mrs Rachel Party they had set up preciously.. There was no conversation to the children in the room to let them know ‚Äúhey we are about to clean this room‚Äù they just started spraying their chemicals around their food and our sons birthday cake. As time went on, we (mommy and daddy) were enjoying this time with our family enjoying our sons birthday, when it was brought to my attention that one of the employees referred to my sons father as ‚Äúare you the baby daddy‚Äù. Excuse me. There was no decorum nor respect in the place. We felt rushed, overlooked, bamboozled, and lied to. They sold us on a fantasy and it was proven to be a lemon.

Reviewer: Rebecca Stoddard
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: So my family ventured to this adorable and fun little establishment a week ago.

I walked in and was immediately greeted by the staff member with a very warm and friendly welcome. The sign in process is simple, for anyone who has a bit of common sense & experience with literally any other waiver process. Scan the QR code, fill out the form online, made my payment and that was that.

The sheet amount of stuff to DO (play with, climb on, swing on, pretend play accessories, stacking or sticking together, read, wear) was surprising!! For a space this size, it is fully maximized! Not to mention the literal baby bar, little high chairs lined up at a bar with a TV playing all toddler friendly stuff while they can have Italian ice, juice, or snacks.

This place was literally perfection. I did notice a couple who was informed to stay out of the bar area, as it was for employee use only, directly disobey the minute the staff member left the area and began snooping through the contents kept hidden and out of reach behind the bar. So I would recommend the owner install cameras so she can protect herself against people with ill-intent. :)

Reviewer: Amanda Loftis
Rating: 1/5
Time: 3 months ago
Review: I've been to the Baby Bar a few times now and I really want to like it, but the experience is just not great for parents or kids.

Each time I've been there, it's been basically empty with staff sitting around bored, yet every surface is dingy and dirty. Floors look like they've never been vacuumed and the counters where kids are supposed to snack are sticky and unclean.  When a place as busy as the Children's Museum is spotless, it's hard to understand how The Baby Bar can be so filthy with several staff members and two guests.

The most recent time I went, there was a family there with a kid that was very clearly sick with a snotty nose and hacking cough. I was shocked that a sick kid was allowed to come in and play since one of the rules posted on the wall states "no sick kids." The staff didn't seem to mind at all even though I wasn't the only parent to immediately leave after noticing the kid.

I really tried to give this place a chance, but it seems worse each time I go and if I'm going to spend $16 I'd rather go to the Science Center or the Children's Museum.

Review: This morning we decided to try a new indoor playground, The Baby Bar. Entering the establishment for the first time, there is a lengthy admissions process to the facility that makes you want to just throw in the towel and the waivers come after you playü§î. The receptionist advised that there was hot coffee bar in the area and not to let the kids near it. I immediately posed my concern about hot beverages in a children‚Äôs play environment.  She said, it was for parents who wanted to enjoy that while their kids played. Once we reached the play area, we were aesthetically pleased with the age appropriate toys. After a few moments in, we noticed the ‚Äúcoffee bar‚Äù was more than what was originally described. If I‚Äôm being required to man an area so my kids don‚Äôt wonder, then I going to inspect it. I was in disbelief  when I saw open bottles of Brut, Smirnoff, beer and cleaning supplies, completely unsecured. I moved the open bottles to the counter to avoid any potential risk for any child. Moments later, my son fell due to a very unstable baby bench press toy. It was wobbly and not secured  at the joints. My youngest son and another little boy were near the personal belongings dresser, a random piece of wood fell off of it hitting the other baby in the face. The  dresser wasn‚Äôt even secured to wall to avoid a fall risk. That was it, we were out of there.

The cherry on top of our experience was when I called back and spoke with the owner. I‚Äôve never heard so many excuses in a conversation. She stated, she never had any children wander behind the bar and it‚Äôs never posed an issue. The liquor is for hosted parties and catered events for parents who are okay with parents drinking in front of kids or ones that allow their kids to drink too. Weird, right!! She mentioned she had multiple bars in Greensboro and had all her permits. All I cared about is the safety of the children, mine and others, not your bars that require a I.D to drink.

The point is, if you want to run the risk of your child getting tipsy due to lack of securing open liquor, then this the place for you. Your unpaid job as the bouncer to the open liquor will not be enjoyable. We came so our kids could enjoy free play in a fun environment and it wasn‚Äôt at all. I hope they address these very serious concerns.

-----------------------

Reviewer: J H
Rating: 1/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I really wanted to like this place and decided to try it for open play. The play area itself was nice, with a good selection of toys. However, we were concerned about the lack of childproofing throughout the space.

The shoe rack, standing about four feet tall, was not secured to the wall, posing a potential tipping hazard. The bar area was completely accessible to children, with open alcoholic beverages on the floor and cleaning solutions within reach‚Äîthings you definitely wouldn‚Äôt want kids getting into. We did sign a waiver stating that parents are responsible for keeping children out of the bar area, but given how easily accessible it was, this still felt like a safety issue. Additionally, the bathroom had exposed outlets and switches without covers, which raised further concerns.

While the concept is great, I hope they make necessary safety improvements to create a more secure environment for young children.

Note: One of the other parents there at the time picked the two open wine bottles up and set them on the counter because they were not sealed in any way.

Review: Took my 18 month old here earlier this summer. Awesome concept! A few thoughts...

-I would have probably given our experience 3 stars, but upped it to 4 stars because the most frustrating thing about our visit wasn't Palmetto Proper's fault! There was a mom there who didn't look up from her computer for over an hour. Her two kids were everywhere and climbing on all the things they weren't supposed to. It was really sad as one of them, who said he was 2, was starved for attention. He wouldn't leave us alone and ended up jumping on my daughter's head. Not sure how common it is for the parents not to be paying attention here.

-I maybe had too high of expectations based on other reviews and we may have just come at a bad time since it was right before closing, but the area/toys were a little more rundown and dirtier than I was expecting (I know it's hard with kids!). There's no place in the area that I know of that rivals this place, but it seems like there definitely could be in the future.

-Overall, I will probably not bring my child back until she is at least 3 years old due to safety/parents not paying attention. I do think that it would be worth renting out for a party though!

Also a good bit of the equipment is in poor condition or broken so it's disappointing they don't replace stuff. Also if you buy something make sure it's exactly what you want and if it's clothes, that it will fit perfectly, because there's only exchanges and if there's not anything else you'd like then you're out of luck. Overall I'll be heading to the children's museum or just splashing in puddles on rainy afternoons.

EDIT: my review was originally a 3 star, but after the most unprofessional response from a business owner I've received I lowered it to 1 star. I won't be using the remaining amount on the gift card that I received for returning a shirt that was able to be re sold because of the owners completely unapologetic attitude and unwillingness to make  anything right. I'm glad that she was able to make double the money off the item but one has to wonder if it's worth it when you're losing any future business.
P.S. Please at least replace the Melissa and Doug grocery store set up, if you haven't already, before a child gets hurt on the broken plastic.

Reviewer: Krystal Kusak
Rating: 3/5
Time: 3 years ago
Review: This is a cute concept but overall is not likely an establishment I will revisit. I give three stars for cleanliness and the variation of engagement opportunities for kiddos. For me the negatives included a lot of rules up front. Of course cleanliness and safety are of utmost importance so I understand some need for structure, but too many rules takes the fun out of the experience in my opinion.

The first rule included that the different category toys needed to be kept in their stations and then anything moved from their original place must be put back before leaving by the parent. I stay home with my children so every day I spend a significant amount of time picking up after them. When I pay to take my toddlers to a play place, the last thing I want to have to do is pick up after my kids, all while making sure they are safe and not making more of a mess in another area. Honestly, I understand why they have this rule because it could be pure chaos with a lot of the smaller toys and a packed house, but we frequent other places specifically Chippy's bounce house and we've never been asked to keep things together or put them back. I do try to be respectful and tidy as we go, but I don't want the responsibility of picking every item up that they played with. My whole opinion is that picking up and putting back should be a service provided by the staff. The second rule was no food or drink in the play area and that makes a lot of sense for children because they're messy. However, the whole concept of this place is a gift shop cafe and play place. The attendant asked me if I wanted a drink and I really didn't care for one but ordered anyways to further support the small business. Apparently I naively didn't think that the drink rule applied to adults and I brought my hot drink inside the play area and was drinking it around the perimeter. Within the first few minutes the attendant came over and told me no drinks were allowed in the play area and to please drink over the gate. It just doesn't really make sense to sell hot coffee for parents to enjoy if it can't be done while supervising children within the play area. Maybe that rule works ok for parents with older children, but mine are toddlers and need to be watched pretty closely. Being reprimanded although respectfully, coupled with having to clean up after my kids with  other children still playing in areas where mine had made messes, just left me feeling bothered.

Imagine trying to tell 3 year olds and under that they can‚Äôt take toys from this side of the room to ten feet to the other side of the room.  My kids were too small to be moving things around at the time but seeing the other kids get scolded for BEING CHILDREN AT A PLACE MADE FOR THEM TO PLAY, made it awkward and uncomfortable.  I‚Äôll be taking my money to village play from now on, they have a better space, better play equipment, and friendly staff.

Rating: 3/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: I need to start out by saying the facility is nice and the staff are nice as well. The 3 stars is because I do see improvement in this establishment. We travel across the state to visit these types of children play places monthly. The space is tight when crowded but not much can be done regarding that. There was little room to move up and down the walkway to find my children. It became a little unsafe with kids running in and out of the big kid area into the walkway. I loved seeing a 5 and under area. With that being said. I wish the door would lock and not allow for the littles to push open on their own. Additionally if there is a 5 and under area I would like for some monitoring to keep the larger kids out of it. I was disappointed in seeing 8yrs and older inside this area. Twice my children were hit in the face by feet due to the lack of these older children not paying attention to the smaller children. One of the bigger kids jumped onto my 1yr old flattening her and then ran off laughing. We had a 2hr play pass and I stayed for 45 mins because the general area was becoming unsafe. I understand that it was opening week and they still need to tweak their policies and procedures. We will give it another try in the future and I'm willing to change my review if that visit shows improvement.

Review: UPDATE: Same cohort, and I visited, and he enjoyed the play area, which wasn't overrun for once.  My drink was not great. It tasted like watered-down milk with a little bit of chia flavor. Will need to figure out how to specify getting a good outcome.

I have been investigating the area for great indoor play spaces and taking my "nanny kid" to test run each one.

I was excited to see this one open. it appeared on the website, which leaves a lot to be desired, that this was a caf√© with a kid friendly atmosphere.

I arrived with my cohort, 2 y.o. male, only to discover they do, in fact, charge for children. Also, they have a time limit. But I viewed the play area, and it was wall to wall parents standing around chatting and littles toddling about. There was no space to run or be a 2 y.o. We had to leave.

I was not subjecting my l'il to that. We traveled across town to Cary and tried out Notasium. He thrived there, and though it had about the same amount of folks, the space itself was bigger. Still, it is suggested, "An indoor playground should generally contain at least 150 square feet of room per child.¬†This can, however, vary depending on the age of the children..."

So, far Over The Moon has been his favorite and the time limit, though less then Bumble Brews ends up being over much because he literally spent 40 of the 80 minutes there running... full out.

I feel this place would "bee" excellent for anyone with pre walkers.

I plan to visit again when I have a client with a pre walker.

Review: I can't say enough good things about Bumble Brews Raleigh! As soon as you step through the doors, you're greeted with vibrant colors and an atmosphere buzzing with joy and excitement. It's truly a haven for both kids and parents alike.

The concept of combining an indoor play cafe for kids with a space for parents to relax and enjoy a drink is pure genius. It's like a mini vacation for families! The kids get to run wild and play to their heart's content in the safe and engaging play areas, while the parents can unwind and socialize over a cold beer or a glass of wine.

One thing that stood out to me is how well-maintained and clean everything is. I appreciate the attention to detail in ensuring a hygienic environment for the little ones to play in.

And let's talk about the staff - they're absolutely fantastic! Friendly, attentive, and always ready to lend a hand or offer a smile. They truly make you feel like family from the moment you walk in.

We hosted our daughters‚Äô birthday party here and it was so much fun!  We invited both our friends and the kids closest friends, blasted our own music, and had the best time and dance party lol!  The owners were so fun to work with and went above and beyond to make sure the girls party went off without a hitch!

I love that there are signs everywhere reminding guests to wear socks, explaining time limits, among other things, so there really aren‚Äôt any surprises when you come to play!  The attention to detail does not go unnoticed to your community.

Overall, I highly recommend Bumble Brews Raleigh to any parent looking for a fun and unique outing with their little ones. It's a gem in the community, and I can't wait to visit again soon!

Review: Not impressed. $10 for an hour and a half of play inside a small crowded room with dirty toys and not much to do. They have a nice jungle gym in the middle, but definitely not for kids older than three.

To add to owners comment below:

I expressed it was our first time here and NO ONE told us when I paid and order coffee that is was no shoes and socks required or I would‚Äôve paid for the socks initially with no issues. After getting my daughter settled playing, I noticed myself no one else had shoes on (several toddlers with bare feet also) so I took off my daughters and my shoes how about the same time one of the employees also came to inform us about being ‚Äú a no shoes facility‚Äù. Again, but no mention about socks being required. Then roughly 20 minutes into playing another time friend came up clean and said that sock are actually required and that we would need to leave or buy socks. at this time, more embarrassed than anything, I decided to leave. It wasn‚Äôt and I informed him not to worry about it, that he would be leaving.

My five year-old daughter told me herself several times that she didn‚Äôt like that place and it was for babies. I am glad you are able to market to higher age group, but that doesn‚Äôt change some of the toys being dirty, it being a small and overcrowded room or that all the toys that were available were most definitely for smaller children under 3. Thanks for your response but trying to blame me for your unclear rules just makes it more clear how under valued your customers are. Good luck in the future. My review is nothing but honest to hopefully save another parent from wasting their hard earned money as well.

Reviewer: Tori Scott
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 days ago
Review: This is a hidden gem! I have been wanting to come here with my two children, who have ADHD & different levels of Autism, my son, who is 11, and my daughter, who just turned 6, since they opened. We never had a chance to visit until yesterday (Saturday, June 28, 2025) when we were invited with some friends who are members. My oldest had a blast with the arcade games, the climbing areas, and just being indoors in general in a safe environment to help escape this heat. The facility is card only, which was no issue for us, thankfully. The machine to dispense the game card even took tap to pay, so my son was able to use some Apple Cash he had to load a new game card.

Francine was very helpful when checking in with explaining the waiver, the process since it was our first time, and swatting any of those pesky flies that snuck through the door. They didn't get far because Francine was on it in the lobby, swatting left and right, taking out those summer nuances. Liz with the killer nails (can't wait to see what design she has on our next visit) helped when we needed to check out from the snack bar, which I was very impressed with the selections that are offered. She is very personable and a great asset to the front desk. Kyrsten knew exactly what I needed on this 100 degree day when I ordered a fountain Sundrop because she came in clutch, offering extra ice! I was like, Yessssss please! I was praising the facility already, and they told me where to leave the review, so here I am!

Plum Krazy Play is now a staple in our neurodivergent family! Not only because it is a safe place I can let my children play inside with added sensory play when needed, I can get a fountain Sundrop, AND I can get some adult interactions in.... I say sign me up! We are discussing membership as a family and looking at all the calendar events, including Sensory Wednesday, which is probably going to be the first time I bring my daughter. Can't wait to come again!

As an added bonus, the facility is a Pok√©mon Gym if anyone plays Pok√©mon Go ;)

Review: A true gem for families!
Maple is hands down one of the most incredible enrichment centers and indoor playgrounds I‚Äôve ever experienced. From the moment you walk in, you‚Äôre struck by how immaculately clean and thoughtfully designed the space is-it‚Äôs inviting, calm, and never chaotic.

What sets Maple apart is the passion and vision of its owner, (Aly)  a devoted homeschool mom who pours her heart into every detail. She‚Äôs created something truly special and brings in licensed teachers to lead and support her programs, which I love and admire.

The programs are constantly evolving and improving, which is something I deeply appreciate, it shows a genuine commitment to growth and excellence. The children are learning so much, and doing so in a way that feels joyful and natural.

Another standout feature: it doesn‚Äôt smell like food or stale coffee like most kid spots. Instead, Maple diffuses On Guard essential oils, making the air feel fresh and clean. They offer complementary coffee for parents, but it blends seamlessly into the atmosphere without overpowering the space.

Above all, Maple feels like a true community. The owner is incredibly present and engaged with the families, and you can feel the warmth between parents as they connect and build friendships here. It‚Äôs more than a business‚Äîit‚Äôs a beautiful labor of love. A total breath of fresh air!

Reviewer: Rachel Beam
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Short version - This is an exclusively christian business where anyone not interested in listing to inappropriate, adult christian music is not welcome to play.

We arrived at Funky Frogs for the first time this morning and my toddlers immediately took off and started to play after seeing the toys. I paid and signed a waiver and only then did I notice that christian music was being played over the loud speaker. I asked the employee, Amanda, if it could be changed to something more appropriate for all families‚Äîchildren‚Äôs music, perhaps‚Äîand she said that she didn‚Äôt have control over the station. After a few minutes I became even more uncomfortable so I simply asked for the volume to be turned down. My children and I were the only people in the store so I figured that this wouldn‚Äôt be a problem. Amanda walked towards the back, but did not make any noticeable change to the level of the volume. This was a huge challenge considering I had not only paid, but my kids had already begun playing and I wasn‚Äôt willing to cut their experience short.

We stayed and played and when it was time to leave, I spoke to Amanda to discuss my discomfort and she made it clear that we were not welcome in the space if we weren‚Äôt willing to be subjected to inappropriate christian music in what is advertised as a family space. She offered no apology and told me that had she known that I was that uncomfortable, that she would have offered a refund so that we could leave. Only after advocating for the refund myself was I able to get my money back.

The christian thing to do would have been to  create a welcoming and inclusive environment for all, but it is clear that the owners have limited their business to only those who practice christianity. Steer clear if you prefer that your kids not be exposed to religious indoctrination.

There are 2 separate ball pits, a little car go round and a few role-playing houses for kids to play with each other. There are 2 separate rooms for parties and they seem to have a lot of events going on to keep the fun going and different (like a ms Rachel meet and egg hunt). Reviewer: Miranda Sofer
Rating: 5/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: This morning, my husband and I found ourselves staring at our two kids, feeling completely stumped on what to do with them. We live in Five Forks and have already checked off the Children's Museum and the Zoo. With the heat making the park a no-go and the age gap between our kids (6 and 2) complicating things, we needed a solution. In a moment of desperation, I googled ‚ÄúThings to do with kids in Greenville, SC‚Äù and stumbled upon Kids Play & Cafe in Easley, about 45 minutes away. The photos looked promising, but I wasn‚Äôt sure if it would hold their interest for more than five minutes. Still, I decided to give it a try.

Spoiler alert: It‚Äôs fantastic!

From the moment we walked in, I was impressed. We signed the waiver, paid the $30, and my kids eagerly ran off to explore. The space has plenty of spots to stash shoes and comfortable seating for parents to keep an eye on their little ones. The climbing jungle gym was a huge hit‚Äîit was designed perfectly for both my 2-year-old and 6-year-old, with various levels of difficulty. I was relieved to see that there were enough ways for kids to climb up and down without needing any help from the staff. Plus, there are several other areas specifically for toddlers to play safely.

I made sure the kids had a good lunch before we arrived, but the on-site cafe had a great selection of snacks, including organic Annie‚Äôs, candy, muffins, cupcakes, and drinks like bottled water, organic juices, and coffee. We enjoyed a cupcake, some Annie‚Äôs cheddar crackers, and a coffee while we were there.

The staff were exceptional‚Äîfriendly, attentive, and proactive. When my 2-year-old removed his socks, they quickly informed me he needed to get them back on or he'd have to miss out on climbing. Honestly, I appreciated the attention they were paying. Additionally, I noticed staff members constantly cleaning and tidying up, which gave me peace of mind about the cleanliness of the facility. After visiting other indoor play centers, I can confidently say this place surpasses them all.

An added bonus was the warm atmosphere created by other parents. Everyone seemed genuinely nice, and the kids quickly made friends. One child even helped my 2-year-old into the ball pit. It‚Äôs clear that this place fosters a great community.

If I had one suggestion, it would be to make the arcade games and cotton candy machine card-friendly. I would have easily bled $30-40 into those machines, but I rarely carry cash and didn‚Äôt notice an ATM on-site. A token system or card payments could be a great addition, but I understand the challenges with credit card fees for small businesses.

As for keeping an eye on your kids, you‚Äôll see a range of options. Some parents worked on laptops in centrally located tables, others relaxed on phones in cozy egg-shaped chairs or enjoyed massage chairs, while some simply found comfy spots to sit along the perimeter. I was more active since my youngest is a bit of a daredevil, but overall, it was a relaxing experience that properly exhausted my kids and provided a nice, quiet drive home.

I hope this review helps other parents considering the drive to Easley for a fun and engaging spot for their kids.

Reviewer: Rachel Beam
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Short version - This is an exclusively christian business where anyone not interested in listing to inappropriate, adult christian music is not welcome to play.

We arrived at Funky Frogs for the first time this morning and my toddlers immediately took off and started to play after seeing the toys. I paid and signed a waiver and only then did I notice that christian music was being played over the loud speaker. I asked the employee, Amanda, if it could be changed to something more appropriate for all families‚Äîchildren‚Äôs music, perhaps‚Äîand she said that she didn‚Äôt have control over the station. After a few minutes I became even more uncomfortable so I simply asked for the volume to be turned down. My children and I were the only people in the store so I figured that this wouldn‚Äôt be a problem. Amanda walked towards the back, but did not make any noticeable change to the level of the volume. This was a huge challenge considering I had not only paid, but my kids had already begun playing and I wasn‚Äôt willing to cut their experience short.

We stayed and played and when it was time to leave, I spoke to Amanda to discuss my discomfort and she made it clear that we were not welcome in the space if we weren‚Äôt willing to be subjected to inappropriate christian music in what is advertised as a family space. She offered no apology and told me that had she known that I was that uncomfortable, that she would have offered a refund so that we could leave. Only after advocating for the refund myself was I able to get my money back.

The christian thing to do would have been to  create a welcoming and inclusive environment for all, but it is clear that the owners have limited their business to only those who practice christianity. Steer clear if you prefer that your kids not be exposed to religious indoctrination.

Reviewer: Rachel Beam
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Short version - This is an exclusively christian business where anyone not interested in listing to inappropriate, adult christian music is not welcome to play.

We arrived at Funky Frogs for the first time this morning and my toddlers immediately took off and started to play after seeing the toys. I paid and signed a waiver and only then did I notice that christian music was being played over the loud speaker. I asked the employee, Amanda, if it could be changed to something more appropriate for all families‚Äîchildren‚Äôs music, perhaps‚Äîand she said that she didn‚Äôt have control over the station. After a few minutes I became even more uncomfortable so I simply asked for the volume to be turned down. My children and I were the only people in the store so I figured that this wouldn‚Äôt be a problem. Amanda walked towards the back, but did not make any noticeable change to the level of the volume. This was a huge challenge considering I had not only paid, but my kids had already begun playing and I wasn‚Äôt willing to cut their experience short.

We stayed and played and when it was time to leave, I spoke to Amanda to discuss my discomfort and she made it clear that we were not welcome in the space if we weren‚Äôt willing to be subjected to inappropriate christian music in what is advertised as a family space. She offered no apology and told me that had she known that I was that uncomfortable, that she would have offered a refund so that we could leave. Only after advocating for the refund myself was I able to get my money back.

The christian thing to do would have been to  create a welcoming and inclusive environment for all, but it is clear that the owners have limited their business to only those who practice christianity. Steer clear if you prefer that your kids not be exposed to religious indoctrination.

Reviewer: lewwni
Rating: 1/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: Two things to know:
1. My husband travels for work and my daughter and i often travel with him. Our favorite thing to do is explore indoor playgrounds when in a new area. All this to say, I‚Äôve been to A LOT of indoor playgrounds.
2. I only leave reviews publicly when a place is extraordinary or extraordinarily bad. I‚Äôm writing this one publicly in hopes of saving another family money and time.

Hands down, the worst indoor playground I‚Äôve ever experienced.

Firstly, the front desk employee was sitting in a corner on her phone when we walked in. She looked up and saw us and carried on with what she was doing. After about two minutes of this she begrudgingly walked over and the greeting we were given was: ‚Äúyou do know we close at 8 right?‚Äù not even a hello. To which I replied, ‚Äúyes.‚Äù It was 6pm so I understood the attempt to make sure I was informed, but that wasn‚Äôt the intent as she followed with: ‚Äúwe WILL close at 8pm, the lights will be cut off at 8:20 and you still have to pay full price.‚Äù Trying to stay positive I said ‚Äúi understand, it‚Äôs no problem.‚Äù She made it very clear that she did not want to be there and that she did not want us there. I‚Äôve never had a more miserable encounter. She talked so fast and low that I could barley understand anything she said and when I asked her to repeat, she made no adjustment, rather pointed to something that explained what she said or repeated it the same.

It cost just my daughter and I $40 to play. We‚Äôve been to some incredibly nice indoor playgrounds, some in expensive locations, but this is the most I have ever paid, by far. My daughter is three and very chill, so she‚Äôs right on the cusp of wanting to be in the toddler area and wanting to explore the ‚Äúbig kid‚Äù area. So, you can pay $15 for your kid to play in the toddler zone, which is a tiny area more targeted for babies or $25 for everything. ‚ÄúEverything‚Äù being the toddler area and ‚Äúbig kid‚Äù play area; not the arcade, ropes course or the slides. Which the ropes course area and fun slides weren‚Äôt even opened. I know all of this because I asked and instead of talking me through it she pointed to a sign I could read. So it was $25 for my toddler, $2 for me to be with her and $10 for both of us a pair of socks. We brought our own grip socks, as we do this a lot, but it was ‚Äúmandatory‚Äù that we each have $5 funville socks. I have NEVER been required to buy socks if I brought our own. After I paid this, I was reminded again of the closing time and sent on my way with no further instruction. I had to ask ‚Äúis that everything‚Äù because she was so vague and unbothered.

I didn‚Äôt see anything being cleaned until 7pm, when they started closing. Yes, closing down so heavily that I had to find another employee (the only other employee I saw) to make sure they closed at 8pm (even though I had been told this several times.) There is ball section in the big kid area that allows kids to press buttons that cut on air and do fun things. It was very neat and my daughter LOVED this part, however only TWO out of the 8-10 machines they had actually worked. They also have air guns that you can shoot the balls out of, probably 15, none of them worked. At 7pm with NO warning, they shut all the air off. In the middle of my daughter and I playing the air suddenly cuts off and the employee that ‚Äúgreeted‚Äù us came in with a bag and started rounding them up. It took me a second to figure out what was going on it was so abrupt. They were pretty much pushing us out of the door at 7pm. We left at 7:38pm (not the last to leave, still several kids playing) and it felt like we were about to get the lights cut out on us. They actually made an announcement stating that lights cut off at 8:20.

All in all, it just felt like a huge scam. Half of the attractions were shut down, others closed an hour early, being required to wear funville socks, shutting down at 7, it was all too much. A few of those things I can handle, but all of that and for $40?! I would not recommend this place to anyone. Please do not waste your money here.

Review: This place is so fun!  It is located by the old Chesapeake mall.  There is a burger restaurant in the same parking lot.  They do serve food though.  I saw people eating pizza fries and soda.  There is a QR code on each table you can order from.  This is a great indoor play area. Many levels of fun for kids of all ages. The colors were bright and vibrant and fun at the same time. The play area for toddlers was large and well thought out with many safe things to keep kids busy. It was for kids under 3 foot tall.  My son loved it. A multi level play area for kids older than toddlers maybe up to pre teens.  More than enough physical activities to keep your kids busy for a few hours.  You need a power card type thing to play at the arcade though but modern and fun.  Staff was polite from the time we entered until we left.  The front desk clerk was understanding of my son‚Äôs disability and allowed me to wear an entrance band on my wrist instead of him.  The lady that was in the play area with the kids was very attentive to the entire play area.  There was also a lady in charge of the large slides and she was kind to my son who ran over several times but was then scared to do the slide.  We drove 50 minutes to check it out and were glad we did. My son loves it here. I‚Äôm sure we‚Äôll be back soon.  This is a good place for a rainy day afternoon.  The only thing I didn‚Äôt like was the price.  We paid $40 for my son and husband to each get a pair of socks and to have free play for 2 hours.

Review: Kid Zone is a hidden gem in Powell, offering a fun and safe indoor playground perfect for young children. As soon as you walk in, you‚Äôre greeted with a clean, vibrant space filled with a variety of activities for kids to enjoy. There are climbing structures, slides, and even a soft play area for toddlers, ensuring that children of all ages have something to do.

One of the best aspects of Kid Zone is how well-organized and well-maintained the facility is. You can tell that cleanliness is a priority, which gives parents peace of mind as their children explore and play. The staff is friendly and attentive, making sure everyone has a good experience while keeping the environment safe.

There are seating areas for parents, and they offer beverages to purchase, so you can relax while your kids burn off some energy.

Overall, Kid Zone is a fantastic place for kids to run, and play in a controlled and fun environment. It‚Äôs a great option for birthday parties or just to get out of the house on a rainy day. Definitely worth checking out if you‚Äôre in the Powell area!

Reviewer: Tori Scott
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 days ago
Review: This is a hidden gem! I have been wanting to come here with my two children, who have ADHD & different levels of Autism, my son, who is 11, and my daughter, who just turned 6, since they opened. We never had a chance to visit until yesterday (Saturday, June 28, 2025) when we were invited with some friends who are members. My oldest had a blast with the arcade games, the climbing areas, and just being indoors in general in a safe environment to help escape this heat. The facility is card only, which was no issue for us, thankfully. The machine to dispense the game card even took tap to pay, so my son was able to use some Apple Cash he had to load a new game card.

Francine was very helpful when checking in with explaining the waiver, the process since it was our first time, and swatting any of those pesky flies that snuck through the door. They didn't get far because Francine was on it in the lobby, swatting left and right, taking out those summer nuances. Liz with the killer nails (can't wait to see what design she has on our next visit) helped when we needed to check out from the snack bar, which I was very impressed with the selections that are offered. She is very personable and a great asset to the front desk. Kyrsten knew exactly what I needed on this 100 degree day when I ordered a fountain Sundrop because she came in clutch, offering extra ice! I was like, Yessssss please! I was praising the facility already, and they told me where to leave the review, so here I am!

Plum Krazy Play is now a staple in our neurodivergent family! Not only because it is a safe place I can let my children play inside with added sensory play when needed, I can get a fountain Sundrop, AND I can get some adult interactions in.... I say sign me up! We are discussing membership as a family and looking at all the calendar events, including Sensory Wednesday, which is probably going to be the first time I bring my daughter. Can't wait to come again!

As an added bonus, the facility is a Pok√©mon Gym if anyone plays Pok√©mon Go ;)

The wonderful woman who worked there‚ÄîFrancine‚Äîhelped me contact the non-emergency police line and entertained my little guy with tap dance moves and lemonade. She made him feel like a million bucks and I could tell she genuinely loved him and was interested in what he had to say. She even let him help behind the counter for a sec while I got my car unlocked. Amazing staff, amazing place! Highly recommend!

Review: First time coming today and it was great! The staff is very nice, explained everything well. We came at 12:30 and it was very calm, maybe four families with their kids. They have clear bins and totes to hold your belongings together like your shoes as shoes aren‚Äôt allowed once inside the play area but they have plenty of tables and chairs in front and around the play area to see your kids playing. Lockers are available as well. The entry to the play area is locked and only staff can let people in and out which I love so kids can‚Äôt run out. We have been to other types of play places similar to this but they didn‚Äôt have the area secured like they do here so kids easily went to the front door. Everything is very clean and organized nicely. The music playing is kidz bop so kid friendly and not at an obnoxious sound level either which is great for me personally as my son is autistic. Also found out they can dim the lights and turn the music down more for sensory friendly environment with those needing it or those who request it. The prices for snacks is good as well. They also informed us that we can leave and come back with our receipt as the price for entry is an all day pass. This would be a great place for a party with everything they offer and the experience we‚Äôve had.

Reviewer: Daniel Brown
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 weeks ago
Review: We had an absolute blast at Down to Play! This indoor playground is a paradise for kids, with clean play structures, slides, ball pits, and a dedicated toddler area that kept my 6-year-old entertained for hours. The staff were super friendly and attentive, ensuring everything was safe and spotless. I loved the cozy parent lounge, a lifesaver for getting a moment to relax while the kids played. The no-shoes policy keeps things hygienic, and the variety of activities like the interactive dance floor and climbing walls meant there was something for kids of all ages. Highly recommend for a fun, stress-free day out with the family.

Reviewer: Sam Eileen
Rating: 5/5
Time: 2 weeks ago
Review: I am SO happy this place exists in Maryville. It took a while to get there, but today I finally took my 6 year old son. He has autism and eloping is part of that. Parks, and open public spaces are a no go, because he will run. It is very limiting and keeps us from going most places.  Today we went here after school and he had such a great time. The play area was so perfect for him. He was able to run around free and he didn't stop for the nearly hour and half we were there. The play equipment was all really great. The bouncy slide area was his favorite but really enjoyed the regular slides too. I brought him home and for the first time pretty much ever, he sat down and relaxed. He was worn out. This place will become our second home and I am so thankful they were so accommodating. The prices were much lower than I had anticipated. Which is rare these days.  The ONLY complaint I have is not about this place nor the staff but about parents not watching over their children a bit better. But I guess that is the appeal. To bring your kids and get a breather from them for a second. Not everyone has children with special needs that require constant supervision, so maybe I'm jealous of their freedom. üòÇ Regardless I couldn't be more pleased with our first visit!

Reviewer: A
Rating: 3/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Little Valley Play Cafe has a lot of potential, I feel the space they're in very much limits that potential. I took my little one here to try it out. The front desk area is tiny making it difficult for everyone to both check-in + grab your shoes (they make you put your shoes in a small cubby at the front upon arrival) as you're trying to leave. I do love that it's gated at the entry so no kid can escape. I did not feel the staff I encountered was very friendly. I had trouble opening the gate and she didn't help but another patron did. I do not like that they don't allow you to bring in your own food. I already pay for coming there, I don't want to buy the snacks you have. I don't eat lots of the ingredients in these foods and snacks and I don't want a dessert coffee every time I go. I like the idea of the cafe, I do understand it needs to be profitable, but my family doesn't eat what they serve. Makes it hard when other indoor playgrounds we can bring food in and eat at their designated tables. I don't like that so much of the space is taken by tables and chairs for parents. A lot of parents were sitting at the stools by the wall watching their kids. And then they leave their left drinks on that wall which leaves the drinks open for little kids to come and drink from them before their parent can stop them. I also didn't like that in order to go use the restroom you have to wear your socks. I'd like to be wearing shoes when I go in a bathroom... That's gross. And then any germs from the bathroom are now on socks that are walked around in the play area. I will say that bathrooms were pretty clean when I visited which is very necessary and appreciated. The themed play stations were great, my little one loved them. I love how creative they were designing that. I did not love that a good chunk of space was taken up for a party area. I just don't see how this space was a good choice for an indoor playground. I think this place could be amazing with some improvements. Customer service is very important and employee/owner attitudes I feel set the tone overall. I look forward to watching this place improve and hopefully grow.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Elisabeth Fouts
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: First the helpful things to know, then I‚Äôll give you the reason for my 5-start review :)
1. Check the hours and get there early. They often have a line outside to get in and they reach capacity often.
2. Be sure that the kids and guardians wear or bring grippy socks. If you don‚Äôt have any or forget, they do sell them there for a very reasonable price.
OK, now onto the reason for my review.
I can‚Äôt say enough great things about the Little Valley Play Cafe and the staff! I went to a birthday party here and everything was magical! The staff arranged for all the decor and the food and of course provided a very clean, safe space to play. I enjoyed playing with the kids in the play areas at first. Then sat by and watched as they continued, while I sipped a delicious latte from their coffee bar. It‚Äôs so much easier to keep an eye on the kids with their open floor plan and safety gate. If you have or care for kids under 6, this place is a must. Great for birthday parties, rainy or cold days, or any day really. Whenever you go, you and the kids will be in for a real treat!

Reviewer: Jessica Winspear
Rating: 5/5

Review: Just Go!! I visited this week to check it out for the first time with my 2 kids since opening with a friend and her 2 kids. It was an absolute blast! We ended up going a second time because it was so much fun -- and not to mention the coffee was fantastic!

There was an incident that happened while we were there of no ones fault, but I watched the owner take amazing care of this sweet boy. After he was all taken care of, they offered him a Good 2 Grow Juice and he got to pick his top. He was back playing in no time. It's always great to see how much an owner cares about their patrons.

Love this place and look forward to it becoming a regular stop for us. I will say it can get busy in the late mornings/afternoons, but I love to see the success of a new business in town. If you want to visit when it's a little quieter, I recommend going in the earlier morning hours.

The owners did amazing job of thinking through things. There is so many fun sections for the kids and the quality of the cafe is top notch. A great new spot in town!

Reviewer: Haley Johnson

Review: Yes, I'm posting a picture of the shelf in the bathroom. Why?

Because today, when I took my toddler to play and stepped into the restroom, what I saw captured everything I'd felt since we came through the door.

At Little Valley, I truly felt that my son and I were so welcome exactly as we are. It is CLEAR that this place is run by fellow mamas; every little detail has been considered! The layout is designed so caregivers can watch their little ones while they sip delicious drinks--and by the way, those drinks are hand-delivered to you, so you don't have to take eyes off your child.

But back to the bathroom shelf. Here you see tampons, baby wipes, breath mints, dental flossers, doggy bags (iykyk), and more. They've stocked everything a mama might need to take care of herself AND her baby in there, and they've done it in a way that is more beautiful than it has to be.

I knew I was taking my baby for a treat today. I just didn't know I was giving myself one too. We can't wait to return.

Review: We hosted my daughter‚Äôs 2nd birthday party at Shelby Play Place, and it was absolutely perfect! The space was the ideal size‚Äînot too big or overwhelming, but just right for the kids to explore and play comfortably while parents could easily keep an eye on them. The entire place was spotless, and the pricing was super affordable for everything included.

Kayleigh Melton, the owner, was incredible to work with. She maintained excellent communication throughout the planning process and went above and beyond to accommodate all of our needs. She really pays attention to the small details, like providing bathroom amenities specifically for little ones and ensuring the space was safe and secure for all kids.

One thing that truly stood out was that parents are allowed to get on all the play equipment with the kids. This was a huge relief since we have a little one who is sometimes a bit hesitant. So many other indoor play areas don‚Äôt allow this, but here, it made all the difference!

This play place made for a stress-free, fun, and memorable celebration. I couldn‚Äôt recommend it enough! Thank you, Kayleigh, for helping make my daughter‚Äôs special day so wonderful!

Review: I don't normally write reviews but I'm going to this time because of Karen's running the place down. I have took my 14 month old twice and this past weekend went with my nieces, nephews, stepdaughter, and my daughter. Ages (2) 17, 14, 13, 10, and 14 months. Got into a debate on facebook about the cleanliness of this place. All of the kids have had a blast both times I went. I see nothing wrong with the cleanliness of this place. People on Facebook were downing this place and saying the one in mooresville was cleaner, I can't comment on the one in mooresville as I've never been there. But from what I have gathered the fun factory cleans just as much as that one does. My thoughts are that the fun factory is in a older building and it's not in mooresville where a bunch of rich Karen's live. Therefore Karen's want to put this place down. We have not gotten sick either time from going here and see nothing wrong with it. My only complaint would be the older kids going into the toddler section. I would like to see this place stay for years to come where I have somewhere to take my 14 month old to play, but if everyone keeps it up they may go under for no reason other than it's not new and fancy enough for the local white SUV Starbucks drinking Karen's.
