A few minutes later a young man who worked there said he had an owners card that would allow him to play the game and try to win my son a duck. After about 5 or so tries he finally won him one and my son was so excited. I realize they didn't have to do that, but I greatly appreciate that they did. It is those small acts of kindness that can make a kids day. We will be back üòä

Review: This was my first and last time visiting the fun factory! I do not EVER recommend anyone purchasing tickets any ‚Äúspecial‚Äù event‚Ä¶ this place is pure chaos. I purchased tickets for the Elsa Ball to take my 4 year old. Upon arriving, the manager put a green wristband on my daughter‚Äôs wrist and explained there were not enough seats for parents and the seats were for the children attending the event which was perfectly fine! As soon as we get in there are parents sitting in every seat. This event was on a time schedule and when it came time for them to ‚Äúsit down and have a special snack‚Äù that was a complete joke. I asked the gentleman SEVERAL TIMES if my daughter could have a plate with a snack and she never received it, she had nowhere to sit because management couldn‚Äôt tell parents to get out of the chairs designated for the children. I saw the gentleman hand multiple kids snacks that weren‚Äôt even there for the event. Disappointed is an understatement. The majority of parents were complaining because it was so unprofessional, unorganized, rude, & flat out a waste of time and money. 0/10 recommend this place of business.

We drove 30 minutes for a complete disappointment. The entire building got to come up push other kids who were there for Elsa. I don‚Äôt know who your manager is but she was absolutely no help at all. She looked like a deer in headlights, no professionalism didn‚Äôt take accountability for anything. We paid to be there for a cracker and a piece of warm cheese. Spent more time waiting for a teenager to paint my kids face w some glitter then anything else. It was super crowded, the "reserved" seats for the children that paid for Elsa were taken by the parents, so when the 2 crackers and 2 pieces of cheese were passed around, only a handful of kids got that special treat. Face painting started at 6 by 1 painter, yes 1 for that huge crowd, but so did Olaf's special appearance. So which line do you choose?? We stayed in the face painting line and then Elsa appears.  We missed that too because every kid in the buidling jumped in front even if they were not there for the Elsa ball. There was no organization and nobody making sure that the kids signed up for the ball were getting to participate. We asked the "manager" many times to help us understand this chaos but she was clueless. The only thing that we got from this event was a picture with Elsa as she was ready to leave and the kids were starting to clear our. Review: I regularly come here during the week with my almost 2 year old. Today was the first time I came on a Saturday. It. Was. Awful. They take reservations on Saturday and Sunday to keep the crowd at a minimum (or so they say), but this place was a madhouse from the second I stepped in. Because all age groups of children are welcome here, there were teenagers and rambunctious pre-teens everywhere. Some of them were lifting up the panels at the top of the stairs in the playground creating a fall hazard. Others were underneath making barriers where other children couldn't pass. It was also impossible to let my daughter play on the trampoline part because of so many unattended children being wild. It was also difficult to keep up with my daughter because there were so many people standing around. I had told my sister about this place and she was there too with her 7 month old and two older children. I was honestly embarrassed that I had recommended this place. I left quickly because it wasn't worth putting my small child in danger due to overcrowding and unsupervised children. I will continue to come here on weekdays, but if you have any kid under 7 or 8 years of age, do yourself a favor and skip it on the weekends.

Review: I've taken my toddler here to play a handful of times, and I've always been so impressed with the cleanliness and the sweet staff members ready to help in whatever way they can. We decided to have our girl's 2nd birthday party here, and the day could not have been more perfect. The staff members were extremely helpful in making sure that we had everything that we needed. They were ready to help as soon as we walked in to set up, they were right there ready to help during the party, and even during the clean up. The schedule of events couldn't have been more perfect. Play time was for a hour and 15 minutes, and the last 45 minutes was dedicated to the party room for pizza and drinks. Sprouts took care of ordering all of the pizzas and even providing drinks!! The kids were allowed to run and play, while the parents were able to talk amongst each other without having to worry too hard about making sure every kid was safe. The layout of the indoor playground is so spacious and open - so it is easy to have eyes on your child at all times. I will always recommend Sprouts to anyone looking to entertain their children in a safe, clean and fun environment.

When we arrived the girl told us that because we had the last reserved spot of the day we needed to leave at the 1 hour mark because they needed time to clean and sanitize everything. So we were asked to leave at 5:30 when we paid until 5:45. It says on the door that they close at 6:00 p.m. The employee locked the door right behind us. I asked her why we were not told when we reserved the spot that it would be a different play time and she said she would have to look but never followed up with us and was instead behind the counter on her cell phone the entire time. She started cleaning with strong smelling chemicals before we were even done with our hour of playtime. This is something that I did not appreciate since I am pregnant.
If these are the rules, that should have been told to us when we reserved our spot, or our playtime should have been credited back or applied to another playtime. Will not be spending our money here again.

Reviewer: Denise Infante
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I love bringing my two and three-year-old to this cafe. It's a place I frequently visit with my husband or other mommies. The atmosphere is very clean, and I always look forward to their delicious vanilla lattes and waffles! The staff behind the counter consistently greet everyone with smiles and work their tails off to serve us. The location is also low sensory which I appreciate as a former special education advocate.

While the location is a bit cramped, I believe this is partly due to families placing their belongings on the tables, which can limit space, especially for those who are dining. It would be wonderful if patrons could utilize the cubbies provided to help create a more enjoyable dining experience for everyone. Additionally, I think it would be beneficial if parents could take a more active role in supervising their children and encouraging them to return items to their proper places. My daughter loves playing in the kitchen area, but it often seems empty. Parents joining their kids on the slide should bear in mind that they move all the balls when they slide down. My son hit his head on the back of the slide because the balls had been removed from a parent sliding down.

I truly believe that creating a welcoming environment is a shared responsibility within our community. If you‚Äôre visiting, it would be wonderful if you could encourage your little one to practice responsibility. I also wish there were opportunities to explore memberships! Otherwise, great location!

Reviewer: Sara G
Rating: 3/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: I enjoy bringing my 16 month old baby here during the week when it tends to be slow, however we brought her recently when there were more older kids running around. The kids were super rowdy, chasing one another around and pelting each other with balls both inside and outside of the ball pit (I got hit hard in the side of the head). They kept climbing up the slides and the parents were way more interested in socializing amongst each other than actually parenting their kids. An announcement was made regarding the kids' behavior, but unfortunately none of us could understand what was being said over the loudspeaker and nothing was done by employees OR parents when the behavior continued. We didn't feel it was safe for our baby to keep playing so we left after about an hour, which felt like a waste of money, as we usually stay for the full two hours. We love Playland, but it would be so much better if there were designated areas by age group, or at least if the rules of safe play were actually enforced. Also, after a few times of coming, we've never once seen employees disinfecting the play area, and as another reviewer mentioned, the baby changing table in the women's restroom isn't bolted to the counter, so it slides around if you have a squirmy baby. We'll still keep coming here, but I was disappointed by our most recent visit.

Reviewer: L J
Rating: 4/5
Time: 6 months ago
Review: Our 3 year old loved Angel Island Fun Park. We went on a Friday afternoon. Not crowded at all. They have several reasonable payment options and a waiver you sign via scanning a bar code or doing it online. We opted for the $20 one-time visit (there's a 59 monthly option or a $72 punch card option plus more options). The $20 one-time play option was good for 3hrs of play! üòé We also purchased $3 non slip socks, so bring your own and save some cash. They also offer snacks and drinks for purchase (didn't see any hot food options), or I think you can bring your own snack and sit at the tables, check with the store. We did see children with their own water bottles in the sitting area.  I know they told us no food or beverages in the play area. They have a cubby for shoes. Free "community" flip flops for bathroom use (must remove your shoes for bathroom use) Im guessing you can bring your own disposable foot coverings if you're uncomfortable using the public flops, ask the store. The restroom was clean and so was the play area - soft padding for little ones. Our 3 year old navigated the play area on his own, under our watchful eyes. Parents can sit at the little tables outside the play area with a full view. The play area is also fenced with open entrances so you can stand and watch your kiddos. There's also two pay-as-you-go massage chairs in the sitting area against the wall - you can relax while getting a massage. If I recall correctly, the cost was about $5 per 10-15 minutes. I believe their website states this play place iso ages 8 and under. Parking was ok but the place is in a small plaza and if they get super busy it looks like parking could be an issue. We enjoyed our time and will be back soon. We recommend!

Which is especially nice to see during the winter months when it‚Äôs sick season! I have never seen an indoor play space with the staff this nice and the facility this clean. I loved there was plenty to do for my girls but it wasn‚Äôt too big that I was having to run around everywhere looking for them. There‚Äôs also a vending machine that has drinks and snacks. Which was a lifesaver when they build up an appetite playing! 10/10 recommend!

Review: I don't normally write reviews but I'm going to this time because of Karen's running the place down. I have took my 14 month old twice and this past weekend went with my nieces, nephews, stepdaughter, and my daughter. Ages (2) 17, 14, 13, 10, and 14 months. Got into a debate on facebook about the cleanliness of this place. All of the kids have had a blast both times I went. I see nothing wrong with the cleanliness of this place. People on Facebook were downing this place and saying the one in mooresville was cleaner, I can't comment on the one in mooresville as I've never been there. But from what I have gathered the fun factory cleans just as much as that one does. My thoughts are that the fun factory is in a older building and it's not in mooresville where a bunch of rich Karen's live. Therefore Karen's want to put this place down. We have not gotten sick either time from going here and see nothing wrong with it. My only complaint would be the older kids going into the toddler section. I would like to see this place stay for years to come where I have somewhere to take my 14 month old to play, but if everyone keeps it up they may go under for no reason other than it's not new and fancy enough for the local white SUV Starbucks drinking Karen's.

I think capacity limits would be good on weekends as well, especially with birthday parties. Like I said I think older kids would love it, but if you‚Äôre going to market a toddler area for the younger kids make it an actual area where only toddlers are.

Review: I regularly come here during the week with my almost 2 year old. Today was the first time I came on a Saturday. It. Was. Awful. They take reservations on Saturday and Sunday to keep the crowd at a minimum (or so they say), but this place was a madhouse from the second I stepped in. Because all age groups of children are welcome here, there were teenagers and rambunctious pre-teens everywhere. Some of them were lifting up the panels at the top of the stairs in the playground creating a fall hazard. Others were underneath making barriers where other children couldn't pass. It was also impossible to let my daughter play on the trampoline part because of so many unattended children being wild. It was also difficult to keep up with my daughter because there were so many people standing around. I had told my sister about this place and she was there too with her 7 month old and two older children. I was honestly embarrassed that I had recommended this place. I left quickly because it wasn't worth putting my small child in danger due to overcrowding and unsupervised children. I will continue to come here on weekdays, but if you have any kid under 7 or 8 years of age, do yourself a favor and skip it on the weekends.

Reviewer: Luanne Pettit
Rating: 1/5
Time: a week ago
Review: The only reason I even gave one star is because the place seemed pretty clean. My son booked his daughter's birthday party here, and we will never book here again.  When you pay over $300 for 2 pizzas and water, a host, 2 hours of room time, and unlimited play, you expect to get what you pay for.  It is overpriced, you don't get what you pay for, and the employees dont seem to want to be there. First off, when we arrived, they changed the price that was quoted to him, and he was charged more than what was agreed upon. The employee didn't seem to care and didn't really try to explain the discrepancy.   The tv they have with advertisements shows that first responders get free admission. When she was asked about it, she just said no, it's 10% off. No explanation. When questioned about what it said on the screen, it seemed to make her mad that she had to go clarify with someone else. Very poor customer service. There was supposed to be a host for the party, but we only saw her once when the pizzas were brought out. (The same person that checked us in) The playtime is supposed to be "all day" and "unlimited", but when they arrived an hour early as was stated that they were supposed to do, only to be turned away and told to come back 15 minutes prior. The party was at 4 pm. The so-called unlimited play is definitely not unlimited. They only had 3 people on staff that we could see. That is ridiculous for a place that big, with parties scheduled. There's no wonder that the party "host" only showed once. The 2 hours of private room time is cut short, too, because they want you out 15 minutes prior to clean up. I understand that, but when you do follow the rules, then it's at least another 30 minutes before they come to clean the room. Why were you told to leave? The party next to ours had the same time frame and were still in the room another hour after their set time and were never bothered. Had we known that we would have stayed. Overall, this place is just a huge letdown. Next time, we will book at Chuck E Cheese. You at least know what you are getting there. And they have gluten-free options, too.

Reviewer: goldie lane
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: Last weekend 4/27/2025, my daughter had her 6th birthday party here.  We arrived 30 mins prior, signed the paperwork and paid the remaining balance.  The young lady who checked us in was great.  She told us that our room wasn't ready but she was gonna go clean it and then we could set up. That process was smooth . Things went downhill from there.  Upon arrival in the room,  we noticed that it was super hot so we opened the door to let some air in. The temperature never really got better, so i found the young lady and asked her if the air was working she said that maintenance had been by and said they fixed it.  As my guests began arriving,  it got worse.  It was so bad,  we had to share the portable fans and few guests brought.  I constantly asked the staff to turn on the A.c. with the same response as before.  So we move on to the pizza.  I ordered an extra pizza for the parents and when the 2 bday pizzas and extra ones came out. 2 of them were burnt. We had to send them back, with hungry kids asking for more pizza. I also ordered pitchers of fountain drinks.  They were out of everything I asked for, except sprite. Not only were they out,  I had to go and pick up the pitchers myself.  I also had to serve the pizzas,  cake and clean up after the kids ate the pizza in order to make space for them to have desserts. We looked around for staff to assist us with the party,  but the 3 of them were stretched so thin we could never track them down.  This was the worst party I've ever paid for.  From extreme heat to the burnt pizza, no staff to assist.  It was just terrible. No one offered any alternatives, no assistance,  nothing.  Since that day,  I called the customer service line a few times and have heard nothing back. Customer service is lacking, besides for the young lady who checked us in.  If y'all are going to charge so much money for a party,  you all need to have the resources to accommodate each party.  When we book these parties,  we book them with the understanding that we are gonna get what we're paying for,  ie; un burnt pizza, fountain drinks that are listed, assistance during the party, air conditioned rooms that seats several people etc. I will never book with you all Again and I'll make sure my loved ones do not either. Just terrible.....

-----------------------

Reviewer: Patricia Mauragas
Rating: 2/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: Booked a party here. If I had just brought my kid here to have fun on a Saturday morning, I‚Äôd leave a 5 star review.

The pros:
The play place is VERY clean. The tunnels and slides seem well attended to. Over all the facilities are great.

The cons:

-after paying for a party package, paying for extra people on top of the party package, and paying for food- we were informed that no outside food is allowed. No veggie trays, no fruit, no drinks. It was over $80 for 12 juice boxes, they do not offer any semblance of fruit, veg or fiber. If this was offered, I would understand no outside food- but the fact is, their soda machine was down and all they have is pizza that isn‚Äôt even little ceasar quality and candy bars. If you don‚Äôt offer it and people have booked a party with you, the fair thing is to allow them to bring it.

- the place is not equipped with an intercom of any kind, so you cut your kids loose to go play- pizza comes, you want to get all those kids back in that room? Good luck - they‚Äôre in the tunnel maze.

- they started prompting us out of the room by 1:00. Our party was 11:30-1:30. If we only get 15 minutes to set up, don‚Äôt rush us out without offering help. It‚Äôs rude.

- customer service was non existent, no one offered to help us clean, they seemed inconvenienced that we had left shoes in the room.

- no one wished my child happy birthday.

Lame.

Review: Just had my daughters birthday party here and was probably the worst experience I've had, not to mention the most expensive. Not to mention, there wasn't enough cups or plates either, but that's okay we brought our own. Save yourself some money and go to urban air or a skating rink if your having a birthday party for more than just your immediate family.}

Review: Amazing experience, and so happy we visited today. I was nervous it would be a long drive, but it's right off the highway, making it a short trip. The coffee shop has lots of goodies including snacks and drinks for kids, the bathrooms come with a step stool and changing table, and the couch is comfortable. Bring your laptop and use their wifi at any of the tables, and let your little play while you work AND your house stays clean. There's multiple play areas with a house, a construction area, a climbing and slide set, dress up clothes, and even a separate area for 2 and under. I wish we had visited sooner, and if you visit more than once a week, the membership is worth it, but you'll be here more often! This is the perfect place to bring your kids!

Reviewer: J B
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: PARENTS BEWARE! Read your waiver agreement CAREFULLY. I was invited to a birthday party by some friends, I guess I was the only one in the group to read the waiver. When you sign the Village Play waiver, it goes beyond the obligation of holding Village Play harmless. You will also agree to ‚Äúindemnify and defend‚Äù Village Play. For those of you who don't know legalese, when you agree to indemnify and defend a business you agree to take on and/or reimburse all legal costs on their behalf. This includes ALL attorney‚Äôs fees, court cost, and judgments. This could make it possible if your child is involved in another child's injury and the other parent decides to sue you and Village Play, not only would you have to pay an attorney for your own defense, but you will also have to pay for Village Plays representation, costs, and judgements. Additionally, this could also make it if a parent sues Village Play for an incident that involved you or your child, Village Play could also forward you the bill for their legal cost because you have agreed to defend them in court and reimburse their fees. Such agreements may also make it possible for you as a parent to burden such expenses under the most loose of connections. In my opinion, these are terrible clauses and even worse business practices. Holding harmless clauses are strong enough defenses for a children‚Äôs business, but clauses to agree to indemnify and defend is a highly offensive legal approach that has the potential to financially decimate an average household income. Unless such verbiage were to be removed from an agreement, I would advise staying FAR away from a children-centered business that implements such measures and consider an alternative place to bring my children and/or host events. In my opinion, Village Play falls in the same category as the chain trampoline parks deserves one star for this practice.

Every table was taken with kids waiting so it was clear we were never going to get a chance to play. I left with two really upset and crying kids who were looking forward to somewhere new. They should really post this information online and give new patrons a heads up about their process. We were looking forward to a fun morning and checking out a place to host my daughters 2nd birthday.  We will not be returning as it was not worth our time and money. Reviewer: Alyssa Watson
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited 3 years ago
Review: So I hate to be a Debbie downer here. I really do.

But I‚Äôve had friends who continuously recommended this place to me, so I finally decided to try it.

I went on Saturday afternoon and the same occurrences took place as this afternoon. So weekend or not this happens. I tried to give it a second chance.

I have a 1 year old and a 2 year old. The entire time we were there (2 hours the first time and 1 hour the next) there were much older children probably 6-10 years old who were running over my 2 year old. Then older kids were in the ‚Äúbaby‚Äù area running over my 1 year old. I did not feel relaxed whatsoever. I felt like I had to continuously stay under my children because older kids were taking their toys away from them, running over them, ect.

Parents do not pay attention to their children in this environment and it‚Äôs dangerous to younger kids.

Staff does not periodically clean up toys (at least they didn‚Äôt while we were there) so toys weren‚Äôt in the places they were supposed to be played in.. they were everywhere.

Staff does not enforce rules and parents do not watch their kids (of course staff cannot change this), but there HAS to be a better way to protect younger children. We go to many indoor playhouses in the upstate and we have never had issues like this.

Over the course of the time we were here today, my friends child got knocked in the head with a shopping cart by an older child running and ended up with a goose egg on his head, older children took toys away from my toddler and baby, and older children pushed my toddler down the stairs.

A total waste of $40.

Edit: we actually came on Friday, then the following Thursday. I do appreciate the owners feedback and credit, but just because most younger kids come in the morning doesn‚Äôt mean they shouldn‚Äôt be able to play in peace on afternoon while older kids parents are supposed to be supervising.

Review: We recently celebrated our son Zayn‚Äôs 3rd birthday at Piney Town Play Space, and it was truly a five-star experience from start to finish!

The theme was George from Peppa Pig, and Courtney along with the amazing staff absolutely delivered. Every detail was thoughtful, colorful, and perfect for the occasion. The kids had a blast, and the entire event was so well-organized that we could actually relax and enjoy it.

We initially had some concerns because we invited a big group of friends, and we were worried the space might be too small or that we‚Äôd somehow be over capacity ‚Äî but the space was HUGE! It was more than enough for everyone to play, mingle, and celebrate comfortably. Courtney, the owner, even called me personally before the party to check in, reassure me, and make sure we were confident in moving forward ‚Äî that level of personal care really meant a lot.

We chose the Pandarosa package, which included 48 cupcakes, sweet tea, lemonade, chicken trays for the adults (so delicious!), and 7 large pizzas for the kids. There was plenty of food and even some left over ‚Äî they really thought of everything.

Special shoutout to Ede, Railey, and Madison who were absolutely wonderful ‚Äî so helpful, kind, and attentive throughout the entire party. Their energy made the day even more special.

Overall, Piney Town made Zayn‚Äôs 3rd birthday unforgettable. Everything was smooth, stress-free, and full of joy. We can‚Äôt thank Courtney and her team enough, and we highly recommend Piney Town Play Space to anyone looking for the perfect place¬†to¬†celebrate!

Reviewer: Stephanie Gillespie
Rating: 5/5
Time: Edited a year ago
Review: EDITED 2/9/24: I said I would never come back here but I have eaten my words and have changed my review from 1-star to 5-stars. The new owners are amazing and have really turned this place around. They have restructured the play area, now offer snacks and coffee, and provide more supervision during play time. They even offer events each month and have extended their hours to include afternoon play times! Piney Town has gone from being the worst indoor play place around to the best, by far.

I never thought I would be writing this review or have a membership (because we are there at least once per week), but here we are.
_______________________________________________________________
THIS REVIEW WAS FOR THE PLAYHOUSE MUSEUM...BEFORE THEY CHANGED OWNERSHIP.
My issue is not really with the Playhouse itself but more the culture there. We have been 3 times and the facility itself is great and the staff are always super friendly but, some parents don‚Äôt watch their kids AT ALL.

Every time we have been there has been an issue with at least one kid pushing or shoving or taking toys from other kids (just being kids), but there is no redirection or even acknowledgement from the parent.

Until today, I just chalked it up to differences in parenting and it wasn‚Äôt a deal-breaker for me. As a stay-at-home mom, I totally understand needing a break and wanting to let your kids figure things out socially for themselves. However, today, my child was playing on the fire truck and sitting in the driver seat, when a child literally picked him up out of the seat and threw him out of the truck. I removed the child from the and out my very upset toddler back into the driver seat. I told the kid that he could play there when my kid was done.

The mother didn‚Äôt come over until much later and didn‚Äôt even ask me what happened. Instead she asked me ‚Äúdid you just put your hands on my child?‚Äù and didn‚Äôt even apologize when I told her what happened.

Again, I know this is not really the fault of The Playhouse Museum, but all the same, I don‚Äôt think this place is for us and we will not be returning.

Reviewer: Rachel Beam
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Short version - This is an exclusively christian business where anyone not interested in listing to inappropriate, adult christian music is not welcome to play.

We arrived at Funky Frogs for the first time this morning and my toddlers immediately took off and started to play after seeing the toys. I paid and signed a waiver and only then did I notice that christian music was being played over the loud speaker. I asked the employee, Amanda, if it could be changed to something more appropriate for all families‚Äîchildren‚Äôs music, perhaps‚Äîand she said that she didn‚Äôt have control over the station. After a few minutes I became even more uncomfortable so I simply asked for the volume to be turned down. My children and I were the only people in the store so I figured that this wouldn‚Äôt be a problem. Amanda walked towards the back, but did not make any noticeable change to the level of the volume. This was a huge challenge considering I had not only paid, but my kids had already begun playing and I wasn‚Äôt willing to cut their experience short.

We stayed and played and when it was time to leave, I spoke to Amanda to discuss my discomfort and she made it clear that we were not welcome in the space if we weren‚Äôt willing to be subjected to inappropriate christian music in what is advertised as a family space. She offered no apology and told me that had she known that I was that uncomfortable, that she would have offered a refund so that we could leave. Only after advocating for the refund myself was I able to get my money back.

The christian thing to do would have been to  create a welcoming and inclusive environment for all, but it is clear that the owners have limited their business to only those who practice christianity. Steer clear if you prefer that your kids not be exposed to religious indoctrination.

Reviewer: Megan Romero
Rating: 5/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: My friend and I visited each with 3 kids 4 and younger. It was great that they have a sibling discount, because with multiples, stuff can add up quickly. We walked in to a clean play space that was covered in toys the kids enjoyed playing with by the end of our 2 hour session. When we were leaving, the worker was cleaning and organizing for the next group to come in and do it all over again. They have a really nice coffee machine which I really appreciated, the coffee was delicious! Tables and a couch for parents and 2 highchairs for the babies. The bathroom and exit doors have a sound bell to prevent kids from escaping. The bathroom is stocked with baby wipes, poop bags, hair ties and even tampons. Our play time was full so there were a decent amount of kids and parents in the building but it didn't feel over crowded and didn't prevent the kids from playing with anything they wanted to play with. The blue "Elsa" dress was a big hit as well as the fireman hose. The only improvement I could suggest is having one more small couch for parents to sit on and I think it would be perfect! This was a fun place for the kids to let out some energy especially with all the rain we have been having lately. Will definitely recommend to other families!

Review: I've taken my toddler here to play a handful of times, and I've always been so impressed with the cleanliness and the sweet staff members ready to help in whatever way they can. We decided to have our girl's 2nd birthday party here, and the day could not have been more perfect. The staff members were extremely helpful in making sure that we had everything that we needed. They were ready to help as soon as we walked in to set up, they were right there ready to help during the party, and even during the clean up. The schedule of events couldn't have been more perfect. Play time was for a hour and 15 minutes, and the last 45 minutes was dedicated to the party room for pizza and drinks. Sprouts took care of ordering all of the pizzas and even providing drinks!! The kids were allowed to run and play, while the parents were able to talk amongst each other without having to worry too hard about making sure every kid was safe. The layout of the indoor playground is so spacious and open - so it is easy to have eyes on your child at all times. I will always recommend Sprouts to anyone looking to entertain their children in a safe, clean and fun environment.

Reviewer: Amanda Branscome
Rating: 3/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Really wanted to like this place but we paid $15 per child ($30 total )for a 75 min play time. When we arrived the girl told us that because we had the last reserved spot of the day we needed to leave at the 1 hour mark because they needed time to clean and sanitize everything. So we were asked to leave at 5:30 when we paid until 5:45. It says on the door that they close at 6:00 p.m. The employee locked the door right behind us. I asked her why we were not told when we reserved the spot that it would be a different play time and she said she would have to look but never followed up with us and was instead behind the counter on her cell phone the entire time. She started cleaning with strong smelling chemicals before we were even done with our hour of playtime. This is something that I did not appreciate since I am pregnant.
If these are the rules, that should have been told to us when we reserved our spot, or our playtime should have been credited back or applied to another playtime. Will not be spending our money here again.

Reviewer: Tori Scott
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 days ago
Review: This is a hidden gem! I have been wanting to come here with my two children, who have ADHD & different levels of Autism, my son, who is 11, and my daughter, who just turned 6, since they opened. We never had a chance to visit until yesterday (Saturday, June 28, 2025) when we were invited with some friends who are members. My oldest had a blast with the arcade games, the climbing areas, and just being indoors in general in a safe environment to help escape this heat. The facility is card only, which was no issue for us, thankfully. The machine to dispense the game card even took tap to pay, so my son was able to use some Apple Cash he had to load a new game card.

Francine was very helpful when checking in with explaining the waiver, the process since it was our first time, and swatting any of those pesky flies that snuck through the door. They didn't get far because Francine was on it in the lobby, swatting left and right, taking out those summer nuances. Liz with the killer nails (can't wait to see what design she has on our next visit) helped when we needed to check out from the snack bar, which I was very impressed with the selections that are offered. She is very personable and a great asset to the front desk. Kyrsten knew exactly what I needed on this 100 degree day when I ordered a fountain Sundrop because she came in clutch, offering extra ice! I was like, Yessssss please! I was praising the facility already, and they told me where to leave the review, so here I am!

Plum Krazy Play is now a staple in our neurodivergent family! Not only because it is a safe place I can let my children play inside with added sensory play when needed, I can get a fountain Sundrop, AND I can get some adult interactions in.... I say sign me up! We are discussing membership as a family and looking at all the calendar events, including Sensory Wednesday, which is probably going to be the first time I bring my daughter. Can't wait to come again!

As an added bonus, the facility is a Pok√©mon Gym if anyone plays Pok√©mon Go ;)

Reviewer: Richard
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: At 12:15 we are told that we can't enter with our 3 year old because "the current playtime is about to end and the next one doesn't start until 12:45". There ONE child currently in there playing. ONE! There are two parents with him. So, there are literally twice as many parents, including the staff, three times as many adults as children here. Still, our child can't come in, and we can't wait inside either for some odd reason. "You have to come back at 12:45" we are told. I point out the ONE child thing. Nope, come back at 12:45. I'm informed these rules "are strictly enforced and have been since covid". So, I asked "why have we not been turned away and told to come back at a designated time the last THREE times are three year old randomly decided she wanted to go there"? With a straight face, the girl behind the counter tells me, "well, it depends on who the staff members are that are that are working that day as to if the 'rules are enforced'". Have you ever tried to explain to a three year old, who's now throwing a fit because she can't play, that she has to go somewhere else and can't play because the wrong staff member is working that day? One last try. "Ma'am, there's one other kid in here, she's all excited to play, no one has ever mentioned this to us before".  Nope, come back at 12:45. ONE kid! I have no problems with there being rules. I do have a problem that only ONE staff member chooses to enforce them or even make them known. I do have a problem that we were allowed to pay and play three previous times and out of the 5 maybe 6 other staff members we've met, none of them ever mentioned these "strictly enforced" rules.
TLDR;
1)Whether or not your child can play without an appointment in a building with ONE other child, COMPLETELY depends on which staff members are working that day.
2)We did NOT return at 12:45
3)You are not allowed to use the restroom to change a toddlers diaper unless you pay. You can't pay until 12:45.

Review: 3 stars due to cost and needed maintenance and upkeep.

My daughter (3 years old) absolutely loves Megaplay. She has more fun here than she does at Zing Zumm and Altitute, both of which we have memberships for.

That said, I think Megaplay is prohibitively expensive as a place to take my daughter. Zing is $100 for an entire year, and for her and I to jump at Altitude 7 days a week for 2 hours at a time it's $40 a month. At Mega, there is no monthly option, so taking her just 3 times a month is as expensive as Altitude unlimited visits.

Can we get a membership option like everywhere else?

As for maintenance, the junglejims have many spots missing padding, covered in duct tape, equipment removed likely due to damage. The bounce houses have airleaks and tape all over.

I'm not posting this to bash, we really love it and would really love if we could go more often and see some much needed repairs. Thank you and please think about it!

Reviewer: Evangeline Jones
Rating: 1/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: On 11/15/2024 at approximately 10:02AM My son & I visited Mega play's Center. I am writing this review to raise awareness about discrimination faced by children with developmental delays during playtime. Office Manager of Megaplay left her office door open leaving a safety hazard to all children in this establishment my son entered her office to play on her play rug and we were verbally attacked by this Manager screaming for us to "get out of her office". I immediately attempted to explain my son is Autistic and this door should be closed. We were kicked out and I asked for a refund before I would leave. The Manager did grant this refund while speaking in a tone and demeanor not professional or fit for any type of leadership. As per the United Nations Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities which ensures disabled children have equal access to play and recreational activities my sons experience suggests that such principles were not upheld.  On behalf of my son, I would like to emphasize the need for this environment to become more nurturing and increase the ability for children to be able to thrive here. I am disappointed in my experience both women in this business lacked professionalism. maturity, and the ability to run an establishment properly by using conflict resolution this is a vulnerable child. You kicked him out because he entered your office and then screamed at a parent? I'm mortified...I ask anyone in this community don't allow your children to be treated like this. This business is unsafe, and follow-up will be taken to determine ratio per employees, cleanliness, and overall ability to operate properly. Staff training and creating a more inclusive environment should be required for this establishment to continue to operate.

Reviewer: Katelynn Burnett
Rating: 5/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: We rented the party room at Megaplay for my daughter‚Äôs 7th birthday this year. I am someone who really struggle with perfectionism and people pleasing. Thanks to this, party planning means a lot of stress for me. The folks at Megaplay were so kind and accommodating from the first moment I called. They had no problem answering every question I had before booking the room. They also explained clearly the fees and accommodations. In addition, they never made me feel uncomfortable or like an inconvenience for needing more clarification or for asking a second or third time. They also confirmed my time slot and accommodations twice before the date of the party. They made it clear they would do all the decorating all I had to do was drop off my supplies, and there was even an option to have them go buy the supplies for you (for an additional charge.)

All of that is great alone, but the staff really went above and beyond to support me. My daughter woke up sick the day of her party and I frantically called crying and defeated that everything was ruined. Not only did Megaplay have no problem rescheduling me, but the staff went out of there way to offer me reassurance and support that everything would be okay. Not as a customer, but as a stressed out mom thinking way too hard about a pokemon party. The reschedule affected the guest turnout pretty badly and I was fretting around in circles most of the party. Josh and Joyanna were right there for me the entire time. They checked with me every few minutes to make sure I was doing okay. They let me take the reins wherever I felt comfortable, but had no probably helping me direct the flow of the party in my stressed out state. I cannot count the number of times they told me ‚Äúif you need anything at all please don‚Äôt hesitate to let us know.‚Äù

The sincerity of the staff at Megaplay made every difference in the world for me. Thank you so much to Josh and Joyanna for having next level customer support. It was so clear my experience mattered to them as a person not just a customer. They were really able to help turn my entire mood about the party around. I‚Äôm so grateful this is where we chose to celebrate and I would give more stars if I could. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Reviewer: amanda stobaugh
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I've taken my son to play at Mega play several times now. During covid, they were on top of keeping it pretty clean. They stopped play time every hour to walk through and sanitize.  The equipment has always been a bit worn out, but this last visit, I was blown away. They have let this place go all the way downhill. 2 days after visiting this place, my son came down with a high-grade fever.

When we first arrived, the only thing I noticed was how HOT and muggy it was inside. Smelled like moldy gym socks. My son was too excited to turn back, so we continued.  My son is only 40 pounds, and he was the only child in the whole building. The bounce house he first picked could barely stay inflated with just him on it. Lots of holes and tape to patch these inflatables up.  And dirt. Lots and lots of dirt.

In the jungle gym maze part, there is pure filth. Candy wrappers, dirt,  drippings of God know what, and HAIR EVERYWHERE.  Lots of spots in the maze need to be fixed properly before someone gets seriously hurt. DUCT TAPE DOES NOT FIX EVERYTHING.  Mind you, we were the first ones there for the day.  So surely there were plenty of hours to clean before the next batch of children came in. There are signs all over saying, " If your child shows any sign of being sick, please inform the staff immediately."  Well, it's 2 days later, my son is very sick, and the only place we were was mega play.

I understand that businesses are short staffed, and I will say that the only girl working in there was very kind..... but this filth is absolutely unacceptable at a childs play place.  They charge 12 dollars for one hour. Not worth it at all. I will never ever bring my son back to mega play.

Reviewer: Camryn Holloman
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: My kids have been coming to this place for 3 years and absolutely love it. Besides the occasional times my kids have gotten sick, never had many issues. I have my kids birthday parties here. My concern currently is yesterday when we went at the FIRST time slot available; my 5 year old managed to get their leg IN BETWEEN a zip tie that is holding the net to the giant Playset. Another parent had to run up there and help me break the zip tie as my child was suspended in the air.

Additionally, there was a large hole above the slide that my child thought was funny to try to stick their head through. Obviously I corrected my child. However, this is still a serious safety concern and should be checked CONSTANTLY and addressed asap. Not once a week!

I called the manager the next day who told me once a week someone comes through to check the safety of the net and the playset. She Then proceeded to tell me that the large hole in the net above the slides must‚Äôve occurred the same day because the employees check the nets every night. That is not possible, because we arrived at the very first timeslot that was available that day.

I tried to explain to her that the zip tie was also loose because there‚Äôs no possible way my child could have slipped their entire leg through a zip tie in between the foam padding on the side; She continued to say it must‚Äôve happened that day and that the employees are very busy.

My child is not a small kid. The zip tie had to have been loose. A zip tie that is loose connected to the foam siding can cause a child to slip through the side off the playset, and the only thing holding a child from falling down is that cheap net that the employees supposedly check every night? I think not.

Additionally, we have a birthday party planned there and I cannot get any refund for the party. I will lose 50% of the funds that I paid so I will continue to have my birthday party there for my child and we just have to ensure that a parent is in there with kids, because the employees do not effectively check the netting for safety. Most of the employees that work there are likely high school or early college kids who genuinely don‚Äôt care. It‚Äôs just a job to them. Nothing wrong with them personally I was at age once with a job that wasn‚Äôt a serious career for me so they genuinely do not care and probably do not check the netting every single night.They are NEVER been too busy the 20 times we‚Äôve been here to check for safety hazards.

My kids enjoy this place so much so we will likely still attend here and have the birthday party where I can‚Äôt get my money back but if you‚Äôre a parent you need to make sure you watch your child extreme amount on that place and be up there with them or have an older child who is capable of watching younger kids because your childs safety is at risk on that play set.  And because you sign a waiver, the facility and the employees and manager genuinely don‚Äôt appear to care.

Reviewer: Michelle Canhg
Rating: 1/5
Time: Edited 3 months ago
Review: Sandy land is a cute place, you walk inside and there‚Äôs a little area for snacks and tables if you want to have lunch, they have snacks for sale as well and allow outside food.
My initial impression though is that it‚Äôs wildly overpriced. For my 4/1 year old I paid 30$ which I find extremely steep especially when you have let‚Äôs play Huntsville with so much more interactive stuff and ways to get the energy out. The blow up ball pit is rough, it‚Äôs dirty and clearly used, the sand pit with water was not thought out well, you need to bring extra clothes to this place as the sand room with water gets your kids not only soaked but sandy as hell. I wasn‚Äôt prepared for that and my baby was soaking within minutes of playing and then I felt like we had to leave because she was so cold and had wet sand inside her clothes and yeah idk about that situation.

The owner wasn‚Äôt overly friendly and honestly I was just taken back at the initial expense. If they did a 10$ per kid plus 5$ for an additional I could see this place being realistic but the cost for what you get doesn‚Äôt match at all. You‚Äôll only really be there maybe 2 hours max and yeah that was my biggest turn off next to the dress up clothes that were all broken and missing pieces. Like if you‚Äôre going to charge that much money you want to have a really epic time.

Let‚Äôs play Huntsville was way more worth money imo.

Not saying this place doesn‚Äôt have potential but meh.

Reviewer: ELP SM
Rating: 1/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: Was not impressed by the cleanliness level and overall safety.
-Cleanliness: Toys do not appear regularly washed, never mind disinfected. A lot of stains on everything. The blowup ball pit and slide had holes and stains all throughout. The water/sand room was gross and the water appears to not be replaced regularly throughout the day. I appreciated multiple hand sanitizers throughout the building, and vacuuming of stray sand, but overall there are a lot of toys that are in need of replacing.
-Safety: This is a big one for me. The sand is dusty and appears to not be silica free (through observation alone), which is incredibly toxic and dangerous to any one that breaths it in. They also advertise sanitization through UV light, but I have a hard time believing that/and how that works.
There are exposed cords and open wall sockets EVERYWHERE. There is zero baby proofing here, and it was a constant fight to not have my young kids stick their fingers in the outlets. There is an area, specifically by the bubbles and bathroom, that has an open cord storage area that is not blocked off and easily accessible. There is also a glass cabinet with doors that are not locked and kids were exploring in there and getting hurt climbing the glass shelves. It appears to be intended for "grocery store" use in the imaginative play section, but doesn't have anything in it and is unnecessary.
-Lastly, a young girl was there with what appeared to be her pet snake, and was walking around with it showing everyone and offering pets. No harm was meant by this, but it should not be allowed to let anyone have animals in this facility meant for young children playing. People with phobias of snakes, and the liability of having a reptile (not being presented by a professional) in a child play place, was not taken into consideration.

Overall I think this place has potential, but needs a lot of work, especially for the high price of admission. People expect a higher level of entertainment, cleanliness, and most importantly safety, when catering to young children, and this place has not met the mark.

-----------------------

Review: We had a really fun time.

Reviewer: Tori Scott
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 days ago
Review: This is a hidden gem! I have been wanting to come here with my two children, who have ADHD & different levels of Autism, my son, who is 11, and my daughter, who just turned 6, since they opened. We never had a chance to visit until yesterday (Saturday, June 28, 2025) when we were invited with some friends who are members. My oldest had a blast with the arcade games, the climbing areas, and just being indoors in general in a safe environment to help escape this heat. The facility is card only, which was no issue for us, thankfully. The machine to dispense the game card even took tap to pay, so my son was able to use some Apple Cash he had to load a new game card.

Francine was very helpful when checking in with explaining the waiver, the process since it was our first time, and swatting any of those pesky flies that snuck through the door. They didn't get far because Francine was on it in the lobby, swatting left and right, taking out those summer nuances. Liz with the killer nails (can't wait to see what design she has on our next visit) helped when we needed to check out from the snack bar, which I was very impressed with the selections that are offered. She is very personable and a great asset to the front desk. Kyrsten knew exactly what I needed on this 100 degree day when I ordered a fountain Sundrop because she came in clutch, offering extra ice! I was like, Yessssss please! I was praising the facility already, and they told me where to leave the review, so here I am!

Plum Krazy Play is now a staple in our neurodivergent family! Not only because it is a safe place I can let my children play inside with added sensory play when needed, I can get a fountain Sundrop, AND I can get some adult interactions in.... I say sign me up! We are discussing membership as a family and looking at all the calendar events, including Sensory Wednesday, which is probably going to be the first time I bring my daughter. Can't wait to come again!

As an added bonus, the facility is a Pok√©mon Gym if anyone plays Pok√©mon Go ;)

Reviewer: Tori Scott
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 days ago
Review: This is a hidden gem! I have been wanting to come here with my two children, who have ADHD & different levels of Autism, my son, who is 11, and my daughter, who just turned 6, since they opened. We never had a chance to visit until yesterday (Saturday, June 28, 2025) when we were invited with some friends who are members. My oldest had a blast with the arcade games, the climbing areas, and just being indoors in general in a safe environment to help escape this heat. The facility is card only, which was no issue for us, thankfully. The machine to dispense the game card even took tap to pay, so my son was able to use some Apple Cash he had to load a new game card.

Francine was very helpful when checking in with explaining the waiver, the process since it was our first time, and swatting any of those pesky flies that snuck through the door. They didn't get far because Francine was on it in the lobby, swatting left and right, taking out those summer nuances. Liz with the killer nails (can't wait to see what design she has on our next visit) helped when we needed to check out from the snack bar, which I was very impressed with the selections that are offered. She is very personable and a great asset to the front desk. Kyrsten knew exactly what I needed on this 100 degree day when I ordered a fountain Sundrop because she came in clutch, offering extra ice! I was like, Yessssss please! I was praising the facility already, and they told me where to leave the review, so here I am!

Plum Krazy Play is now a staple in our neurodivergent family! Not only because it is a safe place I can let my children play inside with added sensory play when needed, I can get a fountain Sundrop, AND I can get some adult interactions in.... I say sign me up! We are discussing membership as a family and looking at all the calendar events, including Sensory Wednesday, which is probably going to be the first time I bring my daughter. Can't wait to come again!

As an added bonus, the facility is a Pok√©mon Gym if anyone plays Pok√©mon Go ;)

Reviewer: Tori Scott
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 days ago
Review: This is a hidden gem! I have been wanting to come here with my two children, who have ADHD & different levels of Autism, my son, who is 11, and my daughter, who just turned 6, since they opened. We never had a chance to visit until yesterday (Saturday, June 28, 2025) when we were invited with some friends who are members. My oldest had a blast with the arcade games, the climbing areas, and just being indoors in general in a safe environment to help escape this heat. The facility is card only, which was no issue for us, thankfully. The machine to dispense the game card even took tap to pay, so my son was able to use some Apple Cash he had to load a new game card.

Francine was very helpful when checking in with explaining the waiver, the process since it was our first time, and swatting any of those pesky flies that snuck through the door. They didn't get far because Francine was on it in the lobby, swatting left and right, taking out those summer nuances. Liz with the killer nails (can't wait to see what design she has on our next visit) helped when we needed to check out from the snack bar, which I was very impressed with the selections that are offered. She is very personable and a great asset to the front desk. Kyrsten knew exactly what I needed on this 100 degree day when I ordered a fountain Sundrop because she came in clutch, offering extra ice! I was like, Yessssss please! I was praising the facility already, and they told me where to leave the review, so here I am!

Plum Krazy Play is now a staple in our neurodivergent family! Not only because it is a safe place I can let my children play inside with added sensory play when needed, I can get a fountain Sundrop, AND I can get some adult interactions in.... I say sign me up! We are discussing membership as a family and looking at all the calendar events, including Sensory Wednesday, which is probably going to be the first time I bring my daughter. Can't wait to come again!

As an added bonus, the facility is a Pok√©mon Gym if anyone plays Pok√©mon Go ;)

Reviewer: Tori Scott
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 days ago
Review: This is a hidden gem! I have been wanting to come here with my two children, who have ADHD & different levels of Autism, my son, who is 11, and my daughter, who just turned 6, since they opened. We never had a chance to visit until yesterday (Saturday, June 28, 2025) when we were invited with some friends who are members. My oldest had a blast with the arcade games, the climbing areas, and just being indoors in general in a safe environment to help escape this heat. The facility is card only, which was no issue for us, thankfully. The machine to dispense the game card even took tap to pay, so my son was able to use some Apple Cash he had to load a new game card.

Francine was very helpful when checking in with explaining the waiver, the process since it was our first time, and swatting any of those pesky flies that snuck through the door. They didn't get far because Francine was on it in the lobby, swatting left and right, taking out those summer nuances. Liz with the killer nails (can't wait to see what design she has on our next visit) helped when we needed to check out from the snack bar, which I was very impressed with the selections that are offered. She is very personable and a great asset to the front desk. Kyrsten knew exactly what I needed on this 100 degree day when I ordered a fountain Sundrop because she came in clutch, offering extra ice! I was like, Yessssss please! I was praising the facility already, and they told me where to leave the review, so here I am!

Plum Krazy Play is now a staple in our neurodivergent family! Not only because it is a safe place I can let my children play inside with added sensory play when needed, I can get a fountain Sundrop, AND I can get some adult interactions in.... I say sign me up! We are discussing membership as a family and looking at all the calendar events, including Sensory Wednesday, which is probably going to be the first time I bring my daughter. Can't wait to come again!

As an added bonus, the facility is a Pok√©mon Gym if anyone plays Pok√©mon Go ;)

Reviewer: Kenneth P Temp. Housing
Rating: 2/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Our kids love this place and always have so much fun when they come in.  Our negative experience comes from their lack of empathy regarding the needs of children.  We brought our two kids and 3 friends today to enjoy the teacher workday.  The kids knew that they have pizza there and wanted to eat when we got there.  About 15 minutes after getting there, we went and asked for a cheese pizza and were told they were out.  She was very nice and said she would order more.  She called dominos and was told it would be at least an hour and a half for it to be delivered.  I asked her if we could pick it up and she said no due to health concerns it needs to be delivered?  I then asked if we could leave and get something to eat and come back to which we were told if we left the parking lot our tickets were void!!!!   We waited over two hours and still no pizza and very hungry kids.  If you are not going to allow outside food, then you need to have inside food available for purchase.  It‚Äôs that simple.

Reviewer: Richard
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 months ago
Review: At 12:15 we are told that we can't enter with our 3 year old because "the current playtime is about to end and the next one doesn't start until 12:45". There ONE child currently in there playing. ONE! There are two parents with him. So, there are literally twice as many parents, including the staff, three times as many adults as children here. Still, our child can't come in, and we can't wait inside either for some odd reason. "You have to come back at 12:45" we are told. I point out the ONE child thing. Nope, come back at 12:45. I'm informed these rules "are strictly enforced and have been since covid". So, I asked "why have we not been turned away and told to come back at a designated time the last THREE times are three year old randomly decided she wanted to go there"? With a straight face, the girl behind the counter tells me, "well, it depends on who the staff members are that are that are working that day as to if the 'rules are enforced'". Have you ever tried to explain to a three year old, who's now throwing a fit because she can't play, that she has to go somewhere else and can't play because the wrong staff member is working that day? One last try. "Ma'am, there's one other kid in here, she's all excited to play, no one has ever mentioned this to us before".  Nope, come back at 12:45. ONE kid! I have no problems with there being rules. I do have a problem that only ONE staff member chooses to enforce them or even make them known. I do have a problem that we were allowed to pay and play three previous times and out of the 5 maybe 6 other staff members we've met, none of them ever mentioned these "strictly enforced" rules.
TLDR;
1)Whether or not your child can play without an appointment in a building with ONE other child, COMPLETELY depends on which staff members are working that day.
2)We did NOT return at 12:45
3)You are not allowed to use the restroom to change a toddlers diaper unless you pay. You can't pay until 12:45.

Reviewer: John Lawrence
Rating: 3/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: 3 stars due to cost and needed maintenance and upkeep.

My daughter (3 years old) absolutely loves Megaplay. She has more fun here than she does at Zing Zumm and Altitute, both of which we have memberships for.

That said, I think Megaplay is prohibitively expensive as a place to take my daughter. Zing is $100 for an entire year, and for her and I to jump at Altitude 7 days a week for 2 hours at a time it's $40 a month. At Mega, there is no monthly option, so taking her just 3 times a month is as expensive as Altitude unlimited visits.

Can we get a membership option like everywhere else?

As for maintenance, the junglejims have many spots missing padding, covered in duct tape, equipment removed likely due to damage. The bounce houses have airleaks and tape all over.

I'm not posting this to bash, we really love it and would really love if we could go more often and see some much needed repairs. Thank you and please think about it!

Reviewer: Evangeline Jones
Rating: 1/5
Time: 7 months ago
Review: On 11/15/2024 at approximately 10:02AM My son & I visited Mega play's Center. I am writing this review to raise awareness about discrimination faced by children with developmental delays during playtime. Office Manager of Megaplay left her office door open leaving a safety hazard to all children in this establishment my son entered her office to play on her play rug and we were verbally attacked by this Manager screaming for us to "get out of her office". I immediately attempted to explain my son is Autistic and this door should be closed. We were kicked out and I asked for a refund before I would leave. The Manager did grant this refund while speaking in a tone and demeanor not professional or fit for any type of leadership. As per the United Nations Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities which ensures disabled children have equal access to play and recreational activities my sons experience suggests that such principles were not upheld.  On behalf of my son, I would like to emphasize the need for this environment to become more nurturing and increase the ability for children to be able to thrive here. I am disappointed in my experience both women in this business lacked professionalism. maturity, and the ability to run an establishment properly by using conflict resolution this is a vulnerable child. You kicked him out because he entered your office and then screamed at a parent? I'm mortified...I ask anyone in this community don't allow your children to be treated like this. This business is unsafe, and follow-up will be taken to determine ratio per employees, cleanliness, and overall ability to operate properly. Staff training and creating a more inclusive environment should be required for this establishment to continue to operate.

Reviewer: Katelynn Burnett
Rating: 5/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: We rented the party room at Megaplay for my daughter‚Äôs 7th birthday this year. I am someone who really struggle with perfectionism and people pleasing. Thanks to this, party planning means a lot of stress for me. The folks at Megaplay were so kind and accommodating from the first moment I called. They had no problem answering every question I had before booking the room. They also explained clearly the fees and accommodations. In addition, they never made me feel uncomfortable or like an inconvenience for needing more clarification or for asking a second or third time. They also confirmed my time slot and accommodations twice before the date of the party. They made it clear they would do all the decorating all I had to do was drop off my supplies, and there was even an option to have them go buy the supplies for you (for an additional charge.)

All of that is great alone, but the staff really went above and beyond to support me. My daughter woke up sick the day of her party and I frantically called crying and defeated that everything was ruined. Not only did Megaplay have no problem rescheduling me, but the staff went out of there way to offer me reassurance and support that everything would be okay. Not as a customer, but as a stressed out mom thinking way too hard about a pokemon party. The reschedule affected the guest turnout pretty badly and I was fretting around in circles most of the party. Josh and Joyanna were right there for me the entire time. They checked with me every few minutes to make sure I was doing okay. They let me take the reins wherever I felt comfortable, but had no probably helping me direct the flow of the party in my stressed out state. I cannot count the number of times they told me ‚Äúif you need anything at all please don‚Äôt hesitate to let us know.‚Äù

The sincerity of the staff at Megaplay made every difference in the world for me. Thank you so much to Josh and Joyanna for having next level customer support. It was so clear my experience mattered to them as a person not just a customer. They were really able to help turn my entire mood about the party around. I‚Äôm so grateful this is where we chose to celebrate and I would give more stars if I could. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Reviewer: amanda stobaugh
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: I've taken my son to play at Mega play several times now. During covid, they were on top of keeping it pretty clean. They stopped play time every hour to walk through and sanitize.  The equipment has always been a bit worn out, but this last visit, I was blown away. They have let this place go all the way downhill. 2 days after visiting this place, my son came down with a high-grade fever.

When we first arrived, the only thing I noticed was how HOT and muggy it was inside. Smelled like moldy gym socks. My son was too excited to turn back, so we continued.  My son is only 40 pounds, and he was the only child in the whole building. The bounce house he first picked could barely stay inflated with just him on it. Lots of holes and tape to patch these inflatables up.  And dirt. Lots and lots of dirt.

In the jungle gym maze part, there is pure filth. Candy wrappers, dirt,  drippings of God know what, and HAIR EVERYWHERE.  Lots of spots in the maze need to be fixed properly before someone gets seriously hurt. DUCT TAPE DOES NOT FIX EVERYTHING.  Mind you, we were the first ones there for the day.  So surely there were plenty of hours to clean before the next batch of children came in. There are signs all over saying, " If your child shows any sign of being sick, please inform the staff immediately."  Well, it's 2 days later, my son is very sick, and the only place we were was mega play.

I understand that businesses are short staffed, and I will say that the only girl working in there was very kind..... but this filth is absolutely unacceptable at a childs play place.  They charge 12 dollars for one hour. Not worth it at all. I will never ever bring my son back to mega play.

Reviewer: Camryn Holloman
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: My kids have been coming to this place for 3 years and absolutely love it. Besides the occasional times my kids have gotten sick, never had many issues. I have my kids birthday parties here. My concern currently is yesterday when we went at the FIRST time slot available; my 5 year old managed to get their leg IN BETWEEN a zip tie that is holding the net to the giant Playset. Another parent had to run up there and help me break the zip tie as my child was suspended in the air.

Additionally, there was a large hole above the slide that my child thought was funny to try to stick their head through. Obviously I corrected my child. However, this is still a serious safety concern and should be checked CONSTANTLY and addressed asap. Not once a week!

I called the manager the next day who told me once a week someone comes through to check the safety of the net and the playset. She Then proceeded to tell me that the large hole in the net above the slides must‚Äôve occurred the same day because the employees check the nets every night. That is not possible, because we arrived at the very first timeslot that was available that day.

I tried to explain to her that the zip tie was also loose because there‚Äôs no possible way my child could have slipped their entire leg through a zip tie in between the foam padding on the side; She continued to say it must‚Äôve happened that day and that the employees are very busy.

My child is not a small kid. The zip tie had to have been loose. A zip tie that is loose connected to the foam siding can cause a child to slip through the side off the playset, and the only thing holding a child from falling down is that cheap net that the employees supposedly check every night? I think not.

Additionally, we have a birthday party planned there and I cannot get any refund for the party. I will lose 50% of the funds that I paid so I will continue to have my birthday party there for my child and we just have to ensure that a parent is in there with kids, because the employees do not effectively check the netting for safety. Most of the employees that work there are likely high school or early college kids who genuinely don‚Äôt care. It‚Äôs just a job to them. Nothing wrong with them personally I was at age once with a job that wasn‚Äôt a serious career for me so they genuinely do not care and probably do not check the netting every single night.They are NEVER been too busy the 20 times we‚Äôve been here to check for safety hazards.

My kids enjoy this place so much so we will likely still attend here and have the birthday party where I can‚Äôt get my money back but if you‚Äôre a parent you need to make sure you watch your child extreme amount on that place and be up there with them or have an older child who is capable of watching younger kids because your childs safety is at risk on that play set.  And because you sign a waiver, the facility and the employees and manager genuinely don‚Äôt appear to care.

Review: I've taken my toddler here to play a handful of times, and I've always been so impressed with the cleanliness and the sweet staff members ready to help in whatever way they can. We decided to have our girl's 2nd birthday party here, and the day could not have been more perfect. The staff members were extremely helpful in making sure that we had everything that we needed. They were ready to help as soon as we walked in to set up, they were right there ready to help during the party, and even during the clean up. The schedule of events couldn't have been more perfect. Play time was for a hour and 15 minutes, and the last 45 minutes was dedicated to the party room for pizza and drinks. Sprouts took care of ordering all of the pizzas and even providing drinks!! The kids were allowed to run and play, while the parents were able to talk amongst each other without having to worry too hard about making sure every kid was safe. The layout of the indoor playground is so spacious and open - so it is easy to have eyes on your child at all times. I will always recommend Sprouts to anyone looking to entertain their children in a safe, clean and fun environment.

Review: Really wanted to like this place but we paid $15 per child ($30 total )for a 75 min play time. When we arrived the girl told us that because we had the last reserved spot of the day we needed to leave at the 1 hour mark because they needed time to clean and sanitize everything. So we were asked to leave at 5:30 when we paid until 5:45. It says on the door that they close at 6:00 p.m. The employee locked the door right behind us. I asked her why we were not told when we reserved the spot that it would be a different play time and she said she would have to look but never followed up with us and was instead behind the counter on her cell phone the entire time. She started cleaning with strong smelling chemicals before we were even done with our hour of playtime. This is something that I did not appreciate since I am pregnant.
If these are the rules, that should have been told to us when we reserved our spot, or our playtime should have been credited back or applied to another playtime. Will not be spending our money here again.

It felt pretty clean, was very spacious, had more things that parents could sit on closer to the kids if they needed help, and truly it was worth the extra dollar or two above Playland to not have to drive all the way down there.
However, the one negative thing I would say is that there's absolutely no security measures for the children or parents. There's no name tags to double check and make sure you're bringing your child out with you or someone else's kid. I felt very concerned the entire time that I had to keep a lookout near the door and make sure no creeps had come in.
Would really appreciate it if you guys have a name system and check on the tags before the parents and children leave. Playland does that.

Reviewer: Denise Infante
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I love bringing my two and three-year-old to this cafe. It's a place I frequently visit with my husband or other mommies. The atmosphere is very clean, and I always look forward to their delicious vanilla lattes and waffles! The staff behind the counter consistently greet everyone with smiles and work their tails off to serve us. The location is also low sensory which I appreciate as a former special education advocate.

While the location is a bit cramped, I believe this is partly due to families placing their belongings on the tables, which can limit space, especially for those who are dining. It would be wonderful if patrons could utilize the cubbies provided to help create a more enjoyable dining experience for everyone. Additionally, I think it would be beneficial if parents could take a more active role in supervising their children and encouraging them to return items to their proper places. My daughter loves playing in the kitchen area, but it often seems empty. Parents joining their kids on the slide should bear in mind that they move all the balls when they slide down. My son hit his head on the back of the slide because the balls had been removed from a parent sliding down.

I truly believe that creating a welcoming environment is a shared responsibility within our community. If you‚Äôre visiting, it would be wonderful if you could encourage your little one to practice responsibility. I also wish there were opportunities to explore memberships! Otherwise, great location!
