The kids were super rowdy, chasing one another around and pelting each other with balls both inside and outside of the ball pit (I got hit hard in the side of the head). They kept climbing up the slides and the parents were way more interested in socializing amongst each other than actually parenting their kids. An announcement was made regarding the kids' behavior, but unfortunately none of us could understand what was being said over the loudspeaker and nothing was done by employees OR parents when the behavior continued. We didn't feel it was safe for our baby to keep playing so we left after about an hour, which felt like a waste of money, as we usually stay for the full two hours. We love Playland, but it would be so much better if there were designated areas by age group, or at least if the rules of safe play were actually enforced. Also, after a few times of coming, we've never once seen employees disinfecting the play area, and as another reviewer mentioned, the baby changing table in the women's restroom isn't bolted to the counter, so it slides around if you have a squirmy baby. We'll still keep coming here, but I was disappointed by our most recent visit.

Reviewer: Denise Infante
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I love bringing my two and three-year-old to this cafe. It's a place I frequently visit with my husband or other mommies. The atmosphere is very clean, and I always look forward to their delicious vanilla lattes and waffles! The staff behind the counter consistently greet everyone with smiles and work their tails off to serve us. The location is also low sensory which I appreciate as a former special education advocate.

While the location is a bit cramped, I believe this is partly due to families placing their belongings on the tables, which can limit space, especially for those who are dining. It would be wonderful if patrons could utilize the cubbies provided to help create a more enjoyable dining experience for everyone. Additionally, I think it would be beneficial if parents could take a more active role in supervising their children and encouraging them to return items to their proper places. My daughter loves playing in the kitchen area, but it often seems empty. Parents joining their kids on the slide should bear in mind that they move all the balls when they slide down. My son hit his head on the back of the slide because the balls had been removed from a parent sliding down.

I truly believe that creating a welcoming environment is a shared responsibility within our community. If you‚Äôre visiting, it would be wonderful if you could encourage your little one to practice responsibility. I also wish there were opportunities to explore memberships! Otherwise, great location!

They have slides, obstacle courses, ball pits, little cars and play mat areas and different things to do with your child or let them explore on there own. U do have to sign a waiver in case of injury and are required to have socks on, no shoes in play area or bare feet. It's for 2 hour intervals unless you buy a package for a party or something then you can stay longer I believe. Would recommend, and we'll be going back, however I'll just keep drinks and snacks in car!

Reviewer: Sara G
Rating: 3/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: I enjoy bringing my 16 month old baby here during the week when it tends to be slow, however we brought her recently when there were more older kids running around. The kids were super rowdy, chasing one another around and pelting each other with balls both inside and outside of the ball pit (I got hit hard in the side of the head). They kept climbing up the slides and the parents were way more interested in socializing amongst each other than actually parenting their kids. An announcement was made regarding the kids' behavior, but unfortunately none of us could understand what was being said over the loudspeaker and nothing was done by employees OR parents when the behavior continued. We didn't feel it was safe for our baby to keep playing so we left after about an hour, which felt like a waste of money, as we usually stay for the full two hours. We love Playland, but it would be so much better if there were designated areas by age group, or at least if the rules of safe play were actually enforced. Also, after a few times of coming, we've never once seen employees disinfecting the play area, and as another reviewer mentioned, the baby changing table in the women's restroom isn't bolted to the counter, so it slides around if you have a squirmy baby. We'll still keep coming here, but I was disappointed by our most recent visit.

Reviewer: Denise Infante
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I love bringing my two and three-year-old to this cafe. It's a place I frequently visit with my husband or other mommies. The atmosphere is very clean, and I always look forward to their delicious vanilla lattes and waffles! The staff behind the counter consistently greet everyone with smiles and work their tails off to serve us. The location is also low sensory which I appreciate as a former special education advocate.

While the location is a bit cramped, I believe this is partly due to families placing their belongings on the tables, which can limit space, especially for those who are dining. It would be wonderful if patrons could utilize the cubbies provided to help create a more enjoyable dining experience for everyone. Additionally, I think it would be beneficial if parents could take a more active role in supervising their children and encouraging them to return items to their proper places. My daughter loves playing in the kitchen area, but it often seems empty. Parents joining their kids on the slide should bear in mind that they move all the balls when they slide down. My son hit his head on the back of the slide because the balls had been removed from a parent sliding down.

I truly believe that creating a welcoming environment is a shared responsibility within our community. If you‚Äôre visiting, it would be wonderful if you could encourage your little one to practice responsibility. I also wish there were opportunities to explore memberships! Otherwise, great location!

The play area is a paradise for kids ‚Äì colorful, engaging, and packed with fun activities like slides, ball pits, and climbing structures that kept my little ones entertained for hours.

Reviewer: Sara G
Rating: 3/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: I enjoy bringing my 16 month old baby here during the week when it tends to be slow, however we brought her recently when there were more older kids running around. The kids were super rowdy, chasing one another around and pelting each other with balls both inside and outside of the ball pit (I got hit hard in the side of the head). They kept climbing up the slides and the parents were way more interested in socializing amongst each other than actually parenting their kids. An announcement was made regarding the kids' behavior, but unfortunately none of us could understand what was being said over the loudspeaker and nothing was done by employees OR parents when the behavior continued. We didn't feel it was safe for our baby to keep playing so we left after about an hour, which felt like a waste of money, as we usually stay for the full two hours. We love Playland, but it would be so much better if there were designated areas by age group, or at least if the rules of safe play were actually enforced. Also, after a few times of coming, we've never once seen employees disinfecting the play area, and as another reviewer mentioned, the baby changing table in the women's restroom isn't bolted to the counter, so it slides around if you have a squirmy baby. We'll still keep coming here, but I was disappointed by our most recent visit.

Reviewer: Denise Infante
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I love bringing my two and three-year-old to this cafe. It's a place I frequently visit with my husband or other mommies. The atmosphere is very clean, and I always look forward to their delicious vanilla lattes and waffles! The staff behind the counter consistently greet everyone with smiles and work their tails off to serve us. The location is also low sensory which I appreciate as a former special education advocate.

While the location is a bit cramped, I believe this is partly due to families placing their belongings on the tables, which can limit space, especially for those who are dining. It would be wonderful if patrons could utilize the cubbies provided to help create a more enjoyable dining experience for everyone. Additionally, I think it would be beneficial if parents could take a more active role in supervising their children and encouraging them to return items to their proper places. My daughter loves playing in the kitchen area, but it often seems empty. Parents joining their kids on the slide should bear in mind that they move all the balls when they slide down. My son hit his head on the back of the slide because the balls had been removed from a parent sliding down.

I truly believe that creating a welcoming environment is a shared responsibility within our community. If you‚Äôre visiting, it would be wonderful if you could encourage your little one to practice responsibility. I also wish there were opportunities to explore memberships! Otherwise, great location!

Reviewer: Sara G
Rating: 3/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: I enjoy bringing my 16 month old baby here during the week when it tends to be slow, however we brought her recently when there were more older kids running around. The kids were super rowdy, chasing one another around and pelting each other with balls both inside and outside of the ball pit (I got hit hard in the side of the head). They kept climbing up the slides and the parents were way more interested in socializing amongst each other than actually parenting their kids. An announcement was made regarding the kids' behavior, but unfortunately none of us could understand what was being said over the loudspeaker and nothing was done by employees OR parents when the behavior continued. We didn't feel it was safe for our baby to keep playing so we left after about an hour, which felt like a waste of money, as we usually stay for the full two hours. We love Playland, but it would be so much better if there were designated areas by age group, or at least if the rules of safe play were actually enforced. Also, after a few times of coming, we've never once seen employees disinfecting the play area, and as another reviewer mentioned, the baby changing table in the women's restroom isn't bolted to the counter, so it slides around if you have a squirmy baby. We'll still keep coming here, but I was disappointed by our most recent visit.

From getting to dress up and play pretend in a coffee shop, to dressing up in a police outfit and riding a car around playing pretend, to playing in the ball pit with new friends, or playing with cars with new friends, I recommend this place to any parent of littles! PLUS, there‚Äôs the perk of them being able to go to a place, and not having to worry about the deep cleaning of a playroom at home! Their atmosphere is so amazing and the staff is so friendly. Plus, all the stations were SO clean! We will definitely be back every opportunity we are able to be back!

Reviewer: Jasmine Caldwell Smith
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: We hosted my daughter‚Äôs 2nd birthday party at Shelby Play Place, and it was absolutely perfect! The space was the ideal size‚Äînot too big or overwhelming, but just right for the kids to explore and play comfortably while parents could easily keep an eye on them. The entire place was spotless, and the pricing was super affordable for everything included.

Kayleigh Melton, the owner, was incredible to work with. She maintained excellent communication throughout the planning process and went above and beyond to accommodate all of our needs. She really pays attention to the small details, like providing bathroom amenities specifically for little ones and ensuring the space was safe and secure for all kids.

One thing that truly stood out was that parents are allowed to get on all the play equipment with the kids. This was a huge relief since we have a little one who is sometimes a bit hesitant. So many other indoor play areas don‚Äôt allow this, but here, it made all the difference!

This play place made for a stress-free, fun, and memorable celebration. I couldn‚Äôt recommend it enough! Thank you, Kayleigh, for helping make my daughter‚Äôs special day so wonderful!

-----------------------

Review: We were in Norman for 3 weeks while my husband was taking a class at NCED. The Play Pit was a pleasant surprise and my 4 year old loved it. We bought a one month membership and went a few times each week. It's very clean compared to some other play cafes we've visited. I saw the employees vacuuming, taking the trash out, and checking the bathrooms regularly. All of the employees were very kind and friendly. Even the other parents were wonderful and handled little kid disagreements/rowdiness very well.

On top of that, it was a great place to get some work done while my little one played. Comfy seats, fast internet, and we were able to bring in our lunch. So grateful to have had this experience!

Reviewer: K R
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: The Play Pit is Norman's only indoor playground and does it so well! ü§ó

Being in a kid-centered environment can be a bit uncomfortable and overwhelming after a while. Still, the Play Pit's cozy antique rocking chairs and furniture, complemented by the modern-chic aesthetic, make you feel like you brought your kids over to your cute friend's house to play. It's as cozy and comfortable for adults as it is entertaining for their kids. üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶

The historic architecture enchants your visual sense, and it is such a great example of adaptive reuse with what would feel like a contradiction in housing a playground, but it fits oh-so-well. We are used to traveling an hour to Edmond for a similar center, and although Edmond's is larger, the aesthetic at the Play Pit appeals to the adults more and makes it a comfy place to hang out and not feel like you are surrounded by raging children. üòå

The staff is friendly, and it always smells fresh in there. On more than one occasion, I have witnessed them actively cleaning surfaces and the air with Lysol and other anti-bac/viral products.

Finally, with the price of $13 for the first kid and $10 for additional kids and re-entry allowed, it makes for a fun family experience you can feel good about! üôåü•≥ They also offer monthly passes, birthday parties, and private parties.

Last, but not least they offer an assortment of snacks and coffee for sale, in addition to bringing your own food if you keep it out of the playground areas. üõù

Reviewer: Denise Infante
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I love bringing my two and three-year-old to this cafe. It's a place I frequently visit with my husband or other mommies. The atmosphere is very clean, and I always look forward to their delicious vanilla lattes and waffles! The staff behind the counter consistently greet everyone with smiles and work their tails off to serve us. The location is also low sensory which I appreciate as a former special education advocate.

While the location is a bit cramped, I believe this is partly due to families placing their belongings on the tables, which can limit space, especially for those who are dining. It would be wonderful if patrons could utilize the cubbies provided to help create a more enjoyable dining experience for everyone. Additionally, I think it would be beneficial if parents could take a more active role in supervising their children and encouraging them to return items to their proper places. My daughter loves playing in the kitchen area, but it often seems empty. Parents joining their kids on the slide should bear in mind that they move all the balls when they slide down. My son hit his head on the back of the slide because the balls had been removed from a parent sliding down.

I truly believe that creating a welcoming environment is a shared responsibility within our community. If you‚Äôre visiting, it would be wonderful if you could encourage your little one to practice responsibility. I also wish there were opportunities to explore memberships! Otherwise, great location!

-----------------------

Review: ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê Absolutely Amazing!

Playland is hands down the best indoor playground and caf√© we‚Äôve ever visited! From the moment we walked in, we were blown away by the clean, modern, and thoughtfully designed space. The play area is a paradise for kids ‚Äì colorful, engaging, and packed with fun activities like slides, ball pits, and climbing structures that kept my little ones entertained for hours.

What really sets Playland apart is the attention to detail. The caf√© is a lifesaver for parents, offering delicious coffee (the caramel Blondie and there waffles is a must-try!), snacks, and a cozy place to relax while keeping an eye on the kids. The staff is incredibly friendly, attentive, and always making sure everyone is having a great time.

The environment feels safe and welcoming, with plenty of seating and space for families to enjoy together. Whether you‚Äôre planning a playdate, hosting a birthday party, or just need a fun outing for the kids, Playland is the perfect spot.

Highly recommend to anyone in the Mooresville area or even beyond ‚Äì it‚Äôs worth the trip! We‚Äôll definitely be back soon.

They have slides, obstacle courses, ball pits, little cars and play mat areas and different things to do with your child or let them explore on there own. U do have to sign a waiver in case of injury and are required to have socks on, no shoes in play area or bare feet. Would recommend, and we'll be going back, however I'll just keep drinks and snacks in car!

Reviewer: Sara G
Rating: 3/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: I enjoy bringing my 16 month old baby here during the week when it tends to be slow, however we brought her recently when there were more older kids running around. The kids were super rowdy, chasing one another around and pelting each other with balls both inside and outside of the ball pit (I got hit hard in the side of the head). They kept climbing up the slides and the parents were way more interested in socializing amongst each other than actually parenting their kids. An announcement was made regarding the kids' behavior, but unfortunately none of us could understand what was being said over the loudspeaker and nothing was done by employees OR parents when the behavior continued. We didn't feel it was safe for our baby to keep playing so we left after about an hour, which felt like a waste of money, as we usually stay for the full two hours. We love Playland, but it would be so much better if there were designated areas by age group, or at least if the rules of safe play were actually enforced. Also, after a few times of coming, we've never once seen employees disinfecting the play area, and as another reviewer mentioned, the baby changing table in the women's restroom isn't bolted to the counter, so it slides around if you have a squirmy baby. We'll still keep coming here, but I was disappointed by our most recent visit.

Reviewer: Baylee Farmer
Rating: 5/5

Review: I've taken my toddler here to play a handful of times, and I've always been so impressed with the cleanliness and the sweet staff members ready to help in whatever way they can. We decided to have our girl's 2nd birthday party here, and the day could not have been more perfect. The staff members were extremely helpful in making sure that we had everything that we needed. They were ready to help as soon as we walked in to set up, they were right there ready to help during the party, and even during the clean up. The schedule of events couldn't have been more perfect. Play time was for a hour and 15 minutes, and the last 45 minutes was dedicated to the party room for pizza and drinks. Sprouts took care of ordering all of the pizzas and even providing drinks!! The kids were allowed to run and play, while the parents were able to talk amongst each other without having to worry too hard about making sure every kid was safe. The layout of the indoor playground is so spacious and open - so it is easy to have eyes on your child at all times. I will always recommend Sprouts to anyone looking to entertain their children in a safe, clean and fun environment.

Review: Really wanted to like this place but we paid $15 per child ($30 total )for a 75 min play time. When we arrived the girl told us that because we had the last reserved spot of the day we needed to leave at the 1 hour mark because they needed time to clean and sanitize everything. So we were asked to leave at 5:30 when we paid until 5:45. It says on the door that they close at 6:00 p.m. The employee locked the door right behind us. I asked her why we were not told when we reserved the spot that it would be a different play time and she said she would have to look but never followed up with us and was instead behind the counter on her cell phone the entire time. She started cleaning with strong smelling chemicals before we were even done with our hour of playtime. This is something that I did not appreciate since I am pregnant.
If these are the rules, that should have been told to us when we reserved our spot, or our playtime should have been credited back or applied to another playtime. Will not be spending our money here again.

Reviewer: Tori Scott
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 days ago
Review: This is a hidden gem! I have been wanting to come here with my two children, who have ADHD & different levels of Autism, my son, who is 11, and my daughter, who just turned 6, since they opened. We never had a chance to visit until yesterday (Saturday, June 28, 2025) when we were invited with some friends who are members. My oldest had a blast with the arcade games, the climbing areas, and just being indoors in general in a safe environment to help escape this heat. The facility is card only, which was no issue for us, thankfully. The machine to dispense the game card even took tap to pay, so my son was able to use some Apple Cash he had to load a new game card.

Francine was very helpful when checking in with explaining the waiver, the process since it was our first time, and swatting any of those pesky flies that snuck through the door. They didn't get far because Francine was on it in the lobby, swatting left and right, taking out those summer nuances. Liz with the killer nails (can't wait to see what design she has on our next visit) helped when we needed to check out from the snack bar, which I was very impressed with the selections that are offered. She is very personable and a great asset to the front desk. Kyrsten knew exactly what I needed on this 100 degree day when I ordered a fountain Sundrop because she came in clutch, offering extra ice! I was like, Yessssss please! I was praising the facility already, and they told me where to leave the review, so here I am!

Plum Krazy Play is now a staple in our neurodivergent family! Not only because it is a safe place I can let my children play inside with added sensory play when needed, I can get a fountain Sundrop, AND I can get some adult interactions in.... I say sign me up! We are discussing membership as a family and looking at all the calendar events, including Sensory Wednesday, which is probably going to be the first time I bring my daughter. Can't wait to come again!

As an added bonus, the facility is a Pok√©mon Gym if anyone plays Pok√©mon Go ;)

Reviewer: Rachel Beam
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Short version - This is an exclusively christian business where anyone not interested in listing to inappropriate, adult christian music is not welcome to play.

We arrived at Funky Frogs for the first time this morning and my toddlers immediately took off and started to play after seeing the toys. I paid and signed a waiver and only then did I notice that christian music was being played over the loud speaker. I asked the employee, Amanda, if it could be changed to something more appropriate for all families‚Äîchildren‚Äôs music, perhaps‚Äîand she said that she didn‚Äôt have control over the station. After a few minutes I became even more uncomfortable so I simply asked for the volume to be turned down. My children and I were the only people in the store so I figured that this wouldn‚Äôt be a problem. Amanda walked towards the back, but did not make any noticeable change to the level of the volume. This was a huge challenge considering I had not only paid, but my kids had already begun playing and I wasn‚Äôt willing to cut their experience short.

We stayed and played and when it was time to leave, I spoke to Amanda to discuss my discomfort and she made it clear that we were not welcome in the space if we weren‚Äôt willing to be subjected to inappropriate christian music in what is advertised as a family space. She offered no apology and told me that had she known that I was that uncomfortable, that she would have offered a refund so that we could leave. Only after advocating for the refund myself was I able to get my money back.

The christian thing to do would have been to  create a welcoming and inclusive environment for all, but it is clear that the owners have limited their business to only those who practice christianity. Steer clear if you prefer that your kids not be exposed to religious indoctrination.

Reviewer: Rachel Beam
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Short version - This is an exclusively christian business where anyone not interested in listing to inappropriate, adult christian music is not welcome to play.

We arrived at Funky Frogs for the first time this morning and my toddlers immediately took off and started to play after seeing the toys. I paid and signed a waiver and only then did I notice that christian music was being played over the loud speaker. I asked the employee, Amanda, if it could be changed to something more appropriate for all families‚Äîchildren‚Äôs music, perhaps‚Äîand she said that she didn‚Äôt have control over the station. After a few minutes I became even more uncomfortable so I simply asked for the volume to be turned down. My children and I were the only people in the store so I figured that this wouldn‚Äôt be a problem. Amanda walked towards the back, but did not make any noticeable change to the level of the volume. This was a huge challenge considering I had not only paid, but my kids had already begun playing and I wasn‚Äôt willing to cut their experience short.

We stayed and played and when it was time to leave, I spoke to Amanda to discuss my discomfort and she made it clear that we were not welcome in the space if we weren‚Äôt willing to be subjected to inappropriate christian music in what is advertised as a family space. She offered no apology and told me that had she known that I was that uncomfortable, that she would have offered a refund so that we could leave. Only after advocating for the refund myself was I able to get my money back.

The christian thing to do would have been to  create a welcoming and inclusive environment for all, but it is clear that the owners have limited their business to only those who practice christianity. Steer clear if you prefer that your kids not be exposed to religious indoctrination.

Reviewer: Kim V.
Rating: 5/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: This indoor playground for kids 10 and under opened in May 2019; it's located in a plaza in Avon, CT. I've had it bookmarked for a while and finally was able to check it out. They also host birthday parties. General admission for kids 2 and older is $16.95, adults are free; if they have a sibling under 2, they are also free. I purchased the general admission ticket ($16.95) plus a pre-loaded $16 game bracelet for $26.95.

Shoes are not allowed so socks are recommended. There was a snack area and tables for the parents. Restrooms were clean and had changing tables. The arcade area was small with an air hockey table, photo booth, and various arcade games. My toddler loved the dinosaur egg machine; there were toys inside those golden eggs.

The playground has two levels and they were soft on the feet. The slides were steep but my son loved it; I can see why there's a disclaimer that it goes fast. There was an indoor go-kart track that my son also loved riding the little go-karts on; it went around the playscape. There were large Legos, blocks, a ball pit, a mini ice cream shop, ride on toy cars, and grocery store. We spent an hour and a half there and my son still didn't want to leave. My other son is a crawler, he still enjoyed the toys at the mini stores and the ride on cars. Overall it was 5 stars for my children and I; we look forward to going back and highly recommend it for kids 10 and under.

Reviewer: Erica Shanks
Rating: 1/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Hello, I just recently had my daughters 2nd Birthday Party here because my daughter loved going their when I brought her. Not to mention one of my friends Highly recommend it. I was supper excited to have her party their until the day of her party. We had chosen the Deluxe package were it included everything except the cake. Her party was scheduled for 2:30-4:30pm. So when it was time for everyone to eat due to it was only being a 2hr party. I asked the front desk employee who was ALWAYS on her phone at 3:40 when was the pizza coming? And she looked puzzled and finally said it should be here in 20mins. However, I quickly reminded her that our party was about to end soon, so how is that possible? And she said she had to call her boss to ask her where it was because she‚Äôs the one that orders the pizza for the party‚Äôs . It was now 4pm and still no pizza. So the front desk employee said her boss wasn‚Äôt answering and offered me a $50 gift card to the facility in exchange for the pizza not being ordered and I said no I would like it back on my card if not cash. So she gave me money in cash however, it wasn‚Äôt even the full $50 dollars. She either missed counted or didn‚Äôt have enough in her drawer to give me the full $50 dollars. So I reached out to her boss that same day and lettting her know what had happen in regards to the money situation and she said she would refund the rest of the money to my card but that never happend. It‚Äôs been over a week and I have still never received the difference of what her employee didn‚Äôt give me. But not to mention you would think that when someone makes an error of not ordering the main meal for my daughters party which is the  pizza and not fully refunding me for it; as an owner you would apologize but she never did. I mean thank god my family had brought in some small dishes to the party so that way the kids and their family had something to eat rather than nothing. If I had only depended on the pizza being served those kids and their family‚Äôs would have starved! Which would of been embarrassing! I am beyondly disappointed in this company, especially when I‚Äôve always heard good things about this facility which is what made me book with them in the first place. Will I ever return their, most likely not. I found it unacceptable for a owner to not order a pizza for an event she was FULLY aware of in advance and knew she was the only one that orders it; along with not being apologetic not only for the pizza but for the refund as well. If you decide to book your kids party here just as soon as you walk in before paying them the remaining balance make sure the employees and management is willing to do their job first! I do NOT recommend this place for party‚Äôs. It is just not worth it!

Reviewer: Mrs Spindola
Rating: 3/5
Time: Edited 2 years ago
Review: BRING SOCKS for yourself and your child.
We went here last summer and then again this summer. I was a bit disappointed this time.
Pros are that the place seems clean. It‚Äôs beautifully decorated. There is a lot to do. There is free WiFi and comfortable seating. You can come and go as you please for a low price. The seating area is a comfortable temperature. There is a camera system that allows the grown ups to see the kids playing.
Cons: When we were purchasing tickets we were told that the arcade and ticket pass was a really good deal by the lady at the desk, so we purchased that package. The arcade only has 9 games. The Virtual reality game was not working last year, and still is not. The games are expensive and give barely any tickets. The prizes for the tickets are priced to high. We were told we could save the tickets to use next time but we are from out of town. They would be better off getting rid of the disappointing arcade and adding more seating. Many times families came in and did not have a place to sit. The snack bar in the lobby has a confusing menu and the snacks are not good. I think they would be better off serving coffee for the parents rather than shaved ice for the kids. The website claims it‚Äôs for 10 and under but my 8 year old daughter seemed far to big for the place. The giant electronic game board was not working. It was just for show. A machine in the other ball pit was not sucking up and spitting out the balls like it was meant to. The bubble machine in the car wash was replaced by fake fluff. They require socks but did not have any for sale. Many families had to walk over to GAP for socks. Despite the air conditioning and fans, the kids play area was extremely hot. All kids would come out red faced and sweaty. We won‚Äôt be going back next summer.
This place seems better suited for kids 3-6 years old without the purchase of arcade as long as you bring your own socks and snacks.

Reviewer: Rachel Beam
Rating: 1/5
Time: 2 years ago
Review: Short version - This is an exclusively christian business where anyone not interested in listing to inappropriate, adult christian music is not welcome to play.

We arrived at Funky Frogs for the first time this morning and my toddlers immediately took off and started to play after seeing the toys. I paid and signed a waiver and only then did I notice that christian music was being played over the loud speaker. I asked the employee, Amanda, if it could be changed to something more appropriate for all families‚Äîchildren‚Äôs music, perhaps‚Äîand she said that she didn‚Äôt have control over the station. After a few minutes I became even more uncomfortable so I simply asked for the volume to be turned down. My children and I were the only people in the store so I figured that this wouldn‚Äôt be a problem. Amanda walked towards the back, but did not make any noticeable change to the level of the volume. This was a huge challenge considering I had not only paid, but my kids had already begun playing and I wasn‚Äôt willing to cut their experience short.

We stayed and played and when it was time to leave, I spoke to Amanda to discuss my discomfort and she made it clear that we were not welcome in the space if we weren‚Äôt willing to be subjected to inappropriate christian music in what is advertised as a family space. She offered no apology and told me that had she known that I was that uncomfortable, that she would have offered a refund so that we could leave. Only after advocating for the refund myself was I able to get my money back.

The christian thing to do would have been to  create a welcoming and inclusive environment for all, but it is clear that the owners have limited their business to only those who practice christianity. Steer clear if you prefer that your kids not be exposed to religious indoctrination.

When we arrived the girl told us that because we had the last reserved spot of the day we needed to leave at the 1 hour mark because they needed time to clean and sanitize everything. So we were asked to leave at 5:30 when we paid until 5:45. It says on the door that they close at 6:00 p.m. The employee locked the door right behind us. I asked her why we were not told when we reserved the spot that it would be a different play time and she said she would have to look but never followed up with us and was instead behind the counter on her cell phone the entire time. She started cleaning with strong smelling chemicals before we were even done with our hour of playtime. This is something that I did not appreciate since I am pregnant.
If these are the rules, that should have been told to us when we reserved our spot, or our playtime should have been credited back or applied to another playtime. Will not be spending our money here again.

Reviewer: Jasmine Caldwell Smith
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: We hosted my daughter‚Äôs 2nd birthday party at Shelby Play Place, and it was absolutely perfect! The space was the ideal size‚Äînot too big or overwhelming, but just right for the kids to explore and play comfortably while parents could easily keep an eye on them. The entire place was spotless, and the pricing was super affordable for everything included.

Kayleigh Melton, the owner, was incredible to work with. She maintained excellent communication throughout the planning process and went above and beyond to accommodate all of our needs. She really pays attention to the small details, like providing bathroom amenities specifically for little ones and ensuring the space was safe and secure for all kids.

One thing that truly stood out was that parents are allowed to get on all the play equipment with the kids. This was a huge relief since we have a little one who is sometimes a bit hesitant. So many other indoor play areas don‚Äôt allow this, but here, it made all the difference!

This play place made for a stress-free, fun, and memorable celebration. I couldn‚Äôt recommend it enough! Thank you, Kayleigh, for helping make my daughter‚Äôs special day so wonderful!

Reviewer: Baylee Farmer

Review: I've taken my toddler here to play a handful of times, and I've always been so impressed with the cleanliness and the sweet staff members ready to help in whatever way they can. We decided to have our girl's 2nd birthday party here, and the day could not have been more perfect. The staff members were extremely helpful in making sure that we had everything that we needed. They were ready to help as soon as we walked in to set up, they were right there ready to help during the party, and even during the clean up. The schedule of events couldn't have been more perfect. Play time was for a hour and 15 minutes, and the last 45 minutes was dedicated to the party room for pizza and drinks. Sprouts took care of ordering all of the pizzas and even providing drinks!! The kids were allowed to run and play, while the parents were able to talk amongst each other without having to worry too hard about making sure every kid was safe. The layout of the indoor playground is so spacious and open - so it is easy to have eyes on your child at all times. I will always recommend Sprouts to anyone looking to entertain their children in a safe, clean and fun environment.

Review: Really wanted to like this place but we paid $15 per child ($30 total )for a 75 min play time. When we arrived the girl told us that because we had the last reserved spot of the day we needed to leave at the 1 hour mark because they needed time to clean and sanitize everything. So we were asked to leave at 5:30 when we paid until 5:45. It says on the door that they close at 6:00 p.m. The employee locked the door right behind us. I asked her why we were not told when we reserved the spot that it would be a different play time and she said she would have to look but never followed up with us and was instead behind the counter on her cell phone the entire time. She started cleaning with strong smelling chemicals before we were even done with our hour of playtime. This is something that I did not appreciate since I am pregnant.
If these are the rules, that should have been told to us when we reserved our spot, or our playtime should have been credited back or applied to another playtime. Will not be spending our money here again.

reviews:
{Reviewer: Anna&jack Jones
Rating: 5/5
Time: 3 days ago
Review: We had a really fun time.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Tori Scott
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 days ago
Review: This is a hidden gem! I have been wanting to come here with my two children, who have ADHD & different levels of Autism, my son, who is 11, and my daughter, who just turned 6, since they opened. We never had a chance to visit until yesterday (Saturday, June 28, 2025) when we were invited with some friends who are members. My oldest had a blast with the arcade games, the climbing areas, and just being indoors in general in a safe environment to help escape this heat. The facility is card only, which was no issue for us, thankfully. The machine to dispense the game card even took tap to pay, so my son was able to use some Apple Cash he had to load a new game card.

Francine was very helpful when checking in with explaining the waiver, the process since it was our first time, and swatting any of those pesky flies that snuck through the door. They didn't get far because Francine was on it in the lobby, swatting left and right, taking out those summer nuances. Liz with the killer nails (can't wait to see what design she has on our next visit) helped when we needed to check out from the snack bar, which I was very impressed with the selections that are offered. She is very personable and a great asset to the front desk. Kyrsten knew exactly what I needed on this 100 degree day when I ordered a fountain Sundrop because she came in clutch, offering extra ice! I was like, Yessssss please! I was praising the facility already, and they told me where to leave the review, so here I am!

Plum Krazy Play is now a staple in our neurodivergent family! Not only because it is a safe place I can let my children play inside with added sensory play when needed, I can get a fountain Sundrop, AND I can get some adult interactions in.... I say sign me up! We are discussing membership as a family and looking at all the calendar events, including Sensory Wednesday, which is probably going to be the first time I bring my daughter. Can't wait to come again!

As an added bonus, the facility is a Pok√©mon Gym if anyone plays Pok√©mon Go ;)

Reviewer: Jenna Trump
Rating: 5/5
Time: 5 months ago
Review: Always an absolute blast! This play place is mostly geared toward the younger set. Probably under age 10 but it depends on how much your kid enjoys imaginary play. My four and six year olds absolutely adore it. The play areas change around periodically but there‚Äôs usually a vet center, play kitchen/grocery store, a magic spell booth, puppet show, and a few small games (skee ball, fooseball, basketball) in the back plus a foam pit, small ball pit, trampoline, and a variety of ninja foam blocks to jump and a roller slide and mountain to climb. Also the front area has one of those interactive coloring areas that animates your drawing on a big projector screen. Plus some tables full of building toys. There are plenty of places to sit and chat with other parents while staying within range of your kids. I‚Äôm always impressed with how clean they‚Äôre able to keep it and how chill the vibe usually is. At our last visit they added a new room full of airtoobz machines which kept my four year old busy for most of the play session. They also added a ‚Äúsnowball fight‚Äù area where you could pelt each other with tiny fluffy balls. I ended up in there with both my kids and nephew having the best time. It‚Äôs a really great place to go let your kids have a fun without being overstimulated and blasted in the face with screens and lights and ending the day in a meltdown. It gives wholesome playdate vibes and I just adore it. It‚Äôs really what the children‚Äôs museum in Portsmouth wishes it could be. If you‚Äôre a family with a quiet calm child it‚Äôs amazing. If you‚Äôre a family with a wild animal child climbing the walls and trying to parkour off every surface in your home it‚Äôs amazing. Bring em both. They‚Äôre gonna love it.

Reviewer: Alex H
Rating: 1/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: If you‚Äôre curious about having a birthday party here, here are the things you need to know. It‚Äôs lengthy.. sorry üôÉ

Time: We had a birthday party for our son and let me tell you the time frame they give you for the room is NOT worth it. They don‚Äôt serve the pizza until after 30 minutes so you have 45 minutes to get through the pizza, sing hbday, do the cake, & presents, get every body out of the room and get everything packed up and get out of the room yourself. Play time is until they close so that‚Äôs beneficial but you did pay for everyone already so it‚Äôs actually expected.

Food: pizza is from papa John‚Äôs and is very good!

Fees: if you get sick or have an emergency and need to reschedule, they fee you $50. Children get sick all the time so you would think they would be understanding being a kids place but they very much not understanding and do not care at all.
There is also a $75 fee if you go over the party room time for every 5 minutes over. We were all stressing trying to get through everything to be able to get out in time especially since they don‚Äôt let you in early to decorate or set up the food and cake, ect and don‚Äôt serve you immediately either so  you wait 30 minutes before you get the pizzas to eat so you really only have 45 minutes total for everything.

Things included: they say decorations and plates and napkins are included. We received table clothes, a happy birthday sign, and only 10 plates and napkins. The juice boxes are the capri suns and they only give you 10. The reservation is for 10 kids and 15 adults so you‚Äôd think they‚Äôd give you more options or atleast waters for everyone. Good thing there‚Äôs a grocery store near by or the adults will starve and not have anything to drink or eat on because just like us, you will need it to go buy yourself more plates, napkins, cups & drinks.

Viruses/sicknesses: be prepared to get sick if coming. We managed to get the flu the week of our son‚Äôs birthday and had to reschedule. When we reached out to the owners to let them know we were all sick, the options the owners gave us were‚Ä¶
Option 1: keep the date because they said ‚Äúwe‚Äôre going to lose your $300 this weekend if you don‚Äôt show up‚Äù  Yet, they knew we were all sick with the flu‚Ä¶ and still wanted us to come in so they would ‚Äúlose‚Äù out on our money.. I find it very irresponsible of these owners to sit there and say that to a parent.
Option 2: pay additional fees ontop of our $300 we spent for 1 hour rental of a room. Which really is 45 minutes when you actually get to start eating.

As a parent, we obviously rescheduled and ate the cost because we in no way would want to get the other kids sick and we obviously didn‚Äôt feel well ourselves but to know the owners are willing to send people there knowingly with the flu not caring that it will get all the other kids sick is disgusting.  We usually come every month with friends and family but I think this will be our last time knowing now what we do. They‚Äôre so desperate for an extra $50 they lost a lot more from us in the long term.  We know kids get sick and we try to have fun and be safe but now knowing you‚Äôre intentionally letting people come in sick because you allow people to keep their reservations when they tell you they‚Äôre sick instead of simply rescheduling them to keep everyone safe without fees attached is bad business and it‚Äôs gross.

-----------------------

Review: I came here with my 2 year old son on a Friday during winter break. We arrived right when they opened and little did we know that the place would soon be taken over by lots of older kids from the Y. All the commotion from all those kids did overwhelm my son at times, but we still managed to have fun. I appreciated how large their 4 and younger section was and there were 2 slide options. I wish there was staff regulating that area a little more as some of the older kids did attempt to play in the area. With the larger playground, there was a good variety of slides and activities. However, there are some areas that need to be fixed as you could see things were falling apart after lots of wear and tear. There is a section where you can shoot soft balls and my son was scared of that noise and it was going off often. I appreciated that you could bring outside food, but not sure why you cannot bring outside drinks. Overall, it can be a hit or miss on how busy it is so you just take that risk when you go. Also it truly depends on your child if they will like that type of environment.

Rating: 1/5

Review: Today was my sons 4th birthday party, and I will never use safari nation again. I called and asked about my reservation and they confirmed that they had the color green wrote down and that I could only have 10 minutes to decorate with my stuff. I also asked when they ordered their pizzas so I could make sure mine was ready at the same time. They told me they would be ready at 2:15, I got there and they literally made me wait till right at 10 minutes to get in the room (I saw other families that got in while the members were cleaning from prior parties) then i get in the room and they didn‚Äôt have any of the green things out. So the 10 minutes I did have pushed me further back, and had my guest watch me set everything up. I was given the room with no instructions. They didn‚Äôt give me the juice boxes till 20 minutes before my party was over and the pizza got there with 30 minutes left in the room. You only get one hour in the room. I‚Äôm thankful I had juice and pizza for the kids or we would have literally been sitting there till half way when the room time  was over. My child‚Äôs name wasn‚Äôt wrote on the door for my guests to even know where to go. There was signs on the table telling me to tip my party attended but I had no attended the whole time- I was even told that an attendant came with my package- I had no one helping the whole time. When I asked about it, they said I had to request one and that no one would really be in there much anyways. The staff were very rude and acted like we were a bother. When you spend almost 400 dollars, I expect so much more. I have had several parties at other facilities, and will definitely use those. It was embarrassing to me, and even some of the people at the party that are members of safari nation. We will not be back.

Reviewer: Jennifer Little
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: My son is 3 years old and LOVED this indoor play place. The customer service here was great. We are not locals and I was initially confused about which location I had booked for open play. I text the number on the website to confirm the location and the owner immediately called me to direct me to the correct place. My son played for the entire two hours. The swings, climbing walls, and slides were all accessible and appropriate. Shout out to Hunter for ‚Äúracing‚Äù my kid on the slide and making him feel welcomed in the space. This was such a great find during our winter beach vacation as the weather did not permit many outdoor activities. My son was able to get some energy out and had a great nap after a morning filled with fun.

-----------------------

Reviewer: Maria Comfort
Rating: 5/5
Time: 9 months ago
Review: Yesterday was our first visit and our 4yr old son had an incredible time!! I can't say enough good things about the Star Academy! First of all, it was a rainy day for us in Marion and we needed to find something fun for our very energetic toddler. I looked on their website, which is super easy to use and saw they had an Open Play session available from 12-2pm! You have the flexibility of either paying when you book or when you arrive. I appreciate that option very much because sometimes plans change when you have children. We were greeted by the owners, who are absolutely lovely people and were so welcoming! Star Academy is extremely clean and has a very cozy atmosphere. They have so much to offer little ones! I was very impressed with how they maximized the amount of space they have with features like nooks above and below the play areas. My son loved the slides! They offer 2 slides, one that is free standing,  and one twisty slide which is enclosed. The foam block pit was a huge hit!! My son loved jumping in the blocks and building towers with them as well. The owner's 12yr old son, was there and did a phenomenal job with the little ones. He introduced himself and asked them if they would like to build a fort with the foam blocks. He said, the magic word, "fort" and my son was so happy to have someone to play with since he's an only child. It's a wonderful space to play with your kids or step back and let them enjoy playing on their own. When my son woke up this morning, he immediately asked if we could go there to play!! The owners offered to make the adults coffee upon arrival and put some snacks out for the kids to enjoy, which is very thoughtful and kind, although my son was too excited and busy to eat anything! They have books, sensory toys and a closer filled with blocks, play dough and sand. Everything was organized, neat and easily accessible for the little ones to explore and choose something to play with in between sliding, swinging, climbing and jumping! We had an amazing day!! Our son didn't want to leave so we purchased an additional 1 hour session. However, I think we will take advantage of the 3 month deal, unlimited play during open play sessions for $188. It was a wonderful experience and a great family outing. We are now a Star Academy family!!

-----------------------

Reviewer: Lindsay Murphy
Rating: 2/5

Review: I brought my daughter and her friend here today because my oldest daughter was attending a birthday party across the street. From the minute we walked in it was a completely overwhelming experience. The lady running the center immediately barked at us to take our shoes off, was rude about the fact that we hadn‚Äôt paid yet and in between checking us in went on a long diatribe about the center itself. It was honestly too much. Don‚Äôt forget adults can have sensory issues and be overwhelmed as well! I don‚Äôt have a problem taking off my shoes but when you tell me over and over it‚Äôs because you worked so hard to clean the floors all by yourself you made me feel like we were ruining your place. I told you my oldest wasn‚Äôt staying and she said she asked you if she could look around for a few minutes. The minute she started playing with something she barked rudely  again telling me we needed to go ahead and pay for our older kids. I already told her they were on there way out the door. I agree with rules and a place with kids needs to run smoothly but it‚Äôs all in the delivery and how you talk to people I was nervous wreck the whole time. Her ‚Äúassistance‚Äù with the kids was following them around and telling them what to do. We couldn‚Äôt relax we couldn‚Äôt just enjoy for fear the kids were going to mess up her clean room! I gave it a two stars because the girls did have fun, it was clean and a good concept. Just tell the lady running it to calm down . She could learn a thing or two from the sweet lady who ran the butter and whisk party. She was polite, good with the kids, and didn‚Äôt make the adults feel like we were in the way! One last thing if you are going to fuss at everyone to take their shoes off as soon as they come in maybe don‚Äôt have your dog running in and out with dirty paws or your husband come in and not take his shoes off‚Ä¶just saying. My kids and I love dogs but not everyone feels the same. Maybe ask us first if it‚Äôs ok to have your dog running around! Reviewer: Megan Romero
Rating: 5/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: My friend and I visited each with 3 kids 4 and younger. It was great that they have a sibling discount, because with multiples, stuff can add up quickly. We walked in to a clean play space that was covered in toys the kids enjoyed playing with by the end of our 2 hour session. When we were leaving, the worker was cleaning and organizing for the next group to come in and do it all over again. They have a really nice coffee machine which I really appreciated, the coffee was delicious! Tables and a couch for parents and 2 highchairs for the babies. The bathroom and exit doors have a sound bell to prevent kids from escaping. The bathroom is stocked with baby wipes, poop bags, hair ties and even tampons. Our play time was full so there were a decent amount of kids and parents in the building but it didn't feel over crowded and didn't prevent the kids from playing with anything they wanted to play with. The blue "Elsa" dress was a big hit as well as the fireman hose. The only improvement I could suggest is having one more small couch for parents to sit on and I think it would be perfect! This was a fun place for the kids to let out some energy especially with all the rain we have been having lately. Will definitely recommend to other families!

Review: I regularly come here during the week with my almost 2 year old. Today was the first time I came on a Saturday. It. Was. Awful. They take reservations on Saturday and Sunday to keep the crowd at a minimum (or so they say), but this place was a madhouse from the second I stepped in. Because all age groups of children are welcome here, there were teenagers and rambunctious pre-teens everywhere. Some of them were lifting up the panels at the top of the stairs in the playground creating a fall hazard. Others were underneath making barriers where other children couldn't pass. It was also impossible to let my daughter play on the trampoline part because of so many unattended children being wild. It was also difficult to keep up with my daughter because there were so many people standing around. I had told my sister about this place and she was there too with her 7 month old and two older children. I was honestly embarrassed that I had recommended this place. I left quickly because it wasn't worth putting my small child in danger due to overcrowding and unsupervised children. I will continue to come here on weekdays, but if you have any kid under 7 or 8 years of age, do yourself a favor and skip it on the weekends.

Reviewer: Denise Infante
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I love bringing my two and three-year-old to this cafe. It's a place I frequently visit with my husband or other mommies. The atmosphere is very clean, and I always look forward to their delicious vanilla lattes and waffles! The staff behind the counter consistently greet everyone with smiles and work their tails off to serve us. The location is also low sensory which I appreciate as a former special education advocate.

While the location is a bit cramped, I believe this is partly due to families placing their belongings on the tables, which can limit space, especially for those who are dining. It would be wonderful if patrons could utilize the cubbies provided to help create a more enjoyable dining experience for everyone. Additionally, I think it would be beneficial if parents could take a more active role in supervising their children and encouraging them to return items to their proper places. My daughter loves playing in the kitchen area, but it often seems empty. Parents joining their kids on the slide should bear in mind that they move all the balls when they slide down. My son hit his head on the back of the slide because the balls had been removed from a parent sliding down.

I truly believe that creating a welcoming environment is a shared responsibility within our community. If you‚Äôre visiting, it would be wonderful if you could encourage your little one to practice responsibility. I also wish there were opportunities to explore memberships! Otherwise, great location!

Review: I enjoy bringing my 16 month old baby here during the week when it tends to be slow, however we brought her recently when there were more older kids running around. The kids were super rowdy, chasing one another around and pelting each other with balls both inside and outside of the ball pit (I got hit hard in the side of the head). They kept climbing up the slides and the parents were way more interested in socializing amongst each other than actually parenting their kids. An announcement was made regarding the kids' behavior, but unfortunately none of us could understand what was being said over the loudspeaker and nothing was done by employees OR parents when the behavior continued. We didn't feel it was safe for our baby to keep playing so we left after about an hour, which felt like a waste of money, as we usually stay for the full two hours. We love Playland, but it would be so much better if there were designated areas by age group, or at least if the rules of safe play were actually enforced. Also, after a few times of coming, we've never once seen employees disinfecting the play area, and as another reviewer mentioned, the baby changing table in the women's restroom isn't bolted to the counter, so it slides around if you have a squirmy baby. We'll still keep coming here, but I was disappointed by our most recent visit.

Reviewer: Denise Infante
Rating: 5/5

Review: I love bringing my two and three-year-old to this cafe. It's a place I frequently visit with my husband or other mommies. The atmosphere is very clean, and I always look forward to their delicious vanilla lattes and waffles! The staff behind the counter consistently greet everyone with smiles and work their tails off to serve us. The location is also low sensory which I appreciate as a former special education advocate.

While the location is a bit cramped, I believe this is partly due to families placing their belongings on the tables, which can limit space, especially for those who are dining. It would be wonderful if patrons could utilize the cubbies provided to help create a more enjoyable dining experience for everyone. Additionally, I think it would be beneficial if parents could take a more active role in supervising their children and encouraging them to return items to their proper places. My daughter loves playing in the kitchen area, but it often seems empty. Parents joining their kids on the slide should bear in mind that they move all the balls when they slide down. My son hit his head on the back of the slide because the balls had been removed from a parent sliding down.

I truly believe that creating a welcoming environment is a shared responsibility within our community. If you‚Äôre visiting, it would be wonderful if you could encourage your little one to practice responsibility. I also wish there were opportunities to explore memberships! Otherwise, great location!

Reviewer: Sara G

Review: I enjoy bringing my 16 month old baby here during the week when it tends to be slow, however we brought her recently when there were more older kids running around. The kids were super rowdy, chasing one another around and pelting each other with balls both inside and outside of the ball pit (I got hit hard in the side of the head). They kept climbing up the slides and the parents were way more interested in socializing amongst each other than actually parenting their kids. An announcement was made regarding the kids' behavior, but unfortunately none of us could understand what was being said over the loudspeaker and nothing was done by employees OR parents when the behavior continued. We didn't feel it was safe for our baby to keep playing so we left after about an hour, which felt like a waste of money, as we usually stay for the full two hours. We love Playland, but it would be so much better if there were designated areas by age group, or at least if the rules of safe play were actually enforced. Also, after a few times of coming, we've never once seen employees disinfecting the play area, and as another reviewer mentioned, the baby changing table in the women's restroom isn't bolted to the counter, so it slides around if you have a squirmy baby. We'll still keep coming here, but I was disappointed by our most recent visit.

Not only is it super cute, but it is very clean, the employees are constantly walking around wiping things down and cleaning up all while being extremely kind and friendly to all of the young kids.  We have been twice and the kids didn't want to leave.

The coffee is great, and not too expensive, and the kids got one of the birthday cake waffles, which was huge and a perfect special treat for them to share.

This place caters to younger kids, so it is nice to not have to constantly be worried that my little ones are going to be trampled, we will definitely be back!

Reviewer: Lavender Smith
Rating: 5/5
Time: a month ago
Review: I don't give reviews but I visited Playcious a while ago and it has slowly become a favourite spot for me and my daughter! We live close yet we've never been here, but one of my friends who is a regular said it was ‚Äúbetter than SkyZone,‚Äù so we gave it a try and are now slowly also becoming regulars!

The kids had a lot of fun with the 2 HR Value pass, and even us adults managed to have fun too, especially with the car racing and arcade games! I also like how the little kids have their own trampoline area, especially with staff keeping it that way, which was not easy on the Saturday with all the rush. The place is also CLEAN! As a clean freak i was impressed with how maintained everything was, especially the washrooms, there was no bad smell which is NOT a usual at like most places.

The main reason for this review is a staff member, I asked but forgot her name (i just remember its start with K and hijab) but, what happened was that my daughter was getting scared on the wall climbing and kept wanting to come down, yet also wanting to go up as it was like her first time.Now usually most get annoyed and just let the kid leave, but she didnt do that. I guess she noticed that my daughter really wanted to do it(I also was insisting that she do it) except was scared, so instead of like "getting over with it" she kept encouraging my daughter by telling her how she was so brave and just being very understanding. As a parent, I appreciated it a lot as she was patient, like not frustrated or in a hurry and just genuinely helped my daughter have fun! I really do recommend this place to other parents!

SOCKS ONLY establishment.

Other then that its a well kept area

Reviewer: Greg S
Rating: 5/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Without hesitation I'd recommend the FUNtastic Forest to anyone looking for safe and incredibly fun entertainment for their children.  My review is based on hosting my son's last two birthday parties here at ages 2 and 3.  Some of the highlights I can share are:

- The staff are friendly, helpful, and professional.  The owner Vern is a great guy.  He was very accommodating and easy to deal with in the planning of our parties.
- The entire facility is well maintained and is very clean throughout from the playgrounds to the washrooms.
- The amenities for the kids are so good! My kids and their friends loved the toddler area as well as the big slide! There are multiple playgrounds with a main corridor that is spacious.
- There's a nice coffee bar for parents/adults, plenty of seating in the front area, and comfortable massage chairs.
- The party rooms are very nice and have tables, countertops, and seating.
- Lots of parking out front and easy to find location.
- Indoor air quality and temperature were perfect.
- Safety and security measures were nice to see such as the staff controlling who enters and maintaining a list of people in the facility.
- Pricing is very affordable and fair.

No negatives at all.  We'll definitely book here again!  Thanks so  much!

Reviewer: Denise Infante
Rating: 5/5
Time: 4 months ago
Review: I love bringing my two and three-year-old to this cafe. It's a place I frequently visit with my husband or other mommies. The atmosphere is very clean, and I always look forward to their delicious vanilla lattes and waffles! The staff behind the counter consistently greet everyone with smiles and work their tails off to serve us. The location is also low sensory which I appreciate as a former special education advocate.

While the location is a bit cramped, I believe this is partly due to families placing their belongings on the tables, which can limit space, especially for those who are dining. It would be wonderful if patrons could utilize the cubbies provided to help create a more enjoyable dining experience for everyone. Additionally, I think it would be beneficial if parents could take a more active role in supervising their children and encouraging them to return items to their proper places. My daughter loves playing in the kitchen area, but it often seems empty. Parents joining their kids on the slide should bear in mind that they move all the balls when they slide down. My son hit his head on the back of the slide because the balls had been removed from a parent sliding down.

I truly believe that creating a welcoming environment is a shared responsibility within our community. If you‚Äôre visiting, it would be wonderful if you could encourage your little one to practice responsibility. I also wish there were opportunities to explore memberships! Otherwise, great location!

Playland is hands down the best indoor playground and caf√© we‚Äôve ever visited! From the moment we walked in, we were blown away by the clean, modern, and thoughtfully designed space. Reviewer: Sara G
Rating: 3/5
Time: 10 months ago
Review: I enjoy bringing my 16 month old baby here during the week when it tends to be slow, however we brought her recently when there were more older kids running around. The kids were super rowdy, chasing one another around and pelting each other with balls both inside and outside of the ball pit (I got hit hard in the side of the head). They kept climbing up the slides and the parents were way more interested in socializing amongst each other than actually parenting their kids. An announcement was made regarding the kids' behavior, but unfortunately none of us could understand what was being said over the loudspeaker and nothing was done by employees OR parents when the behavior continued. We didn't feel it was safe for our baby to keep playing so we left after about an hour, which felt like a waste of money, as we usually stay for the full two hours. We love Playland, but it would be so much better if there were designated areas by age group, or at least if the rules of safe play were actually enforced. Also, after a few times of coming, we've never once seen employees disinfecting the play area, and as another reviewer mentioned, the baby changing table in the women's restroom isn't bolted to the counter, so it slides around if you have a squirmy baby. We'll still keep coming here, but I was disappointed by our most recent visit.

Review: This is a cute idea for a kids play place, pretty well executed. I thought the incorporation of things like jumbo building blocks and toy vehicles into the ‚Äúmake believe you‚Äôre in a tiny town‚Äù theme was a nice touch, and it meant that my two-year old, who isn‚Äôt much interested in imaginative play yet, could still have a great time. I also appreciated the infant area.

My major complaint is that the ‚Äúno-outside-food‚Äù policy is unnecessary and makes me unlikely to come here frequently. There‚Äôs a well-defined area for eating, and there‚Äôs no reason a family couldn‚Äôt enjoy a packed lunch there, so I assume the idea is to force me to spend more money at their cafe. But when I saw that the cafe was basically only offering fast food and empty calorie snacks I became pretty unexcited about that option. Small children are notoriously picky eaters as well as frequent snackers. So, when a business specifically aimed at children intentionally frustrates our eating routines just to shake another $5 out of me for a greasy slice of pizza, it‚Äôs a huge turn-off.

Reviewer: Jason L

Review: Went due to postive reviews. Only one staff member at the front that also runs the limited food stop, e.g. microwaved pizza. Most of the parents don't watch their kids. The kids don't clean up after themselves and are grabbing stuff from other kids or just throwing toys around, so toys are in different rooms. My kiddo likes organization so we ended up tidying up after the other kids. A fair amount of broken stuff, e.g. baby strollers and cars, and for how long they've been in business, I don't think most of the stuff was purchased new as there is significant wear and tear.

Some of the kids stuff is on the low end, e.g. the cheaper kids kitchens. Kids aren't washing their hands after using the bathroom but that's not on the facility. There is signage to use hand sanitizer but the wall mounted one isn't just finished, it has nothing inside. There was also a coughing kid that was touching everything. Surprised they didn't tell them to come back when they're not sick.

Overall, we just made sure we all washed our hands after.

We also kept the coffee bar open for our guests which seemed to be a hit! All in all, it was a perfect venue for our son‚Äôs first birthday celebration. The space accommodated our 75 guests of all ages comfortably and everyone had a great time. It is a wonderful space to host a child‚Äôs birthday party of this grandeur.

Review: Cute little play place that we attended for a birthday party. It was great for kids of all ages. There are different rooms with activities and costumes, a road with vehicles to drive, and a construction area. Each room represents a different building in the town (restaurant, salon, grocery store, etc). There is also an infant area with toys and activities for babies under 1 to play with. Just beside the play rooms there are tables and chairs for parents to sit at while their kids play. The bathrooms were big and clean. Diaper changing stations for baby, potty seats and a step stool at the sink are available and so convenient. No strollers are allowed in the play area, we left ours in the coat room. Everyone must wear socks (adults too). We attended for a private event, but there is also a drop-in play option. For drop ins there is a snack bar where snacks and refreshments can be purchased. There are 3 party rooms available. Parking is free outside the building and everything is on the main level. I will definitely be back with my kids .

Reviewer: Julia
Rating: 4/5
Time: a year ago
Review: Held my 2 year olds party here and it was pretty stress free and easy
-Staff came to check up on us a few times, helped us to set up the tv to match our party theme
-they also cleaned up the room so we didn't have to
-spacious washrooms
-amazing detail to each store / room, but I would say some toys were pretty worn
-spacious party rooms and play areas, even though it was a little busy we still had room to play
-discounted open bar coffee since we had a party booked
And more good things
The ONLY reason I have to dock a star is because the security. There is no gate or any sense of security, so anyone could pick up a child and walk out with them. There should be a gate, or wristband system, or security who will make sure every child who walks out is walking out with the right people. Of course parents should always watch their kids, but there should definitely be another layer of protection since there's lots of small children. Other than that great experience :)
